loans.name: Rabiaa

texts.en:
Rabiaa is a Lebanese married woman. She’s 52 years old and the mother of four children, two of them are still attending school.

She is a housewife, focusing on her family and kids and her husband works in the construction field to provide his children with the bare minimum needs of life.

Rabiaa, at this time, is in a real need of a little help from Kiva. For that reason, she is requesting for a loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s educational fees for the coming year.

She said that she is happy that she will be able to ensure them a suitable education.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees.

loans.name: Homero

texts.es:
Homero con 37 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia de material rústico, junto a su cónyuge y sus hijos, en el distrito de Pomahuaca,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro de 15 años. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cuál no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.

Homero es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Firma con su cónyuge.
texts.en:
Homero is 37 years old and is in a common-law marriage. He lives in his own house of rustic material, along with his spouse and his children, in the district of Pomahuaca, province of Jaen, department of Cajamarca, country of Peru. He has very good references, as many personal references as work references on the part of the inhabitants of the area. The inhabitants of this town mostly work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock.

He works in agriculture, specifically in the cultivation of coffee, with 15 years of experience in the industry. He will use the loan that he receives for farming, application and use of pesticides, fertilizers, and labor for his harvest. In this way, it will help him improve the function, appearance, and production of his crop, and he will also have an opportune harvest. Therefore, he will have better production, a better quality of product, because of which he will not have issues selling his product.

Homero is a recurring member of Edpyme Alternativa. He signed up with his wife.

loans.use: to farm and to apply and use pesticides, fertilizers, and labor for his harvest.

loans.name: Barbarita

texts.es:
Barbarita con 60 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y su nieta, en el distrito de Colasay,provincia de jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 10 años. Solicita préstamo para la compra de abonos e invertir en el mantenimiento de su finca. De esta manera mejorar los rendimientos de las campañas anteriores.

Barbarita es socia nueva para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Barbarita is 60 years old and is in a common-law relationship. She lives together with her spouse and her granddaughter in the district of Colasay, Jaén province, in the department of Cajamarca, Peru. She has very good personal and work references from the residents of the area. The inhabitants of this place work mainly in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

She works in agriculture specifically growing coffee with 10 years experience in the field. She is requesting a loan to buy manure and invest in the maintenance of her farm. In this way she will improve her yields from the previous seasons.

Barbarita is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy manure and invest in the maintenance of her farm.

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.en: Suhrob is a student of the 4th course. He studies economy and finance at the National University of Tajikistan. He is a smart and hardworking man. Suhrob studies hard and learns well all his subjects. Suhrob dreams of working in any field after graduating university. He is asking for a loan of 4,000 TJS to pay university tuition, and KIVA lenders are the only ones who can help him. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es:
La señora Rosibel vive en una comunidad de  Danli al oriente de Honduras, se dedica al comercio y cuenta con una pulpería en la cual vende productos de la canasta básica, tiene una amplia clientela ya que su negocio está ubicado en una de las carreteras principales por donde transitan una gran cantidad de personas.
Doña Rosibel cuenta con 2 años de experiencia en el manejo de su negocio y se le venta muy temprano a realizar la apertura diaria de su negocio, solicita préstamo para la compra de arroz, café, azúcar, manteca, huevos, salsas, embutidos, lácteos, pollo, carne de res, etc. ya que en esta temporada navideña sus ventas son mayores, de igual manera la demanda del producto.
Doña Rosibel desea ampliar su negocio e implementar nuevos productos del área agropecuaria esta idea la quiere aplicar debido a que en su mayoría los clientes son de la zona rural y le han sugerido que lo implemente.
Uno de sus sueños es poder salir adelante con su negocio.

Danli, Honduras  - Octubre del 2015
texts.en:
Señora Rosibel lives in a community of Danli in the eastern part of Honduras. She works in commerce and has a grocery store where she sells products for the basic family food basket. She has an extensive clientele, since her business is located on one of the principal highways where a large number of people pass by.

Doña Rosibel has two years of experience managing her business, and she gets up very early every day to open it. She is applying for a loan to purchase rice, coffee, sugar, lard, eggs, sauces, cold cuts, dairy products, chicken, beef, etc., since in this Christmas season her sales are greater, like the demand for her products.

Doña Rosibel wants to expand her business and include new products from the agricultural area. She wants to employ this idea since the majority of her customers are from the rural zone and they have suggested that she implement it.

One of her dreams is to be abel to continue forward with her business.

Danli, Honduras - October 2015

loans.use: to buy rice, coffee, sugar, lard, eggs, sauces, cold cuts, dairy products, chicken, beef, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said, who is in his early 50's is married with five school aged children. He has been running two projects, selling charcoal and running a retail shop since 2003. He works from 7.30 am to 09 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be SAID's 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase on the shop stock and started the charcoal business. He has managed to pay all his loans successful. He is doing fine with his loan. He used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan, reinvest in business and covered household expenses.

He will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal and to increase on the retail shop with sugar, salt, maize and baking flour, cooking oil, washing soaps etc. He dreams of expanding his projects.

Said will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and to increase on the retail shop inventory.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella has not finished school when she was younger. Because of this, she has limited choices when it comes to livelihood.  On the other hand, she is a hard working woman and is engaged in growing spring onions and raising hogs. 
Since these businesses means months of waiting, Estrella is asking a loan to buy seedlings and feed for her hogs.  Estrella has high hopes that things will be better. Her priority at the moment is the education of her 11-year-old daughter so her child can have a life that is quite different from hers in the future. Estrella is from Garcia Hernandez, Bohol.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and feed

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
She is Ester from Polomolok, South Cotabato. She owns this tricycle which she rents out to her neighbors for income. Rental payments sustain her and her husband’s everyday needs. Once her tricycle breaks down due to mechanical problems, it will surely affect their daily sustenance. Ester wants to avoid that crisis so she prepares early by requesting a loan worth PHP 23,000. She plans to buy necessary spare parts and troubleshooting equipment as early as now. Part of the loan will be spent for the renewal of its franchise so she can continue operating without hassle. Praying that you could extend your generosity to her. She would surely be very grateful.

Ester meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God. *All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy necessary spare parts and troubleshooting equipment for her tricycle; to pay for the renewal of its franchise

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Thirty-year-old Maribeth is a resident of Valencia, Bohol. She is married and has two children. The oldest child is nine, while the youngest is three. Maribeth is a risk-taker who is engaged in a fishing business. She also sells fashionable clothes known as RTW or ready-to-wear clothing in her community. A barn is also kept near her house for the pigs that she is raising.

Maribeth is asking for a loan to buy a new set of fishing nets and piglets. With this, Maribeth would improve her catch and increase her earnings. She hopes that with additional capital, she can continue making a better profit out of her business and continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a new set of fishing nets and piglets.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en: Peace used the previous loan to buy beers, waragi and sodas to sell. She is still operating the same business of distilling waragi plus growing bananas on a large scale. Peace started these businesses way back in 2007 and had a vision of raising more income to educate her children. She is faced with challenges of limited capital plus high license fees that on her expected profits hence little progress in relation to business growth. Peace has asked for another loan facility to  buy beers, waragi and sodas for her bar business to sell.

loans.use: to buy beers, waragi and sodas for her bar business to sell.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo se encuentra realizando la siembra de maíz y necesita de más capital para comprar semilla mejorada de maíz, abono, insecticidas y herbicidas, así como también pagara los costos de preparación del terreno, con esta nueva inversión busca obtener una buena producción maíz y mejores ganancias.
Al utilizar créditos en su negocio él ha aumentado la productividad y las circunstancias económicas son bastante favorables comparándolas con las que tenía antes de hacer uso de créditos, su familia se mantiene y le brinda apoyo para continuar luchando para salir adelante todos juntos.
texts.en:
Ricardo is sowing corn and needs more capital to buy improved corn seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides. He will also cover the cost of preparing the land. With this new investment, he wants to have a better production and improve his profits.

Using loans for his business has helped him to improve his productivity. His financial situation is quite favorable compared with how it was before applying for a loan. His family is stable and supports him to continue fighting to get ahead with them.

loans.use: to buy improved corn seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides, and cover the cost of preparing the land.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Noma de 46 años de edad, vive al lado de su hija de 9 años y su hijo mayor de edad. Norma es madre soltera y lucha por mantener la economía del hogar y para que a su familia no le falte nada, para ello cuenta con un negocio de venta de comida típica, vende pupusas y tamales de gallina. Este negocio lo ha administrado desde hace 20 años, lo que le permite contar con un número bastante grande de clientes que la prefieren. Además vende sandalias aprovechando la clientela que posee. En vista que la demanda para sus productos ha aumentado solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: materia prima para la elaboración de sus platillos y más sandalias para sus ventas. De esta forma aumentar las ganancias y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Noma is 46 years old, she lives together with her 9 years old daughter and her adult son. Norma is a single mother and she fights to maintain the household economy so that her family lacks nothing. For that reason, she has a business selling traditional meals, she sells stuffed corn tortillas and chicken tamales.

She has managed this business for 20 years, which has allowed her to have a large amount of customers that prefer her. Moreover, she sells sandals taking advantage of the customer base she has.

Given that the demand for her products has increased, she is requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest in ingredients to prepare her dishes and more sandals for her sales. In this way she will increase her earnings and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in ingredients to prepare her dishes and more sandals to sell.

loans.name: Wakorintho Group

texts.en:
Zuhura who is in her mid 20's, is single with no child. She has been running several projects, selling fried cassava, selling fabrics door to door and sells powdered soap since 2013. She works from 6 am to 7 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to increase on the powdered soap stock, to buy and fry cassava and to increase on fabrics which she sells door to door. She dreams eventually of taking her children to good schools.

She will share this loan with her loan group WAKORINTHO which has three members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on her powdered soap stock, to buy and fry cassava and to increase on fabrics

loans.name: Cristine

texts.en: Cristine is a young woman of 19. She has a baby who is only two months old. Cristine helps her husband who is a carpenter to earn a living. She raise hogs, makes barbecue in the evening and sells cooked dishes. She needs additional capital to buy two piglets, one sack of feed, vegetables, cooking oil and seasoning. She hopes to make her business successful so that she can be better prepared for the education of her child someday.

loans.use: to  buy two piglets, one sack of feed, vegetables, cooking oil and seasoning

loans.name: Dúo Marianita 2 Group

texts.es: Dúo Marianita 2 Doña Mirna Lorena es la de blusa a cuadros ella es dueña de una librería ella es madre soltera tiene 2 hijos de 22 y 16 años de los cuales estudian ella necesita su crédito para poder invertir en su producto escolar ya que tiene listas de utiles escolares encargardas y no cuenta con el material necesario sus clientes son vecinos, amigos, familiares,  ella trabaja su proyecto sola sus metas son: mejorar la  calidad de vida, alimentar  la producción, ofrecer variedad de productos, fortalecer el negocio, pagar gastos de la casa. Poder darle estudio a su hijo menor incrementar y surtir la librería. Es el primer crédito que solicita a fape y agradece por por la ayuda brindada de fape y kiva.
texts.en:
Dúo Marianita 2. Doña Mirna Lorena is the one in the checked blouse. She owns a bookstore. She is the single Mom of two children aged 22 and 16 who are students. She needs a loan to invest in school supplies because she has lists of school supplies ordered but she doesn't have the product in stock. Her customers are neighbors, friends and acquaintances.
She works her business by herself. Her goals are: to better her quality of life, alimentar la produccion, offer a variety of products, strengthen her business and pay the household bills, as well as help her youngest son study and grow and supply the bookstore.
The is the first loan she has requested and she is grateful to FAPE and to Kive for the help they have offered.

loans.use: to buy school supplies merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
After being married and having a family, Vicenta learn to adapt to her place in Duero where she lives now with her family. At the moment, she is already a widow. Three years ago, she started investing in a buy-and-sell business of root crops like taro, fruits and flowers. Her income provides her with what she needs for her three children aged 14, 16 and 18.

Vicenta would like to expand her business so she can give her family the financial security that they need. She is asking for a loan to buy more crops such as taro, bananas and anthurium flowers so she can sell more and thus earn better. She hope to expand her business, which will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to buy more crops such as taro, bananas and anthurium flowers.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a wife and a mother to four school-aged children. She and her family live in Valencia, Bohol. To provide for them, she raise hogs and cooks dishes to sell in the neighborhood. Sometimes Evangeline can’t cook anymore because she lacks ingredients for her food business since she also gives her children a school allowance.

She is asking for a loan to buy more spices, vegetables and feed for her hogs. She is hoping that with the help of the loan she can cook more food to sell, fatten her hogs and earn a better income for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy spices, vegetables and feed for her hogs

loans.name: Yesenia Esmeralda

texts.es:
Yesenia vive con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos en casa propia, tiene 13 años de residir en su domicilio actual, ella se dedica a vender bebidas frías y golosinas, su negocio lo ubica bajo una ramada, en ocasiones también ofrece tortillas, ella aprendió el oficio de su madre, atiende a sus clientes de nueve de la mañana a cinco de la tarde.
Con el financiamiento comprara jugos, agua, gaseosas y maíz al por mayor, diversificara su inventario y tendrá materia prima para la venta de tortillas, tendrá mercadería suficiente para vender y  a un bajo precio, permitiéndole generar más ganancias con las que podrá cancelar las cuotas del crédito.
El objetivo de Yesenia es administrar bien el crédito y las ganancias para cumplir con sus obligaciones y lo más principal es darle a su familia un estilo de vida digno.
texts.en:
Yesenia lives with her life partner and their three children in her own house. She has lived in her current home for 13 years. She works selling cold drinks and candies. Her business is located under a shelter made of branches. Occasionally she also offers tortillas. She learned this trade from her mother, and she attends to her customers from nine in the morning until five in the evening.

With this funding, Yesinia would buy wholesale juices, water, sodas and corn, diversify her inventory, and she would have more raw material for the sale of tortillas. She would also have sufficient merchandise to sell at a low price, allowing her to generate more earnings with which she will be able to settle her credit payments.

Yesenia’s objective is to successfully administer her credit and earnings in order to complete her obligations and most importantly give her family a dignified standard of living.

loans.use: to buy wholesale juices, water, sodas and corn, in order to diversify her inventory and have raw materials for the sale of tortillas and enough merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Wendy Sarai

texts.es:
Wendy es una joven trabajadora de 22 años de edad, ella  creció con su abuela quien se dedicaba a  realizar los oficios domésticos, la joven es muy honesta y respetuosa  y su abuela fue la encargada de inculcar principios en ella, actualmente está acompañada y no tiene hijos.


La joven  se creció trabajando en el campo, desde que era una niña ayudaba en las tareas agrícolas y ayudaba a realizar trabajos domésticos de su casa, también se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos a personas que lo solicitan, ella cuida bebés y por lo cual recibe ingresos económicos para cubrir sus gastos.


El crédito será utilizado para comprar fertilizantes y herbicidas para preparar la tierra.

Sus metas para un futuro son haber cancelado el crédito y procrear hijos cuando se sienta preparada.
texts.en:
Wendy is a young working woman. She is 22 years old and grew up with her grandmother, who worked as a housekeeper. She is an honest and respectful young woman, and her grandmother was in charge of instilling in her good principles. She is now married and does not have any children.

She grew up working in the countryside. She has been helping with the agricultural activities and taking care of the household chores since she was a girl. She also works as a housekeeper for people that hire her. She works also as a babysitter, so she can cover her expenses with what she earns.

She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and herbicides to prepare the land.

Her goals for the future are to pay off the loan, and have children when she feels that she is ready.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides to prepare the land.

loans.name: Alma Delia

texts.en:
Alma is a 35-year-old woman; she is married to a loving husband and with him she is raising 3 young kids. They live at her mother's house in order to take care of her and because Alma doesn't want her mother to live on her own.

Alma makes a living by working as a promoter for an electronic store in the city; she also owns a convenience store near her house. She started the store awhile ago, and she thinks that is a good way to create an extra income.

This store is managed by her children and mother during the week, and in the weekend Alma takes care of it. Since Alma is starting her business, she is looking for a 26,000.00 MXN loan that will allow her to create a bigger stock and to offer a vast variety of products.

Alma dedicates her life and work to her children, her biggest dream is to see them move ahead with their lives; she also wants to create a business that provides for her family in the future.

loans.use: to restock her store

loans.name: Twitezimbere Kamushenyi Group

texts.en:
Fabien is 60 years old and married, and they have three children who are between 13 and 17 years of age. He is well-known in his business, which he has been doing for about three years. Fabien is the president of the Twitezimbere Kamushenyi Group, which means, in both the local language and English, "to have a bright future". He is the one who has his hand raised.

Fabien's hours of selling local drinks is from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. every day. He wants to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase a large quantity of sorghum to make the local drink to sell.

With the profit from this loan, Fabien will be able to purchase enough food for the family, buy new clothes for the children, pay school fees for his children and buy medical insurance for his family. He said that in five years he will be able to renovate his house and to buy some animals.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of sorghum to make a local drink to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, desde hace 7 años se dedica al cultivo de yuca y la comercializa en los pueblos aledaños con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con esposa y su hijo, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The young man's face is pixelated because he is 25 years old and lives in a high risk area. For seven years, he has worked growing yucca that he sells in neighboring towns. With his earnings, he is able to cover some of his household expenses. The young man lives in his own house with his wife and son. He is seeking a loan to purchase fertilizers, manure, pesticides, etc. in order to continue with his work and improve his earnings.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers, manure, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Dayci Edelmira

texts.es: Dayci es una mujer trabajadora de 42 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de tamales y prendas de vestir, actividad que le permite sacar adelante a su familia. Ella es madre soltera y vive con sus dos hijos de 15 y 10 años de edad en vivienda propia desde hace 8 años. Dayci desea reparar el techo de su vivienda, ya que este como se observa en la fotografía este se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, lámina, clavos y alambre para reparar el techo de su vivienda y proteger a sus hijos de la lluvia.
texts.en: Dayci is a hard-working 42-year-old woman who sells tamales and clothing garments for a living.  This work allows her to advance her family’s condition.  She is a single mother and lives with her two children, who are 15 and 10 years old, in her own house for the last 8 years.  Dayci wants to repair the roof of her house, since, as can be seen in the photo, has deteriorated.  For this, she is requesting  loan from FUSAI to buy: cement, sheet metal, nails and wire to repair the roof of her house and protect her children from the rain.

loans.use: to buy: cement, sheet metal, nails and wire to repair the roof of her house and protect her children from the rain.

loans.name: Angel

texts.en: Angel is  22 years old and has two children aged three and a new-born baby who is only one month old. Her husband is a farmer who does not earn much and with this she continue her livelihood of a Sari-sari store business and raising hogs. Angel is asking a loan to buy canned goods, soft drinks and feed. This way Angel can continue working at home even while taking care of her kids. She hope to make business improvements to increase profitability for the sake of her beloved family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks and feed

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel con 64 años de edad,vive en casa propia, junto a su esposa, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como borregos y cerdos, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 16 años. Solicita préstamo para la compra de alimento para sus animales y ampliar sus corrales. de esta manera hacer crecer más su negocio, obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

Daniel es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha manejado 07 créditos, el último fué de S/.4,200.00 el cuál lo canceló puntualmente.
texts.en:
Daniel, age 64, lives in his own home with his wife in the Cayaltí district of the Chiclayo province, part of the department of Lambayeque in Peru. He has excellent references from both friends and coworkers in the area. Most people in the region are farmers, cattle ranchers, or business owners.

He is in the business of raising and selling animals such as lambs and pigs, and he has sixteen years of experience at this work. He is requesting this loan so that he can buy feed for his animals and expand their pens. This way, he hopes to expand his business, earn more money, and improve his quality of life.

Daniel is a recurring member at Edpyme Alternativa. He has had seven loans; the most recent was for S/.4,200.00, and he paid it off on time.

loans.use: to build animal enclosures for keeping pigs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth sends you her sincere thanks for your generosity, because her previous loan of PHP 38,000 greatly enriched her business. She was able to purchase more ingredients for her chorizo and embotido making and added supplies for her variety store. The loan also helped her provide for her family's daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she can improve her business even more, if you will help her borrow PHP 45,000. This new loan will be used to buy additional grocery items, sacks of charcoal, plus fruits and vegetables. She is also planning to buy one videoke machine to encourage more customers. This improvement in her business will help sustain the educational needs of her children.

Elizabeth is consistent in meeting with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items, sacks of charcoal, plus fruits and vegetables and to procure a videoke machine.

loans.name: Sarlyn

texts.en:
Sarlyn is a 41-year-old resident of Quezon City, Philippines and a member of Center of Community Transformation (CCT). She is involved currently in a Direct Selling business, where she has sold personal products to her friends and neighbors like ready-to-wear-clothes, bags and cosmetics for more than 10 years. Php 15, 000 is her approximate monthly income.

Since there’s always a change on market price, Sarlyn dreams of having her business expanded where she can have complete products to offer to clients. This will result in increase of the business' revenue. Basically a customer will wait for a week or two to have the product/s they ordered; however if there’s an availability of the product, there’s no need for them to wait for weeks which will improve customers’ experience and will result in customer’s loyalty. With this, Sarlyn applied for a Php 50,000 loan and prays that CCT would approve the amount.

On a weekly basis, Sarlyn regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy stocks of personal products for her buy and sell business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is able to earn an approximate amount of Php 16,000 every month. She wants to thank all of the people who’ve been part of the previous loan approval. The amount was used to buy stocks of eco bags for her buy and sell business. This would not be also possible without the help of all the lenders. Sincerest appreciations she wants to extend.

She aims for continuous business operation. She thinks of different marketing strategies to increase the business' revenue. That’s why she takes advantage every time Center for Community Transformation (CCT) conducts business seminars to broaden her knowledge on the business. To have savings for future needs and invest for her own stall in the future are her dreams.

Elena applied for a loan amount of Php 10,000 that will be used for buying more stocks of eco bags with different sizes and designs. She’s determined to succeed on the business to provide income and support for her family.

Elena regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of eco bags to sell

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela is 32 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Shiela works very hard to provide for them.

Shiela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Shiela has been in this business for 1 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Shiela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a widowed woman, 61 years old with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Elvira has a fishing business in the Philippines. Elvira requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase materials like fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her business.

Elvira has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials like fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her business

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel es una persona que tiene un negocio de venta de productos de la canasta básica y también elabora hamacas, su núcleo familiar está compuesto por su esposa e hija, ambas son dependientes de los ingresos que él genera con su negocio, se ha dicado a estas actividades toda su vida, trabaja todos los días sin un horario fijo.
Él está solicitando un crédito en Pedecomsm para fortalecer ambas actividades económicas, comprara granos básicos, harina, detergentes, verduras, dulces, entre otro tipo de mercadería para atender mejor las demandas de sus clientes, también podrá invertir en hilo de colores para seguir fabricando hamacas, espera estar preparado para la temporada de buenas ventas en fin de año.
Su objetivo es seguir mejorando su negocio y conquistar nuevos mercados con los productos de jarcia
texts.en:
Manuel is a person who has a business selling products for the basic family food basket, and he also makes hammocks. His household is composed of his wife and daughter, both dependent on the income that he generates with his business. He was worked in these businesses all his life. He works every day without a fixed schedule.

He is applying for a loan with PADECOMSM to strengthen both his businesses. He will buy basic grains, flour, detergents, vegetables, and sweets, among other types of merchandise to better serve the demands of his customers. He will also invest in colored thread to continue making hammocks. He hopes to be prepared for the season of good sales at the end of the year.

His goal is to continue improving his business and conquer new markets with his rope products.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, flour, detergents, vegetables, and sweets, among other types of merchandise, to better serve the demands of his customers.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick Lives in Hoima Uganda.He is aged 25 married man charged with the responsibility of taking care of 2 children and both attend school. He operates a retail shop mainly buying and selling of general merchandise, sugar, soap, bread among other items.

In order to supplement his incomes he rides a motorcycle for transport. He hopes to grow and expand his business the more. He will use the loan facility to buy more stock items like salt, sugar and soap for sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock items like salt, sugar and soap for sell.

loans.name: Bundibugyo Junior School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Jeremiah. He is the Head Teacher of Bundibugyo Junior School, a mixed school in the rural area of Bundibugyo with 600 students. Bundibugyo Junior School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Bundibugyo Junior School will repay its loan from its school fees, which are collected each term. Jeremiah ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from waterborne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose Alfredo and his wife met each other at the park, it was love at first sight. Since that moment they decided to form a family. This is why he and his wife Marcelina, love to visit together the small park of their community, when they are not working hard, working their land.

They are parents of 4 children; one of them is already married and doesn´t live with them anymore; the youngest one is not in the picture because he was studying at the moment it was taken, he studies primary.

They live with their remaining 3 children in the same room, sleeping in two beds, with a lot of blankets, because the cold pierces the walls made of thin wood.

Their biggest wish is to have a suitable house where the rain water doesn´t enter through the rooftop wetting everything; a house where the toilet is near and clean; a place where each of them can sleep in a bed and not be afraid that a hailstorm destroys their rooftop.

loans.use: to give his family a proper house

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria got married five years ago, and she is the mother of a little 3-year-old boy. She lives with her husband in her mother in law's house. Now that they are parents, they have a dream to give their little boy the best opportunities, which includes a house in which he can grow in a healthy environment and where he can study more than them. Maria's husband went to primary school, and she finished high school.

Maria's husband is a bricklayer, and he moves from place to place searching for work to support his family. Maria sells candies and flowers to help pay the bills at home. They dream of having their own house, where they can stay warm and comfortable, and grow their family. Their biggest wish is to continue helping other members of their community to make their wishes of living in suitable homes come true.

loans.use: to give her little son a house where he can have the opportunities she didn't have.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, ella está estudiando la carrera de psicología, y por medio de su profesión quiere abrirse camino para poder ser mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Ella comenta que está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder ser una profesional útil a la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Elizabeth is from the city of Coronel Oviedo. She is study psychology and wants to use her profession to create a better life for herself. She states that she is making a great effort to be a useful part of society. She is seeking a loan to pay her college tuition so that she can continue with her education.

loans.use: pay college tuition.

loans.name: Las Marias Group

texts.en:
Patulul is located in the coastal area of Western Guatemala, where heat and humidity permeates everything. The weather is ideal for large industrial farms of coffee, fruit, and other products essential to the international economy.

Here are eight businesswomen who are managing microenterprises. On average, they are 30 years of age, and they formed the “Las Marías” trust bank to support one another in their endeavors. Their businesses include selling firewood, tortillas, cheese, bread, and corn that they harvest, as well as running convenient stores and doing animal husbandry.

Patricia is 25 years old and has a third-grade education. She has three children, who are nine, five and three years old. She cares for them on her own, providing education and quality of life with determination, since she is separated from her husband. She is thankful to be part of Las Marías, where she is president. Patricia sells cheese and bread throughout Guatemala, and she plans to use her microloan to re-stock her products, buying quality cheese and breads to distribute to her customers.

The majority of the women in the Las Marias trust bank were only able to study for a few grades in primary school, but this has not robbed them of the motivation to persist, proudly working to provide education and wellness to their children and families.

With dreams to expand their sales and create better opportunities for their families, the members of this new trust bank are excited to receive their loans that will enable them to reach these goals. Thank you, Kiva!

loans.use: to buy quality cheese and breads to distribute to her customers

loans.name: Glenda Elizabeth

texts.es: Glenda de 23 años de edad, vive al lado de su compañero de vida y su hija de apenas 1 mes de nacida. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora quien se dedica a la confección de camisas las cuales las vende en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su comunidad. Logrando de esta manera obtener los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos del hogar. Glenda en busca de mejorar sus ingresos solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: hilo y tela para aumentar la producción de camisas y de esta manera aumentar las ganancias.
texts.en:
Glenda is 23 years old and lives with her husband and their 1 month old daughter. She is a hardworking woman who makes shirts that she sells in the market near her home. This work allows her to generate enough income to cover their household expenses.

Glenda is hoping to increase her income and is seeking a loan from FUSAI to purchase thread and fabric so that she can increase her shirt production, therefore improving her earnings.

loans.use: purchase thread and fabric to increase her shirt production.

loans.name: Ana Gertrudis

texts.es: Ana de 19 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida con el que con esfuerzo ha logrado comprar su vivienda en la que actualmente viven. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida brindando sus servicios como domestica siendo así como genera sus ingresos económicos con los que lleva el alimento a su hogar, su compañero  aporta su ayuda económica gracias a su trabajo. Ana desea realizar unas reparaciones en el corredor de su vivienda ya que este presenta deterioro en el techo y en época de lluvia el agua ingresa al interior lo que hace que se les mojen sus pertenencias, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: láminas, clavos, tornillos, mano de obra. Para realizar la reparación del corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana, age 19, lives with her partner in the home that they managed to buy for themselves through a great deal of hard work. She is a hard-working woman who earns a living working as a maid. With her income, she is able to provide food for her household. Her partner also works and contributes to the household economy.

Ana wants to make some repairs to the passageway of the home. Currently, the roof is deteriorating and during the rainy season, water comes in and soaks all their belongings. She has come to FUSAI for this loan, which she will invest in sheet metal, nails, screws, and labor, so that she can repair the passageway.

loans.use: buy building materials to make repairs to the passageway of her home

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal is a 30-year-old married mother of two. She has been working as a tutor from her house to support her husband in developing their family's living and covering their increasing living expenses.
This is her third year in the tutoring business, and she is looking forward to developing it in the future to open her own tutoring center and expect more students.

Today, since Dalal's income combined with her husband's is distributed for their family's basic daily needs, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her children's school tuition fees.

She is working hard to provide her children with the best education and is seeking a better future for them.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Francisca De Los Angeles

texts.es: Doña Francisca de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 10 años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Francisca, 58, lives in her own home with her husband.  She has a small store in her house.  She's had this store for 10 years, and she has many customers because of her good prices and friendly service.  She is requesting a loan to buy more soups, eggs, staple grains, beverages, snacks, sweet bread, etc.  This way she can increase her income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy products for her store

loans.name: Irma Yolanda

texts.es: Doña Irma de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de pupusas su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada e inicio con capital propio, con lo que obtienen de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, maíz y demás ingredientes y asi poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Doña Irma, who is 62 years old, lives with her husband in their own house. She has been making and selling pupusas [thick, filled corn tortillas] for a number of years. Her business is located near her place of residence in a zone with a lot of traffic. She began with her own capital. With what she obtains from her sales, she manages to pay some of the household expenses.

She is applying for a loan to purchase fried pork rinds, fresh cheese, beans, corn, and other ingredients and thus be able to continue with her work, which generates good income for her.

loans.use: to buy fried pork rinds, fresh cheese, beans, corn, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Federico

texts.en: Federico is a man with determination. He is a 36-year-old married man from the city of Baybay, Leyte. For fifteen years, he raised his family by driving a “pedicab” (a cycle rickshaw), a vehicle with three wheels that is moved by foot pedals. His income from this livelihood is not enough for them. That is why he is asking for a loan. He needs to start other business opportunities that will certainly help them improve their livelihood. From this loan amount, he will buy fish to sell. In addition to this, he also plans to raise pigs and feed as well.

loans.use: to buy fish, pigs and feed.

loans.name: Luz Amparo

texts.es:
Amparo con 56 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge, en el distrito de Oyotún,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú, en una zona rural. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, como leche, aceite, arroz, azúcar, gaseosa, artículos de aseo, etc. con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo, compra de más mercadería como arroz,azúcar,leche,etc. Dicha inversión le servirá para incrementar sus ventas, con gran influencia en el negocio. De esta manera piensa tener mayor stock de productos para poder atender las diversas necesidades, requerimientos y gustos de los clientes de la zona.

Amparo es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha tenido dos créditos de S/.1000,00 y S/.1500,00 los cuáles los a cancelado de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Amparo, 56, is married and lives with her husband in the Oyotun district of Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque department of Peru.  This is a rural area.  She has good personal and work references on the part of residents from the area.  People here work mainly in agriculture, trade, and animal husbandry.

Amparo has a grocery business; she sells items such as milk, cooking oil, rice, sugar, soft drinks, personal care items, and other products.  She has more than 10 years of experience with the business, which is located in her home.  She is requesting a loan for working capital so that she can buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, milk, etc.  This investment will enable her to increase her sales, and will have a great influence on the business.  This way, she plans to have a greater stock of products on hand so she can meet the diverse needs, requirements, and tastes of her customers.  

Amparo is a returning member of Edpyme Alternativa.  She has taken previous loans of 1,000 soles and 1,500 soles which she has paid off on time.

loans.use: to buy products for her store

loans.name: Badria

texts.en:
Badria is a Center for Community Transformation (CCT) partner. She has been managing her clothes buy and sell business for 3 years and contemplates ways to come up with better marketing strategy. She's happy for the support CCT offers for every entrepreneur. She believes that CCT nurtures every member by lending certain amounts for their business growth and provides business seminars.

She decided to apply for a loan this year amounting to Php 30,000 for her direct selling business of ready-to-wear clothes. The amount will be used to buy varieties of designs and sizes of clothing so that customers will have variety of choices.

Like other entrepreneurs, Badria aims to be successful on her chosen industry and indeed, be able to sustain the needs of her family. She also wants to save money to invest for her own space to put up the business. Though it's not that easy to run the business without an established fund but she believes that CCT will be is a medium for her to succeed in the business.

Badria believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and hear God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy varieties of designs and sizes of clothes for her buy and sell business.

loans.name: Normalia

texts.en:
In the year 2012, Normalia started to manage her own business. She was only 16 years old at that time, when it was established. She’s grateful that until now she continuously had the business. Normalia is married to Abdul who is also a vendor. They are involved in a buy and sell business of different ready-to-wear clothes and earn about Php 17, 000 each month.

Each day is tiring, since dealing with different kinds of people and change of weather are what she considers a challenge in the business. However, she perseveres to earn more profit as she wants to have savings for their future and invest for a space in Common Wealth Market so that she no longer has to pay a monthly rental.

She decided to apply for a Php 30,000 loan as she needs additional capital for her business growth. Since Christmas is now approaching, she wants to have more stocks of ready-to-wear clothes of different designs and sizes to attract more patrons and increase sales.

Normalia regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of ready-to-wear clothes of different designs and sizes for her buy and sell business.

loans.name: Jeanie

texts.en:
Jeanie was able to buy sacks of rice, cases of soft drinks and other grocery items as Center for Community Transformation (CCT) was able to approve her previous loan. She wants to thank CCT and lenders for their generosity in helping people financially to run a business. Without their help she’ll not be able to buy bulk quantity of products to add for the business. Most of all, she wants to thank God for providing CCT and lenders as a medium of blessings to her.

She’s determined to succeed in the business for her family. She’s not just managing her own variety store but also has her own buy and sell business of curtains and linoleums. She prays that God will send more customers and gain bigger profit. To have savings of her own is what she aspires. She’s applying for another loan of Php 50,000 to buy more stocks of grocery items, different designs of linoleums and curtains as well. It will be a great privilege if CCT will approve her loan application.

Despite of being busy managing the business, Jeanie spares time attending CCT group fellowship that consist of 10-15 individuals where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hear testimonies from other CCT partners and able to hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of grocery items, different designs of linoleums and curtains as well.

loans.name: Jose Daniel

texts.es:
José Daniel con 57 años de edad,de estado civil casado, vive junto a su esposa, en el distrito de Oyotún,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú, en una zona rural. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, huevos, menestras, etc; con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para arreglos de local y compra de mercadería-abarrotes, con gran influencia en el negocio. De esta manera piensa tener más variedad de productos para poder atender las diversas necesidades, requerimientos y gustos de los habitantes de la zona.

José Daniel es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha tenido 11 créditos de S/.1500,00; S/.2000,00; S/.1000,00; S/.1300,00;S/.1300,00; S/.1500,00; S/.1500,00;S/.1600,00; S/.1600,00; S/.1600,00 y S/.1600,00 los cuáles los a pagado de manera puntual.
texts.en:
José Daniel, age 57, lives with his wife in a rural area of the district of Oyotú, part of the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque department of Peru. He has excellent references from both friends and coworkers in the area. Most people in the region are farmers, cattle ranchers, or business owners.

He runs a grocery store, selling merchandise like rice, sugar, milk, oil, eggs, soups, and more. He has more than ten years of experience in this business, which he runs out of his home. He is requesting this loan so that he can make some repairs to his store and so he can purchase additional groceries as merchandise; this will make a big impact on his business. He hopes to have greater variety of goods so that he can meet a diverse set of needs, requirements, and tastes for the local residents.

José Daniel is a recurring member of Edpyme Alternativa. He has had 11 loans previously for quantities from S/.1000.00 up to S/.2000.00, and he has paid them all back punctually.

loans.use: repair his location and buy additional merchandise for his grocery store

loans.name: Fhemy

texts.en:
Fhemy is 25 years old and married with one child. Fhemy works very hard to provide for them.

Fhemy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, bread, snack foods and other personal care products.

Fhemy has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future Fhemy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, bread, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 36 years old and married with five children.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Ruby is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Ruby has been in this business for 9 years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en:
Tigran works as a taxi driver in Janfida village of Armavir region. Besides taxi driving, Tigran is a construction worker and from time to time receives orders from locals to provide different renovation services.

Tigran lives with his wife and two little kids who are attending a local school. The requested loan will help Tigran to purchase a new car for providing taxi service. He needs to change the car so his customers will have convenient service during long trips. Tigran hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for a new car for providing taxi service.

loans.name: Sovanna

texts.en:
Sovanna is 27 years old, a single freshman who resides in the Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. He has been working since 2009, earning around $12 per day.

Currently, Sovanna is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in Law at the university in the province. Due to the fact that he is short of the finances to pay his tuition fees for the first year, he would like to request a loan.

With this loan, he will be able to have enough finances to cover his university fees and earn a bachelor’s degree. After graduation, Sovanna wants to find another better job with a reasonable salary, so he will be able to save money to build a proper house.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees for the first year, for a BA in Law

loans.name: Deysi Areli

texts.es: Deysi de 29 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 1 y 9 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que brinda sus servicios como ayudante en una tortillería y gracias a su  esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos brindado lo necesario para su crecimiento y desarrollo también recibiendo un aporte económico de parte de su compañero de vida. Deysi desea realizar unas reparaciones en el área continua al baño principal de su vivienda dado que el piso es de tierra y desea brindarles mayor comodidad a sus hijos, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, grava, arena y mano de obra para encementar el piso del área del baño.
texts.en:
Deysi, age 29, lives in her own home along with her life partner and their two children, ages 1 year and 9 years old. She is a hard-working woman who works as an assistant in a tortilla-making shop. Thank to her hard work, she has managed to get her children ahead, providing them what they need for their growth and development. She also receives economic support from her partner.

Deysi wants to make some improvements in the area around the main bath of her home, since the floor is now packed earth and she wants to provide her children with greater comfort. She has come to FUSAI for a loan which she will invest in cement, gravel, sand, and labor, so that she can pave the floor around the bathroom.

loans.use: buy building materials and labor to pave the floor around the bathroom

loans.name: Esmildes

texts.es:
Esmildes es de la ciudad de Villarrica, ella está estudiando la carrera de nutrición, y por medio de sus estudios quiere poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Ella desea poder ayudar a su familia, tener un futuro mejor, y así por medio su carrera cumplir con sus anhelos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en: Esmildes is from the city of Villarrica. She is studying to be a nutritionist, and she wants to use her education to help others. She also hopes to help her family have a better future and reach her goals through her career.  She is seeking a loan to pay her college tuition so that she can continue studying.

loans.use: pay her college tuition.

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en:
Najwa is a hardworking mother of five. She is 49, and has been working with her husband in selling clothes and winter blankets and bed shields for five years.

Najwa is working hard on expanding her working zone and increasing her business capital, especially through an increase in customers. That's why she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with new released winter blankets especially for the coming winter season.

She will work hard so that in the future she will move her home based business to a wide shop and attract more customers.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with new released winter blankets especially for the coming winter season

loans.name: Sulma Marcela

texts.es: Sulma de 38 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos de 7, 10 y 13 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida brindando sus servicios como doméstica y además posee una pequeña tienda, de esa manera genera sus ingresos económicos con los que está sacando adelante a sus hijos brindado lo necesario para su crecimiento y desarrollo como también llevando el sustento a su hogar. Sulma desea cambiar una parte del techo el cual ya se encuentra deteriorado  y en época de lluvia el agua ingresa al interior de la vivienda, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: la compra de lámina, tornillos, mano de obra, etc., para cambiar el techo dañado de su vivienda y brindarle más comodidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sulma, age 38, lives in her own home with her life partner and their three children, ages 7, 10, and 13 years old. She is a hard-working woman who earns a living working as a maid. She also runs a small store. With this work, she is able to earn enough money to get her children ahead, providing for their growth and development as well as sustaining her home.

Sulma wants to replace a part of the roof that has deteriorated. In the rainy season, it lets water into their home. She's come to FUSAI for a loan, which she will invest in the purchase of sheet metal, screws, and labor, so that she can replace the damaged roof of her home and provide her children with greater comfort.

loans.use: pay for building materials and labor so that she can replace the damaged roof of her home

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.en:
Dionisio is a hardworking father of five grown children. Thru farming, he is able to feed his children enough and give them a better way of living.

Dionisio manages seven hectares of farm land. He grows rice in their field. Since farm inputs in the market become costly, Dionisio can’t obtain all of his farm needs. Therefore, he is asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy seeds, and fertilizers for his farm. The rest of his loan will used to pay labor costs for preparing his land and planting. Dionisio believes that the loan will be a big help for him to meet his farm needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds, and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en: Eugenia is already 59 years old, and still enthusiastic to succeed with the business she has now. She is managing a retailing business in their village. Eugenia has a small sari-sari store in front of their house but because of her aspiration to increase her income, she rented a stall as expansion of her business. Eugenia is selling various grocery items and breads. Eugenia wanted to sell more items so that her costumers will have more choices. Thus, she is requesting a loan of P30,000 to buy diaper, powdered milk, and groceries to sell. Eugenia hopes for continues growing of her business.

loans.use: to buy diapers, powdered milk and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alicia Elizabeth

texts.es: Alicia vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 15 años su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y conlas ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Alicia lives in her own home with her son. For 15 years, she has worked selling clothing. Her business is located in her home and she has many customers because of her fair prices. With her earnings, she is able to cover some of her household expenses. She is seeking a loan to purchase clothing in bulk so that she can increase her earnings.

loans.use: purchase wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Cerila is a 57-year-old Center for Community Transformation (CCT) member from Malibay branch. A housewife doing a buy and sell business of mineral water on containers, her neighbors are mostly her customers. She has 3 children that are currently working and are able to help her with some house expenses.She has held the business for 6 years now and she's thankful that the business is still operating which is one of her prayers.

Cerila dreams of having her own house and lot someday since currently she's just paying for a house rental monthly. She's thankful that Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is able to conduct seminars for entrepreneurs to acquire new knowledge and marketing strategies in running a business.

To increase the business' revenue is also one of her goals. With this, Cerila decided to apply for a Php 20,000 loan for her to have revolving funds in buying containers of mineral water daily.

Cerila has been consistent in attending CCT fellowship group that consist of 15 to 30 members where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners, this made her to become strong spiritually and dependent to God on every occasion.

loans.use: to have a revolving fund in buying containers of mineral water daily.

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma is a sari-sari store owner who lives in the city of Baybay, Leyte. She is a 56-year-old married woman and has two adult children. For eight years, she has sold varieties of goods in her sari-sari (variety) store. Delma wants to improve her business for their sustainability.

With this, she is asking for a bigger amount of loan to buy grocery items such as sugar, salt, powdered juice, coffee, candies, chips, biscuits, bread, spices, noodles, canned goods and drinks. In addition to this, she will also buy piglets to raise and feed as well. In this way, she will be able to enhance her earnings and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, powdered juice, coffee, candies, chips, biscuits, bread, spices, noodles, canned goods, drinks and piglets and feed.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling purified drinking water business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of drinking water to sell to customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Doris's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Sonia is 50 years old and has four children who are in school.

Sonia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Sonia requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Sonia has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Sonia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is 48 years old, married with three children.

Jessie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, bread, snack foods and other personal care products.

Jessie has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from pig fattening and charcoal retailing.

Jessie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, bread, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
Blanca de 34 años de edad, está soltera y se dedica a los oficios domésticos de su casa, también se dedica a la venta de pupusas todos los días de la semana por las tardes,  creció con sus padres  quienes se dedicaban a la ventas de productos básicos y a la prestación de servicios de molino nixtamal, es una mujer muy trabajadora que se caracteriza por  su alto compromiso con su familia.


Blanca tiene una experiencia de 15 años en realizar ventas de comercio y de prestación de servicio de molino nixtamal, además realiza la venta de pupusas por las tardes, de esta manera puede obtener buenos ingresos para cumplir con sus compromisos crediticos. 


Ella necesita este crédito para comprar maíz, quesillo, frijoles, queso, aceite, etc. para su negocio de pupusas y también invertirá en el molino.

Ella sueña con cancelar el crédito para tener abiertas las puerta de esta institución.
texts.en:
Blanca, who is 34 years old, is single. She does the domestic tasks in her home, and she also sells pupusas [thick, filled corn tortillas] every day of the week in the afternoon. She grew up with her parents, who sold basic products and provided nixtamal milling services. She is a very hard-working woman who is characterized by her great commitment to her family.

Blanca has 15 years of experience in making commercial sales and providing nixtamal milling service. She also sells pupusas in the afternoons. In this way she can obtain good income to meet her credit obligations.

She needs this loan to buy corn, fresh cheese, beans, cheese, oil, etc., for her pupusa business, and she will also invest in the mill.

She dreams of paying off the loan in order to have the doors of this institution open to her.

loans.use: to buy corn, fresh cheese, beans, cheese, oil, etc., for her pupusa business, and to also invest in the mill

loans.name: Ma. Nancy

texts.en:
Ma. Nancy is 45 years old and married with five children.

She is in agricultural business, farming banana in the Philippines. Ma. Nancy is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ma. Nancy has been in this business for 6 years and also earns additional income from fruits vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Gegham

texts.en:
Gegham has run a clothing store in Vostan village since 2009. He lives with his two sons, and the younger son serves in the army.

Gegham runs his clothing store in the center of the village and also organizes sales from his house. Due to his nice and professional attitude with the clients, locals prefer his shop for clothing sales. The requested loan will help Gegham to purchase new stock of clothing to complete current orders and have good sales in the coming holiday season.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing to complete current orders and have good sales in the coming holiday season.

loans.name: Manuel Martin

texts.es:
Manuel es un joven estudiante de Mecánica Automotriz, carrera que decidió estudiar, porque desde pequeño le fascina todo lo relacionado al funcionamiento de vehículos. Actualmente se encuentra cursando el último semestre de su carrera, se encuentra muy emocionado por ello, ya que podrá cumplir uno de sus principales sueños, que es de culminar su carrera y obtener su título profesional como Profesional Técnico.

Durante todo el tiempo que está estudiando, le va muy bien en sus cursos. Le dedica 50 horas semanales a sus estudios, adicionalmente a ello, realiza prácticas pre-profesionales en una empresa llamada CARDAEZ, que se dedica a todo el mantenimiento y reparación de vehículos. 

Manuel está seguro que gracias a su carrera podrá sacar adelante a su familia, porque podrá formar su propia empresa dando oportunidades laborales tanto a familiares como a su comunidad. El mayor sueño que tiene en la vida es lograr especializarse en todo lo referente a su carrera, ya sea llevando cursos en universidades de Perú o del Extranjero.

El obstáculo que se le ha presentado en estos últimos meses a Manuel, es el económico, porque no puede cancelar sus deudas debido a problemas económicos que tiene en su familia. Es por tal motivo que, solicita a KIVA el apoyo para que pueda terminar de estudiar este último semestre que le falta y así logre obtener su título profesional. Este crédito que le brindarán será para cancelar su último ciclo de estudios y para los trámites de la titulación.

Manuel quiere expresarles unas líneas como agradecimiento por el apoyo brindado:"Muchas gracias por todo lo que están haciendo por mi, aún sin conocerme. Gracias a ustedes podré concluir mi carrera y obtener mi título profesional. Gracias a ustedes seré el orgullo de mi familia."
texts.en:
Manuel is a young man studying Automotive Mechanics, a career he decided on because he has been fascinated by everything to do with the functioning of vehicles since he was little. He is currently in the final semester of his studies. He's very excited about it because he'll be able to fulfill one of his biggest dreams, which is to finish his career studies and obtain his professional qualification as a Professional Technician.

During all the time he's been studying, he's doing very well in his classes. He studies 50 hours a week and also works at a pre-professional  level at a business called CARDAEZ which offers every sort of maintenance and repair of vehicles. 

Manuel is sure that thanks to his career he will be able to provide for his family, because he'll be able to start his own business and provide work opportunities to members of his family and community. The biggest dream he has in life is to be able to know his career in depth, either through taking classes at universities in Peru or in other countries. 

The obstacle Manuel is facing in recent months is economic, because he can't pay off debts due to financial problems in his family. That's why he's asking for a KIVA loan to be able to finish the last semester that he needs to get his professional qualification. The loan he will receive will be to pay off his final cycle of studies and for the degree process.

Manuel wants to express a few lines of gratitude for the support that is offered:  "Many thanks for all that you are doing for me, without even knowing me. Thanks to you I will be able to conclude my studies and get my professional qualification. Thanks to you I will be the pride of my family."

loans.use: to finish studying the career of Automotive Mechanic and earn his professional qualification.

loans.name: Santos Marisol

texts.es: Santos de 35 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 6 y 10 años de edad. Ella es un mujer trabajadora  que se gana la vida vendiendo productos por catálogo para damas y ropa usada de forma ambulante ya que posee clientes en los alrededores de su comunidad, siendo esa la manera como genera sus ingresos económicos con los que está sacando adelante a sus hijos brindándoles lo necesario para su crecimiento y desarrollo. Santos desea realizar unas mejoras a su vivienda construyendo un techo en el área donde se encuentra el lavadero ya que esta al aire libre, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: madera, laminas, tornillos, clavos, etc., para realizar la construcción del techo en el área del lavadero de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Santos, age 35, lives in her own home along with her life partner and their two children, ages 6 and 10 years old. She's a hard-working woman who earns her living by selling merchandise for women by catalog and by selling used clothing to her customer base all around the area. With this work, she is able to earn enough money to get her children ahead and provide them with what they need for their growth and development.

Santos wants to improve her home by building a roof over the area where the sink is, since it's currently out in the open. She has come to FUSAI for a loan which she will invest in the purchase of wood, sheet metal, screws, nails, and more, so that she can build a roof over her home's sink area.

loans.use: pay for building materials to build a roof over the sink of her home.

loans.name: Nyahuka Parents School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Godfrey. He is the Head Teacher of Nyahuka Parents School, a mixed school in the rural area of Nyahuka in Bundibugyo with 900 students. Nyahuka School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining two UV water filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children.

Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the longterm as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase two UV water treatment systems with a 450 litre tank and a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Nyahuka School will repay its loan from its school fees, which are collected each term.
