Godfrey ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from waterborne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Dúo Jeremías 2 Group

texts.es:
DUO JEREMIAS 2
Marina de 36 años es madre soltera,  de dos niños menores de edad los cuales asisten a la escuela, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de cerámica y productos plásticos desde hace 8 años. Marina solicita un crédito para la compra de apastes para cocinar tamales navideños y compra de productos de plasticos. pues se acerca la temporada navideña y es una de las mejores temporadas para su negocio. El sueño de marina es tener un negocio más grande y así tener mejores ingresos para darles un mejor estilo de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jeremias 2 Team

Marina, age 36, is the single mother of two children who are both in school. For eight years now, she's run a business selling ceramic and plastic products.

Marina is requesting this loan so that she can buy clay pots for cooking Christmas tamales as well as additional plastic goods. The upcoming Christmas season is one of the best times for her business.

Marina' goal is to expand her business and earn more money so that she can provide her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy and sell the clay pots necessary for making Christmas tamales

loans.name: Yeni Abigail

texts.es: Yeni de 18 años de edad, vive al lado de su compañero de vida, reside en vivienda propia y para cubrir sus gastos se dedica a la venta de cocos en un puesto que ha instalado cerca de su comunidad, además en busca de aumentar sus ingresos sale a vender ropa los fines de semana. Y en vista que se acerca la temporada navideña, fecha en la cual aumenta la demanda para sus productos, solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cocos y diferentes tipos y estilos de ropa para aumentar las ventas y así también sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Yeni, age 18, lives with her partner. They live in their own home, and to cover their expenses, she works selling coconuts at a stand she's set up near their community. As an additional means of supplementing their income, she also sells clothing on the weekends.

The Christmas season is coming, and with it comes an increase in demand for her products. She has come to FUSAI for this loan which she will invest in the purchase of both coconuts and various types and styles of clothing. By doing that, she can increase her sales and thus her income.

loans.use: supply her businsses for Christmas by buying coconuts and an assortment of clothing

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena wants to send her deepest gratitude to lenders who extended their help financially, and to the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for the approval of her previous loan. Without the loan, it might have taken some time before she could refill bulk quantities of grocery products at her variety store business. The loan became a way for her to attract more patrons and increase sales. She’s first and foremost thankful to God for providing instruments to improve the business.

The daily income Lorena earns is what she uses to pay bills and other expenses. She’s determined to make her business grow for her family, and to support her children’s education, as she wants them to be professionals someday. Lorena applied for a loan of 50, 000 PHP to add grocery items to her variety store business and to have revolving fund as well.

Lorena is consistent in attending the weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members. There, she gains spiritual strength from members' life changing testimony, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays microfinance loans and hears God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to add grocery items to her variety store business and to have revolving fund as well.

loans.name: Rafiki Mwema Group

texts.fr:
Liliane  fait partie du groupe  Rafiki Mwema et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle  a 35 ans et est mariée  à Célestin. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 5 à 17 ans,  tous  étudient.
 
Il fait le service de charge batterie de téléphone  depuis  6 ans. 

Il est à son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter un onduleur   servant à charger les batteries, pour servir beaucoup de clients et  gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait  avoir acheté un nouveau moteur pour servant à charger les batteries  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Liliane is part of the Rafiki Mwema group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 35 and is married to Célestin. Together they have four children from 5 to 17 years of age, all attending school.

She has been running a phone battery-charging service for the past six years.

This is her second loan with Turame. She will use the Kiva loan to increase her working capital and buy an inverter to recharge batteries, so as to serve many customers, and earn more.

In coming years, she would like to buy another device to recharge the batteries and ensure her children's education.

loans.use: increase her working capital and buy an inverter to recharge [mobile phone] batteries, to serve many customers, and earn more.

loans.name: Tubandanye Group

texts.fr:
Odette fait parti du groupe Tubandanye et habite à Bujumbura.Ella a 42 ans et est mariée  J Bosco ,un professeur. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants âgés de 2 ans à 17ans,dont 5 étudient.

Elle a un enfant à sa charge qui étudie.

Elle fait le commerce des habits depuis 6 ans.

Elle est à son cinquième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit kiva qu'elle obtient,elle va augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d' habits à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années,il voudrait voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Odette is a part of the Tubandanye Group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 42 years old and is married to J. Bosco, a professor. Together, they have 6 children between the ages of 2 and 17, 5 of whom are in school.

She has one child whom she cares for who is in school.

She has been selling clothing for six years.

She is on her fifth loan with Turame. With the loan that she receives from Kiva, she will increase her capital and buy a large supply of clothing to resell and make more money.

In the coming years, he would like to see his children study.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large supply of clothing to resell.

loans.name: Theav

texts.en:
Theav is 20 years old and a single student. He resides in the Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. He is taking an English literature major at a university. In order to support his studies, he is also working at an hotel, as a bellboy, where he can earn approximately $9 per day.

Theav is in the second year at the university, and since he is lacking finances to pay his second-semester tuition fees of the second year, he requested a loan, which will help him finish the second semester successfully.

In the future, he plans on finding another better job with a reasonable salary. He also wants to build a new house for his family and if he has children, he wants his children to study to pursue bachelor or master degrees, if he can support it.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees. He is studying English Literature and working as a hotel bell-boy to help finance his education.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, es estudiante de la carrera de Psicología, tiene previsto graduarse el próximo año, y así poder abrir para su consultorio para la atención a sus pacientes en forma personal.
Ella es una persona muy sacrificada que quiere ser alguien en la vida, es por ello que se esfuerza mucho.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Martha is from the city of San Lorenzo and she's a psychology major. She expects to graduate next year and hopes to be able to open a consultation where she can attend to her patients personally.

She wants to be someone in life, and she's worked very hard and sacrificed a lot to do that.

She is requesting this loan so she can pay her program tuition and fees and stay in school.

loans.use: pay her university costs

loans.name: Ngadjisarr Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est constitué de 14 femmes qui habitent le même village; elles ont comme principale activité le commerce. Anta l'emprunteur en vedette est la responsable du groupe, elle est âgée de 58 ans, mariée et mère de huit enfants dont 4 garçons. Elle est debout à gauche sur la photo et a levé la main Gauche. Elle mène une activité de petit commerce de produits alimentaire et capitalise une bonne expérience de plusieurs années. Avec son prêt elle compte acheter des produits pour sa boutique, du sucre, du riz, de l'huile. Avec ses bénéfices elle va renforcer son épargné au niveau du Banc Villageois, payer la scolarité de ses enfants car son mari ne travaille plus.
texts.en: This group is made up of 14 women who live in the same village. They are all businesswomen. Anta, the star borrower, is the group's representative. She is 58 years old, married, and the mother of eight children, four of whom are boys. She is standing on the left in the photo with her left hand raised. She has a small business selling groceries and capitalizes on her considerable experience gained from many years of work. With her loan, she intends to buy products for her shop - sugar, rice, oil. With the profits she will strengthen her savings with the 'Banc Villageois' and pay for her children to go to school as her husband no longer works.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is thankful that there are people who are willing to help new entrepreneurs who are financially incapable. The previous loan of 50,000 PHP became a way to increase her daily sales. She bought grocery items for her variety store business. She wants to thank each lender participating in the Kiva program. Without their help, she wouldn’t be able to provide a complete stock of products to her customers. It's also essential to have a revolving fund for the business to succeed.

Juditha wants to have an established savings account for her family’s future, and she also dreams of operating the business in a more commercialized location. With the help of the Lord, people are helping her, not just financially, but also sharing knowledge on how to run a business the right way. Juditha prays that God may touch the hearts of the people who will read her story, since she is once again applying for a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy stocks of grocery items for the business.

Juditha has been consistent in attending her CCT fellowship group, which consists of 15 to 30 members, and where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners. This makes her become spiritually strong and dependent on God on every occasion.

loans.use: to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Juan Gual Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Juan es una persona emprendedora y dedicada al comercio, cuenta con una llantera en la cual además de reparar neomáticos también vende lubricantes, su negocio es muy productivo ya que está ubicado en una zona muy comercial de su comunidad.
Don Juan realiza mantenimiento de cambio de aceite y reparación de llantas en diferentes zonas y sus clientes son amigos y vecinos de su comunidad, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de lubricantes, parchos, mechas, pegamento, etc. para continuar con su negocio y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
Don Juan sueña con poder ampliar su negocio y convertirlo en taller de balanceo y alineamiento para automóviles.

Danli, Honduras – Noviembre del 2015
texts.en:
Juan is an enterprising man of business who runs a tire shop where he repairs tires and sells lubricants. His business is very productive since it's located in a busy commercial zone in his community.

Juan's business does oil changes and tire repair throughout the area. His customers are his friends and neighbors. He is requesting this loan so that he can buy lubricants, patches, fuses, adhesives, and more. That way, he can keep his business going and improve his quality of life. Juan's goal is to expand his business and convert it into an auto shop for rotation and alignment.


Danli, Honduras – November, 2015

loans.use: buy lubricants, patches, fuses, adhesives, and more for his business

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman with two children. She 33 years old and both of her children are still in school.

Irene is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a fruit and vegetable business in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables like garlic, onions, carrots, bananas, mangos, papayas, etc. to sell in her food stall.

Irene has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables like garlic, onions, carrots, bananas, mangos, papayas, etc. to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Félix Arnoldo

texts.es:
Félix tiene 40 años de edad, trabaja en su comunidad como agricultor, vive con su familia formada por su esposa y sus dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando educación básica en la escuela de su comunidad, también se dedica a la ganadería al cuido y crianza de cerdos, el señor  creció con sus padres quienes se dedicaban a la agricultura y ganadería como principal fuente de ingresos. Al paso del tiempo formó su familia en la cual ha sabido salir  adelante con ayuda de las ganancias que le generan las ventas de ganado y de cerdos de esta manera ha podido satisfacer  las necesidades de su familia y poder cumplir con los compromisos crediticos. 


El señor   tiene una experiencia de 10 años en realizar actividades de agricultura y crianza de cerdos actividad que aprendió de su padre quien dedicó toda su vida a realizar trabajos de ganadería, a esta actividad que realiza se suma la ayuda de su esposa quien también se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos de su casa.


El crédito será utilizado para comprar concentrado para los cerdos y también darles tratamiento para desparasitarlos y mejorar las instalaciones donde permanecen los animales.


Las proyecciones que tiene para un futuro son las de apoyar en la educación de sus hijos, pagar el crédito y adquirir uno nuevo para instalar una granja de gallinas ponedoras, crear un estanque y cultivar peces ya que cuenta con un terreno muy adecuado para realizar esa actividad.
texts.en:
Félix is 40 years old and works in his community as a farmer. He lives with his family, which consists of his wife and two children, who are elementary school students at the school in their community. He also earns a living in livestock, caring for and raising pigs. The man grew up with his parents who worked in farming and livestock as their main source of income. Over the years, he formed a family and has known how to get ahead thanks to the earnings he generates selling livestock and pigs. This is how he has managed to take care of his family's needs and comply with his loan commitments.

The man has 10 years of experience working in farming and raising pigs. He learned the business from his father who spent his whole life working with livestock. He is assisted in his work by his wife, who also takes care of the household chores.

The loan will be used to buy feed concentrate for the pigs and also give them a parasite treatment and improve the facilities where the animals are kept.

The plans he has for the future are to support the education of his children, pay off the loan and take on a new one in order to install a farm with laying hens, build a pond and farm fish, because he has some land that is very suitable for that business.

loans.use: to buy feed concentrate for the pigs and also give them a parasite treatment and improve the facilities where the animals are kept.

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Sagrada Familia está en el primer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Alicia quien tiene una despensa, también se debe destacar el entusiasmo de esta señora, que siempre participa de una manera muy activa en las capacitaciones dentro del grupo. Ella se define a sí misma como una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que pone todo de si para poder seguir creciendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser: carne, verduras, frutas, bebidas, panificados y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
The group "Sagrada Familia" [Sacred Family] is in the first cycle of the women's committee program, they are making the poverty elimination survey, working to improve their living conditions. 

One of the members is Mrs. Alicia, who has a general store. This lady's enthusiasm should also be noted; she always participates very actively in the group's training sessions. She see's herself as a very hardworking and fighting person, who gives everything so she can keep growing. 

She is asking for this loan so she can invest in supplies for her store, like meat, vegetables, fruits, drinks, and other items, to be able to continue her sales.

loans.use: To buy meat, vegetables, fruits, drinks, bread and other products to supply her store

loans.name: Ngadjisarr-2 Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe a été crée le 17 Mai 2010 et  est constitué de 19 femmes qui habitent le même village; elles ont comme principale activité le commerce. Coumba l'emprunteur en vedette est la responsable du groupe, elle est âgée de 55 ans, mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle est debout à gauche sur la photo et a levé la main droite. Elle mène une activité de petit commerce de divers produits et fait aussi la transformation de l'huile d'arachide. Elle capitalise une bonne expérience de plus de 05 ans. Avec son prêt elle compte acheter des arachides pour la transformation en huile. Avec ses bénéfices elle va renforcer son épargne au niveau du Banc Villageois, acheter des habits et payer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: This group was started on May 17, 2010 and is made up of 19 women who live in the same village. They are all businesswomen. Coumba, the star borrower, is the group's representative. She is 55 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She is standing on the left in the photo with her right hand raised. She has a small business selling a variety of products and also makes peanut oil. She capitalizes on her more than five years of good experience. With her loan, she intends to buy peanuts to make into oil. With the profits, she will strengthen her savings with the 'Banc Villageois,' buy clothing, and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy various products and peanuts.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
As a source of income, Farida buys and sells different designs of ready-to-wear clothes. She is a 33-year-old businesswoman, and a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She's been in the industry for four years and works hard to continually support her family. She’s grateful for having the business and earning about 16,000 PHP every month.

Although Farida is able to earn a daily profit, there are still other expenses that need to be paid. Profits that are supposed to be put back into her business are being used to pay bills and other expenses. With this, she needs to have supplementary capital to buy stock of ready-to-wear clothes as she aims to increase revenue by providing a wide range of clothing in different designs and sizes. This is why she applied for a 30,000 PHP loan. She’s hoping that her loan request will be granted by Center for Community Transformation (CCT) since she has been a dedicated member.

Farida wants her children to finish college, and that’s why she’s eager to earn more each day. She also aims to invest in getting her own space for her business.

Despite being busy with managing the business, Farida spares time to attend CCT's group fellowship, which consists of 10-15 individuals. There, she can gain spiritual strength, hear testimonies from other CCT partners, hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy stock of ready-to-wear clothes for her buy-and-sell business.

loans.name: Welnida

texts.en:
Welnida is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a 33,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Welnida industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like running a food vending business. She dreams of being able to save money to expand her business someday.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Evelin Esther

texts.es: Evelin es una mujer de 46 años de edad con un excelente espíritu de superación, ella es madre de cuatro hijos de los cuales, el mayor tiene 26 años, sus gemelos 24 y su último hijo 21 años, ella enviudó muy joven y en medio de esta situación tan dolorosa para su grupo familiar tuvo que buscar alternativas para poder continuar con su vida y ofrecer a sus hijos un buen porvenir, así que se encaminó por la confección de ropa y se capacitó en este arte. Con escasos recursos adecuó su taller en las instalaciones de su vivienda una humilde casa situada en un barrio del municipio de Soledad, allí se dio a conocer y en esta localidad se encuentran sus principales clientes y también maneja contratos para maquilar prendas. Diciembre es la temporada del año en la que sus pedidos se incrementan es por ello que necesita aprovisionarse de materias primas e insumos, ella realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, capital con el que financiará sus compras de telas, hilos, cremalleras, pellones, botones y demás insumos que requiera para su producción. Su meta a futuro es comprar casa propia y continuar ayudando a sus hijos con los gastos de estudios profesionales.
texts.en:
Evelin is a 46-year-old woman with an excellent spirit to overcome challenges. She is the mother of four children: the eldest is 26 years old, two twins are 24, and her last son is 21 years old. She became a widow at a very young age and in the midst of such a painful situation for her family, she had to look for alternatives to be able to continue with her life and offer a good future for her children. Thus, she turned to making clothing and became proficient in this art. With scarce resources she adapted her workshop in the setup of her home – a humble house situated in a neighborhood of Soledad. There, she became known found her first customers and also manages contracts to assemble garments.

December is the season in which her orders increase, and it is for this reason that she needs to stock up on raw materials and supplies. She put together a loan application, an opportunity to link herself to finances through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, capital with which she will finance her purchase of fabric, thread, zippers, blankets, buttons and other supplies she requires for her production. Her goal for the future is to buy her own house and continue helping her children with the cost of their processional studies.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zippers, blankets, buttons and other raw materials that she needs for production

loans.name: Ratamalgré Ii Group

texts.fr: Marie est mariée mère d'un enfants, elle est âgée de 56 ans. Elle vend de la Farine dans sa maison et cela fait 10 ans qu'elle exerce cette activité. Elle a besoin d'un prêt pour acheter du maïs à 50 000 F CFA afin de transformer en farine pour vendre. Dans le quartier de Marie c'est la seule à vendre la farine et le marché n'est pas à côté ce qui fait que la vente de la farine marche bien et en plus de cela elle propose la meilleure farine à ses clients, elle est également très propre. Après ses ventes, elle aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de faire des épargnes, de s'occuper  de sa famille et aussi de continuer ses activités. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt une fois et à rembourser à la date prévue à ACFIME.
texts.en:
Marie is a 56-year-old married mother of one child. She sells flour from her home and has been performing this activity for the past ten years. She needs a loan to buy 50,000 CFA francs' worth of maize to be ground into flour for sale.

Mary is the only one to sell flour in her neighborhood, and since the market is not close by, flour sales are doing well. On top of this she offers the best quality flour to her customers, and also maintains a very clean business.

After sales, her profits will enable her to make savings, care for her family, and also pursue her business activities. She has already been granted one loan and repaid it on time to ACFIME.

loans.use: buy 50,000 CFA francs' worth of maize

loans.name: Kikeje Group

texts.fr: Débutée il y a à peine 4 ans, l'activité rizicole de Fabrice progresse pour le mieux. Il a été attiré par sa rentabilité et l'expérience acquise de par ses parents. Malgré l'insuffisance de moyens y affectés et parfois le manque d'eau, il souhaite acheter un champ, scolariser ses enfants dans des bonnes écoles et construire une maison en matériaux durables. Fabrice est l'homme au milieu sur la photo.
texts.en:
Initiated barely four years ago, Fabrice's rice-growing activity is making good progress. He was attracted by its profitability and the experience gained by his parents.

Despite the lack of resources and sometimes the lack of water, he wants to buy a field, see that his children are educated in good schools, and build a house with durable materials. Fabrice is the man in the middle in the photo.

loans.use: pay for plowing, transplanting, weeding, and buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon is 41 years old, married, and has three children. He is a farmer, planting and harvesting rice to sell. He manages his rice field well in order to attain good nutrition and a profitable harvest.

He is now asking for a loan as additional revolving capital for his business. He is asking for PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming.

In the future, Marlon hopes to continue to improve his business and save profits for education and emergency needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Famille Didier Group

texts.fr: C'est depuis 2010 que André et son épouse Toyi ont accéléré l'exécution  des activités rizicoles qu'ils ont appris de leurs parents car ils la trouvent rentable par rapport aux autres. Comme obstacle, André cite l'absence d'eau d'irrigation et la présence permanente des oiseaux ravageurs dans leur champ. Il souhaite posséder son propre champ et d'atteindre une bonne production pour le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Since 2010 André and his wife Toyi stepped up the rice-farming activities learned from their parents, because they found them to be more cost-effective than others.

As an obstacle, André cites the lack of irrigation water and the permanent presence of pest birds in their field. He wants to have his own field and achieve good production to ensure his family's well-being.

loans.use: pay for plowing, harrowing, transplanting, weeding, and buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is the 40-year-old wife of Joelito from Quezon City, Philippines. She is from the Batasan branch of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and a hardworking mother of three children. She has a store that sells school supplies, earning her about 15,000 PHP each month. The business has become a medium for her in supporting the needs of her family, which is why she's thankful that she has a business to manage.

Maribel buys school supplies on a weekly basis. However, she only purchases small quantities of products because that’s what she’s able to afford at the moment. She dreams of purchasing large quantities of school supplies that will increase her revenue. To have another store is also one of her goals.

Maribel aspires to maintain a revolving fund. Therefore, she applied for a loan of 20,000 PHP. Indeed, perseverance and determination should be the foundation to succeed in any industry.

On a weekly basis, Maribel meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony and her business experience. She also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listens to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to have revolving fund for her business and to buy additional school supplies.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 58 years old and has four children. She is married and one of her children is still in school.

Daisy is in the agricultural business, and raises pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her businesses.

Daisy has been in this business for nine years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Daisy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Honeylyn

texts.en:
As a woman parent, Honeylyn works hard to support her family.

She has a sea cucumber business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Honeylyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy supplies such as plastic, etc. needed for her sea cucumber business.

Honeylyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as plastic, etc. needed in her sea cucumber business.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 53 years old and married with 10 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and also earns an income from food vending.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries.

Betty has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Ángela Tulia

texts.es: Ángela es una mujer de 36 años muy creativa, alegre y entusiasta, ella está comprometida y es madre de un hijo de 10 años de edad, sus padres le entregaron en herencia una vivienda en la que encontró la oportunidad de construir apartamentos para arrendar y aportar en los gastos de su hogar. Su vivienda está ubicada en un barrio del municipio de Soledad y ella se esmera porque sus inquilinos cuenten con las condiciones de habitabilidad favorables, y uno de los apartamentos que va a arrendar, aún le faltan detalles, es por ello que realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar cerámicas para pisos, baños y cocina y cancelar la mano de obra.   Esta inversión permitirá que el canon de arriendo sea mucho mayor y su familia cuente con mejores beneficios.  Su meta es comprar otra casa y construir más apartamentos.
texts.en:
Angela is a 36 year-old woman who is very creative, happy, and enthusiastic.  She has a partner and is the mother of a 10 year-old child.  She inherited a house from her parents, and there she found the opportunity to build apartments to rent so that she could contribute to the household expenses.  Her home is located in a neighborhood in the municipality of Soledad.  She works hard so that her renters can have good living conditions.  One of the apartments is ready to rent, and the other still needs some work.  This is why she is requesting a Kiva loan, and is becoming involved with the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy tiles for the floors, bathrooms, and kitchen, and to pay for labor.  

This investment will make it possible for her to charge a much higher rent, and so her family will benefit.  Her goal is to buy another house and build more apartments.

loans.use: to buy tile and pay for labor

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 48 years old and married with seven children.

Norma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Norma has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Norma aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Juan Agustin

texts.es:
Agustín, de 39 años de edad, es un hombre luchador, fue huérfano, pues su padre los abandonó y su madre murió cuando él tenía solo 2 años de edad, fue criado por una tía quien no lo dejó que estudiara y lo puso a que trabajara en la agricultura; actualmente está acompañado y tiene dos hijos, pero uno de ellos emigró hacia Estados Unidos en busca del “sueño americano”, su esposa se dedica al cuido del hogar y atiende un molino al que acuden todas las personas de la comunidad a moler maíz. 

Agustín, es empleado en una hacienda ganadera cercana a su comunidad, el cargo que desempaña es de bus-capataz y también es el encargado de coordinar ciertas actividades en la hacienda.- Juan, también es una persona muy versátil, pues también a trabajado como mecánico, chófer, tractorista, carpintero, soldador y hasta peluquero, estos oficios los ha aprendido con el transcurso de la vida.

Agustín, necesita el préstamo para comprar herramientas para establecer un pequeño taller de estructuras metálicas en su vivienda; porque a futuro ya no desea depender de un empleo, sino ser totalmente independiente.

Agustín, sueña con llegar a tener un taller en donde aparte de estructuras metálicas, también tenga la sección de carpintería.
texts.en:
Agustín is 39 years old and is a fighter. He was an orphan; his father abandoned them and his mother died when he was on 2 years old. He was raised by an aunt who didn't allow him to study and who put him to work in farming. He is currently living with someone and has 2 children, but one of them immigrated to the United States in search of the "American dream." His wife dedicates her time to the housekeeping and looking after a corn mill that all the folks in the community come to grind their corn.

Agustín is employed on a cattle ranch near his community. His job is that of boss-foreman and is also in charge of coordinating certain activities on the ranch. He is also a very versatile person, having also worked as a mechanic, driver, tractor driver, carpenter, welder and even barber. He has learned all these professions throughout the course of his life.

Agustín needs the loan to buy tools to establish a small workshop to make metal structures at his home, because in the future, he doesn't want to depend on a job, he wants to be totally independent.

Agustín dreams of having a workshop where, besides metal structures, he also has a carpentry division.

loans.use: to buy tools to establish a small shop to make metal structures at his home.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel, de 50 años de edad, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a la comercialización de carne y tiene dos hijos que están estudiando.

Manuel, se dedica a la venta y compra de ganado desde hace diez años, también trabaja en la crianza de pollos de engorde y todo lo hace en su casa.

Manuel, necesita el préstamo para comprar una yunta de bueyes para engordarlos y venderlos después.

Manuel, sueña con tener una pequeña tienda para tener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Manuel is 50 years old and accompanied, his partner works in the meat business and he has two children who are in school.

Manuel has been working in the buying and selling of cattle for the past 10 years, he also breeds and fattens chickens, all of which he does from his house. 

Manuel needs a loan to buy a pair of oxen to fatten and sell. 

Manuel dreams of having a small store to have more income.

loans.use: To buy a pair of oxen to fatten and sell

loans.name: Nick Jordan

texts.es:
Nick, es un joven estudiante de Mecánica de Mantenimiento, carrera que decidió estudiar porque le encanta la mecánica y el mantenimiento, además de desmontar y montar motores, para poder arreglarlos según la experiencia que va obteniendo día a día en sus estudios. Siente que gracias a esta carrera podrá apoyar a su familia, porque con mucho esfuerzo podrá sacar adelante a sus hermanos menores, logrando pagarle sus estudios.

Está cursando el último ciclo de su carrera, le dedica 21 horas semanales de clases teóricas, adicionalmente realiza prácticas pre-profesionales. Cuando acabe su carrera, piensa trabajar en una gran empresa del rubro de la mecánica, la cual le permita desarrollarse profesionalmente.

El mayor sueño que tiene en la vida es no conformarse con esta carrera, sino llegar a estudiar 2 carreras más, que le permitan desarrollarse cada vez más como un gran profesional. Cuando ya obtenga toda la experiencia requerida, le gustaría formar una familia muy unida, feliz; que sus padres se sientan muy orgullosos de todos los logros obtenidos al acabar su carrera.
 
En este último año, su familia tuvo problemas fuertes de dinero, lo que casi ocasiona que deje sus estudios. Para evitar que eso suceda, Nick solicita a KIVA el apoyo para que le permitan terminar su carrera y obtener su título profesional. Este crédito logrará en él grandes cambios, sobre todo personales haciéndolo un hombre más responsable y maduro. Con este crédito, Nick se siente muy feliz al saber que podrá concluir su carrera gracias al apoyo que le están brindando.

Debido a ello, quiere expresarles unas palabras de agradecimiento: "Gracias a ustedes voy a poder cumplir uno de mis tantos sueños que tengo en la vida, que es de culminar mi carrera a tiempo. Me siento muy feliz por todo este apoyo que me brindan, porque gracias a ustedes podré ser un profesional de éxito y nada me impedirá que siga alcanzando mis objetivos personales y profesionales. Gracias KIVA!"
texts.en:
Nick is a young student of Mechanics and Maintenance, a course he decided to study because he loves mechanics and maintenance, apart from disassembling and reassembling motors in order to fix them according to the experience that he is obtaining day by day in his studies
He feels that thanks to this degree he will be able to support his family, because with great effort he will be able to bring his smaller brothers forward, managing to pay for their studies.

He is pursuing the final stage of his degree, to which he dedicates 21 hours a week to theory classes. In addition he is doing pre-professional practices. When he finishes his degree he thinks of working in the mechanics segment of a big company, which will allow him to develop professionally.

The greatest dream of his life is not to settle with this degree, but to arrive at studying two more degrees, which allow him to develop more every time like a great professional.
When he has all the required experience, he would like to build a very united happy family, and that his parents feel very proud of all his achievements made after completing his studies.

In this last year his family had grave financial problems, which almost caused him to quit his studies. To prevent this from happening, Nick is asking KIVA for support, so that they will allow him to finish his course and obtain his professional degree. This loan will accomplish great changes for him, above all personal ones, making him a more responsable and mature man.

Nick feels very happy with this loan, knowing that he will be able to finish his degree thanks to the support that he is given.

Because of this he wants to express some words of gratitude: "Thanks to you I will be able to fulfill one of my many dreams that I have in my life, which is to finish my degree in time. I feel very happy about all this support that you give me, because thanks to you I can be a successful professional and nothing will stop me from achieving my personal and professional goals. Thank you KIVA!"

loans.use: to terminate his last semester of Mechanics and Maintenance and to earn his professional degree.

loans.name: Santos Victorino

texts.es:
El señor Santos tiene 56 años de edad, vive con su  esposa y tiene 3 hijos que dependen de él, vive en una comunidad al Oriente, Trojes El Paraíso, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 35 años a la caficultura.

Don Santos cuenta con 5 manzanas productoras de café y espera aumentar su produccion ya que su finca es relativamente nueva, esta solicitando el prestamo para la compra de huevos, acite, harina, refrescos, churros, etc. porque pretende instalar una pequeña pulperia en donde ofrecera los productos de la canasta basica familiar a los personas de su aldea.

Don Santos tambien desea limpiar y fertilizar parte de su finca con parte del prestamo solictado,  su sueño es poder tener un buen negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida junto a su familia.

Trojes, Honduras – Noviembre del 2015
texts.en:
Santos is 56 years old and lives with his wife and 3 children who are dependent on him. He lives in the eastern town of Trojes in the department of El Paraíso. He owns his own home and has made a living growing coffee for 35 years.

Santos has 5 manzanas producing coffee and hopes to increase his production, since his plantation is relatively new. He is requesting the loan to buy eggs, cooking oil, flour, soft drinks, donuts, etc. because he intends to install a small grocery store to offer staple necessities to the people in his village.

Santos also hopes to clear and fertilize part of his plantation with a portion of the requested loan. His dream is to have a good business and improve his quality of life and that of his family.

Trojes, Honduras – November 2015

loans.use: to buy eggs, cooking oil, flour, soft drinks, donuts, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
At her age of 59, Elena still has the eagerness to manage her retailing business. She has a sari-sari store business in their village. She has been 39 years in her business, yet her business is still going well. At present, Elena’s four children are all grown and most of them have their own familes.

Elena wants to expand the business because she wants to extend her support to her grandchildren. Therefore, Elena wants to borrow a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy breads, drinks, and condiments to sell. She wishes to maintain the business to have a continuous source of income as well.

loans.use: to buy breads, drinks, and condiments to sell.

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
Haide is a 29-year-old married woman with three children; one of them is currently in school.. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a shells craft business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more shells, thread, and other supplies needed in her business.

Haide has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more shells, thread, and other supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Elías Antonio

texts.es:
Elías, de 24 años de edad, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a la comercialización de tortillas, tiene dos hijos pequeños que aún dependen de él.

Elías, se dedica a la comercialización de ganado, tiene cuatro años de dedicarse a este negocio y lo aprendió por medio de su papá, quien desde pequeño le enseño a comercializar ganado.

Elías, necesita el préstamo para comprar ganado, para engordarlo y comercializarlo a un buen precio.

Elías, sueña con comprar un vehículo para comercializar ganado.
texts.en:
Elias is 24 years old and is in a relationship. His partner works selling tortillas. He has two small children who are dependent upon him.

Elias works selling cattle. He has worked in this business for four years. He learned this trade from his father who taught him, at a young age, how to sell cattle.

Elias needs a loan to buy cattle to fatten and sell at a good price. Elias dreams of buying a vehicle to use to sell cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Melba Sarahi

texts.es:
Melba de 36 años de edad, actualmente se encuentra acompañada su esposo trabaja lejos del hogar pero siempre está pendiente de ella y su pequeño hijo de 5 años de edad.

Melba tiene una pequeña tienda y una crianza de cerdos, actividades que le sirven para obtener ingresos para la subsistencia de su familia, por eso ella pone todo el empeño y compromiso en las cosas que hace para sentirse satisfecha de poder salir adelante con su propio esfuerzo.
 
Ella necesita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, café, condimentos, bebidas, etc. para su tienda y además comprará concentrado para los cerdos.  

Ella sueña con tener bienestar en su familia, ver crecer a su hijo y hacer todo lo posible de darle la oportunidad de estudiar.
texts.en:
Melba, 36 years old, is currently married. Her husband works far from the home, but always keeps an eye on her and their little five-year-old son.

Melba has a small store and a pig nursery, work that allows her to make income for the subsistence of her family. To this end, she puts forth all her effort and commitment in the things she does to feel satisfied to advance forward through her own effort.

She needs this loan to buy rice, sugar, coffee, seasonings, drinks, etc. for her store and also to purchase concentrated feed for the pigs.

She dreams of well-being for her family, to watch her son grow, and to do everything possible to give him the opportunity to study.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, coffee, seasonings, drinks, etc. for her store and also to purchase concentrated feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Marcia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Marcia, de 36 años de edad, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a trabajar como taxista y tienen dos hijos que están estudiando.

Marcia, se dedica a la venta de carne asada desde hace cuatro años, ella aprendió por medio de una amiga y viaja en transporte público y trabaja de 8:00 a.m. a 2:00 p.m.

Marcia, necesita el préstamo para comprar equipo para cocinar, para poder comercializar la carne.

Marcia, sueña con colocar su propio negocio y tener un local y obtener más ingresos a futuro.
texts.en:
Marcia is 36 years old and accompanied, her partner works as a taxi driver and they have two children who are in school. 

Marcia sells grilled meat, which she's been doing for the past four years. She learned through a friend, and uses public transportation, working from 8:00 am to 2:00 pm.  

Marcia needs the loan to hire a cooking team to be able to sell more meat.

Marcia dreams of opening her own business and having a location and making more income in the future.

loans.use: To hire a cooking team to be able to sell more meat

loans.name: Ukwiji Group

texts.fr: Depuis 1987, Espérance a été initié dans l'agriculture par ses parents afin de lui permettre à l'avenir de nourrir sa famille et de scolariser ses enfants. Elle est confiante quant au fait d'élargir son champ afin d'avoir un bon rendement, ceci malgré la difficulté liée au manque d'une main d'œuvre disponible et permanent pour entretenir son espace cultural. Cette activité est secondée par celle de la ventes de pagnes, facilitant ainsi un remboursement mensuel. Espérance est en troisième position sur la photo, de gauche à droite, portant une chemise bleu ciel.
texts.en:
Since 1987, Espérance was initiated into agriculture by her parents, to enable her in the future to feed her family and educate her children.

She is confident about the need to expand her field to achieve good performance, despite difficulties linked to the availability of a permanent workforce to maintain and cultivate her field.

This activity is supported by the sales of pagnes (colorful West-African fabric), thus facilitating monthly repayments. Espérance is third from left to right in the photo, wearing a blue shirt.

loans.use: pay for field maintenance labor

loans.name: Marangatu Rape Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Marangatu Rape está en su ciclo número 7º del programa de comités, son 17 mujeres muy unidas y trabajadoras, que vieron una oportunidad de crecer y mejorar a través de la ayuda de la fundación paraguaya.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Teresa, quien se dedica a las costuras, es una mujer muy trabajadora, que con sacrificio y esfuerzo está saliendo adelante. Ella es una persona con muchos anhelos de poder mejorar su negocio, para que de esa forma pueda ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, de manera a poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The group called "Marangatu Rape" is in it's seventh loan cycle with the committee program. The group is made up of 17 women who are very united and hardworking. They saw an opportunity to grow and improve with the help of Fundacion Paraguaya.

One of the member is Teresa who earns a living by sewing. She is a very hardworking woman who is getting ahead because of her sacrifice and effort. She is a person with a great desire to improve her business so that she can help her loved ones.

She is asking for a loan to buy fabric, thread, glue and other products so that she can continue with her sales, as she has been doing, and be able to help her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, glue, and other products to making clothing.

loans.name: Roel

texts.en:
Roel is 28 years old and married, the father to two children, ages one and three. 

He drives his motorela (motorized carriage) to earn a living. His transportation business has been operating for three years now. 

In addition to this, he also raise hogs. He is asking a loan to buy feed for his hogs and also to pay for some repair and maintenance. 

Once these needs are addressed, he can be assured of operating his business without delay and enough feed to keep his hogs. In the future, he plans to buy another motorela to increase his earnings.

loans.use: to buy feed for his hogs and also pay for some repair and maintenance

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a widow who lives in Garcia Hernandez, Bohol, with her family. She is 50 years old. 

Like many people her age, Lolita is into raising hogs.  She is also engaged in buying and selling of rice from farmers and selling it on the market.  

Hog raising is easier to manage due to the proximity of the barns to the owner’s  home. This has been her business for a year now.  Every four months, she usually earned PHP 6,000. 

She is asking a loan to buy three piglets, feed, and more rice to sell. This will assure her  of a healthy and fattened hogs that will give her a better return of investment.

In the future, she hope to expand the number of hogs to raise. Her income will be for food and savings.

loans.use: to buy three piglets, feed, and more rice to sell

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta hails from Dimiao, Bohol.  She is 33  years old, and she is married, with four daughters. 

She works hard on the farm growing rice for an income, while her husband also drives a motorcycle to transport people to another village. 

Marietta has also invested in a hog raising business.  She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm and more piglets to raise. 

She wanted to increase her income for her family’s benefit. Any additional profit will go towards expansion of her farming business. 

In the future, she hopes to see her children having a better chance in life through education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm and more piglets to raise

loans.name: Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Emprendedoras, se formó con la intención de que cada una de las integrantes de este grupo mejore sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Margarita, quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de todo tipo, comenta que siempre tiene muchos pedidos y que gracias a su trabajo tiene los medios para poder procurarse una vida digna para ella y su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar cosméticos de todo tipo, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, cumpliendo con sus clientes y seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called Emprendedoras. It was formed with the intention that each one of its members could improve the life conditions of herself and her family.

One of the members is Sra. Margarita, who works selling cosmetics of all types. She says that she always has many orders and that thanks to her work, she has the means to be able to obtain a dignified life for herself and her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy cosmetics of all types, so that she can continue with her sales, fulfilling her customer’s orders and keep helping her family.

loans.use: to buy various cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is a 50-year-old married woman with seven children, three of whom are in school.. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a shells craft business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more shells, thread, and other supplies needed in her business.

Chona has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more shells, thread, and other supplies needed in her business

loans.name: Marydel

texts.en:
Marydel is 36 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for 10 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items to sell, like canned goods, diapers, noodles, and other groceries.

Marydel has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, like canned goods, diapers, noodles, and other groceries.

loans.name: Alexander Maximino

texts.es:
Alexander de 33 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a oficios domésticos, tienen tres hijos menores de edad y viven en casa propia.

Alexander es carpintero desde hace unos cinco años, el taller lo tiene en la segunda planta de su casa, decidió emprender este negocio pues no tenía otras opciones de empleo y vio que este podría ayudarle a obtener ingresos para el hogar. 

Él necesita este crédito para comprar herramientas que necesita en su carpintería. 

El sueño de Alexander es mejorar cada día su negocio, tener mas clientes y  apoyar siempre a sus hijos para que estudien en un futuro.
texts.en:
Alexander is 33 years old and has a Bachelor's degree; he is accompanied and his partner does housework, they have three young children and live in their own house.  

Alexander has been a carpenter for five years, he has his workshop on the second floor of his house. He decided to open this business since he had no other work options and saw that this could help him generate household income.

He needs this loan to buy tools that he needs for his carpentry business.

Alexander's dream is to improve his business each day, have more customers, and always support his kids so they can study in the future.

loans.use: To buy the needed tools for his carpentry business

loans.name: Claudia Carolina

texts.es:
Claudia es una joven emprendedora de 26 años de edad, logró culminar sus estudios de bachillerato, ahora está acompañada y su pareja trabaja de motorista en una agro-ferretería, tiene dos hijos que aún están pequeños y por lo tanto no asisten a la escuela.


Claudia ya tiene cuatro años de dedicarse a vender tamales, elotes con salsa y elotes sancochados, esto lo realiza en el centro de su colonia, además cuando hay carnavales aprovecha de vender en grandes cantidades y su esposo le ayuda brindándole transporte a los lugares donde ella vende.

 
Ella necesita el crédito para comprar una hornilla móvil y un carretón que le servirán para su venta de tamales y elotes.

Claudia siempre ha soñado con aumentar su clientela para que sus ingreso  económicos se incrementen y poder dar el sustento a su familia.
texts.en:
Claudia is a young, entrepreneurial, 26-year-old woman who finished her high school education. She is married. Her husband works as a driver for a farming supply store. Claudia has two children, who are still too young to go to school.

Claudia has been selling tamales, corn with salsa, and parboiled corn. She does this in her city's center as well as at carnivals where she can sell in large quantities. Her husband helps her with transportation to the places she sells her products.

Claudia needs this loan in order to buy a mobile oven and a big cart to help her sell tamales and corn.

Claudia has always dreamed of increasing her customer base so that her income will also increase and she will be able to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy a mobile oven and a big cart that will help her sell her tamales and corn.

loans.name: Ana Judith

texts.es:
Ana, de 22 años de edad, estudia hasta noveno grado, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica al comercio de ganado y a la agricultura, tienen dos hijos y viven en su casa.

Ana, se dedica al comercio de tortillas desde hace tres años, este oficio lo aprendió por medio de su tía, quien también se dedica a este negocio.

Ana, necesita el préstamo para comprar leña, granos básicos y maíz.

Ana, sueña con colocar una pequeña tienda y así mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana is 22 years old and completed 9th grade. She is married, and her husband sells cattle and farms. They have two children and live in their own home. Ana has been selling tortillas for three years. She learned this work from her aunt, who also has a tortilla business. Ana needs a loan to buy firewood, basic grocery items, and corn. Ana dreams of opening a small store and in this way improving her income and her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wood, basic grocery items, and corn.

loans.name: Evelyn Guadalupe

texts.es: Evelyn de 26 años de edad vive con sus dos hijos una niña de 2 años y un varón de 8 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir de forma ambulante, actividad que realiza desde hace 4 años, por lo que cuenta con muchos clientes. Evelyn con el crédito anterior cambio el techo de su vivienda, ya que este tenía muchas filtraciones, por lo que solicita nuevamente un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava y cemento para encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Evelyn, 26 years old, lives with her two children, a 2 year old daughter and an 8 year old son. She is a hardworking woman who works as a street vendor selling clothing. She has done this work for 4 years which is why she has many customers. 
With her previous loan, Evelyn changed the roof of her home since it had many leaks. This is why she is requesting a new loan from FUSAI to buy: cement, sand and gravel to cement the floor of her home.

loans.use: to buy: cement, sand and gravel to cement the floor of her home.

loans.name: Sinforniana

texts.en:
Sinforniana, who is 52 years old, earns a living through her food vending business . She sell puto (steamed rice cake) with her family in the town of Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. 

Sinforniana has been engaged in the business for three years now.  It is the source of her income. 

Sinforniana is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients like flour and sugar and also grocery items for her daily household use. Through this, she will be able to improve her business and makes it a success.

loans.use: to buy flour and sugar and also grocery items for her daily household use

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita, who is 46 years old, operates a small family business to earn an income.  Her husband is a “pedicab” driver.  A “pedicab” is a cycle rickshaw, a vehicle with three wheels moved by foot pedals. 

Clarita has been involved in making floor wax for 16 years to help her husband support their children. They have two children, who are now attending school, aged 20 and 17 years old. Clarita and her husband work hard to support them and offer them better lives. The family lives in the city of Baybay. 

Clarita wishes to improve her business so she can better sustain her family's daily needs, as well as pay her children's school fees. She therefore requested a loan to buy floor wax ingredients, such as preservatives, polymer emulsions, film formers, and wax containers. 

Clarita’s goal in life is to make a good living for her family.

loans.use: to buy floor wax ingredients, such as preservatives, polymer emulsions, film formers and wax containers

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en: For 11 years, Rosario is engaged in buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the city of Baybay, Leyte; while her husband is working hard in their farm. They are doing this to provide the needs of their seventeen-year-old daughter. Rosario’s future plan is to have food stall to display her fruits and vegetables. In this way, she will be able to improve her sales to augment her livelihood. Now, she needs an amount for additional capital to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell that will increase her profit.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is a very hardworking entrepreneur from Butuan City, Philippines. She is married to Edgar and together they manage a vegetable stand business. Their income from the business helps with their everyday needs and expenditures.

Cheryl buys and sells fresh vegetables like bottle gourd, ginger, onions, cabbage, white carrots, chayote and many others. She buys a quantity of vegetables and sells them per kilo. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

Cheryl is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan to purchase more varieties of vegetables to sell. She will use her loan to improve her sales and her additional revenue to improve her family's general living conditions.

Aside from becoming successful in business and future plans, Cheryl also hopes to make life easy for her children and give them a better quality education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups, comprised of 15 to 30 community partners each, that gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy fresh vegetables like bottle gourd, ginger, onions, cabbage, white carrots, chayote and many others.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 49 years old, married with five children. Two of whom are in school, she is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Lolita has a firewood retailing business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of firewood to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
As a single parent of three children, Elena works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Elena is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase materials for her business such as, thread, needle, cloth and maintenance for her sewing machine.

Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her business such as, thread, needle, cloth and maintenance for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 50 years old and married with five children.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Gemma is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Gemma has been in this business for 5 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Connie is 41 years old and has four children are currently in school.

Connie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Connie requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fresh fish to sell to her customers.

Connie has been in this business for 7 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fresh fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es:
María, de 28 años de edad, está acompañada, su esposo es motorista y tiene dos hijos que están pequeños.

María, se dedica al comercio de ropa desde hace siete años, ella no tiene un puesto fijo y es por eso que sale casa por casa en su cantón para vender la ropa; este oficio lo aprendió de su madre quien también vende ropa, María, trabaja de 8:00 a.m. a 2:00 p.m.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar ropa interior para mujer y hombre y de esa manera mejorar sus ingresos.

María, sueña con que su negocio crezca y tener un local fijo.
texts.en: María is 28-years old. She is married and her husband is a driver. She has two small children. María has worked in the clothing business for seven years. She does not have a permanent spot so she goes out house-to-house in her canton to sell the clothing. She learned this job from her mother who also sells clothing. María works from 8AM to 2PM. María needs the loan to buy underwear for women and men and this way she can improve her income. María dreams of her business growing and having a permanent shop.

loans.use: to buy underwear for women and men.

loans.name: María Nelis

texts.es:
María de 42 años de edad, está casada y su esposo trabaja en la Policía Nacional Civil, tiene dos hijas que se encuentran estudiando y dependen de María y su esposo.


María se dedica a trabajar de maestra, tiene dos turnos de trabajo, en la mañana atiende a los alumnos mas pequeños y en las tardes a los mas grandes, el trabajo está a 20 minutos de su casa y se va en carro.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar repuestos a su vehículo ya que es su medio de transporte para su trabajo.

Ella espera seguir trabajando con esta institución y darles estudio a sus hijas para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maria is 42 years old and is married. Her husband works for the national civil police. She has two daughters who are in school and depend upon Maria and her husband.

Maria is a teacher and works two shifts. In the mornings she teaches the younger students and in the afternoon, the older students. She works 20 minutes away from her house and goes there by car.

She needs a loan to buy spare parts for her vehicle as it is her mode of transportation to get to work. She hopes to continue working with the institution and provide an education for her daughters so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her vehicle.

loans.name: Maria Aurora

texts.es:
La señora  María Aurora  de  48 años de edad es madre soltera,  vive con su hijo que dependen de ella, tiene casa propia y vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras se dedica desde hace 04  años a la venta de abarrotería.
Doña María Aurora es una mujer honesta y trabajadora en sus ratos libres elabora hamacas y también vende golosinas que es otra fuente de ingresos  es una persona que quiere salir adelante.
Doña María Aurora está solicitando el préstamo para  la compra de azúcar, arroz, huevos, frijoles, queso, harina, papel higiénico, jabones, etc. para surtir su negocio y mejorar su pulpería y aprovechar la época de Navidad y desea tener suficiente productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
Su sueño es mejorar su casa y su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2015
texts.en:
María Aurora, 48 years old, is a single mother. She lives with her son, who depends on her. She has her own house and lives in a community of San Lorenzo, a valley in the south of Honduras. She has worked for 4 years selling groceries.

Miss María Aurora is an honest and hard-working woman. In her spare moments she decorates chairs and also sells candies, which is another source of income. She is a person who wants to advance herself upward.

Miss María Aurora is requesting this loan to buy sugar, rice, eggs, beans, cheese, flour, toilet paper, soaps, etc. to supply her business and improve her food store and take advantage of Christmas season. She wants to have sufficient products to offer her customers.

Her dream is to improve her house and her business.
San Lorenzo, Honduras – November 2015

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, eggs, beans, cheese, flour, toilet paper, soaps, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Rosa Nelly

texts.es:
Rosa de 25 años de edad, actualmente está estudiando bachillerato los fines de semana,está acompañada y su pareja administra un comedor, aún a no tiene hijos pero esperan poder procrear algún día.


Rosa se dedica a vender en un comedor que tienen junto a su pareja, el negocio lo tienen hace varios años el cual está ubicado en casa de la suegra de Rosa y atiende el negocio de 6:00 AM a 7:00 PM.

 
Ella solicita este crédito para comprar pollo, carne, arroz y otros para la elaboración de alimentos que vende en el comedor.

El sueño de Rosa seguir trabajando junto a su pareja y  con el tiempo tener mas clientela y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 25 years old, she is currently attending high school during the weekends. She has a life partner and he runs a diner. They do not have any children yet, but they hope to start a family one day.

Rosa is a retailer, working in the diner she owns together with her partner. They have been running their shop for many years, and it is located in her mother-in-law's house. Rosa works in the shop from 6:00 am to 7:00 pm.

She is requesting a loan to buy chicken, meat, rice and other ingredients to prepare the food she sells in the diner.

Rosa dreams of keep on working with her partner and to get more customers in time, in order to increase her income.

loans.use: buy chicken, meat, rice and other ingredients for her diner.

loans.name: José Alexander

texts.es:
José es un joven de 21 años de edad, estudió hasta 9º grado por las dificultades económicas, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a vender refrescos en la colonia y por las tardes pasteles y enchiladas, ellos viven en casa familiar.


José tiene tres años trabajando con negocio de venta de CD's y videos, y en casa tiene una tienda de productos de 
primera necesidad, su pareja y su madre se dedica a lo mismo y por lo tanto son las únicas que se involucran en el trabajo.
 
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar productos pirotécnicos y fuegos artificiales ya que se se acerca la navidad y quiere estar preparado con la venta.

El sueño de José es tener una mejor tienda mas surtida para tener mejores condiciones de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en: José is a young 21-year old. He went to school until 9th grade because of economic difficulties. He is married and his wife works selling soft drinks in the colony and cakes and enchiladas in the afternoons. They live in a family home. José has been working in the business of selling CDs and videos for 3 years. In his house he has a staple product shop. His wife and mother work doing this as well and therefore they are the only ones involved in the job. He needs the loan to buy pyrotechnic products and fireworks because Christmas is coming up and he wants to be prepared for the sale. José's dream is to have a better supplied store to have better living conditions for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy pyrotechnic products and fireworks because Christmas is coming up and he wants to be prepared for the sale.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, de 80 años de edad, es ganadero y agricultor, está soltero y vive solo con un hijo.

José, se dedica al comercio de ganado desde hace seis años, pero también se dedica a los cultivos de maíz y el lugar donde siembra está a media hora de su casa.

José, necesita el préstamo para comprar ganado, para comercializar y obtener buenos ingresos.  

José, sueña con comprar un pick-up para hacer viajes en la comunidad.
texts.en: José is 80-years old. He is a rancher and farmer. He is single and lives with one son. José has worked selling cattle for six years and he also grows corn in an area half an hour from his house. José needs the loan to buy cattle to sell and get good earnings. José dreams of having a pickup to make trips in the community.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell and get good earnings.

loans.name: Milagro Del Carmen

texts.es:
Milagro, de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está acompañada, su pareja es empleado y aún no tienen hijos.

Milagro, tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa desde hace dos años, en donde vende productos de la canasta básica.

Milagro, necesita el préstamo para comprar arroz, frijoles, café, azúcar, detergentes, entre otros productos para su tienda.

Milagro, sueña con ser madre y poder darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos que la que ella tuvo.
texts.en: Milagro is 23-years old. She went to school until the 7th grade. She is married and her husband is an employee. They do not have children yet. Milagro has had a small store in her home for two years where she sells basic family need products. Milagro needs the loan to buy rice, beans, coffee, sugar, detergent and other products for her store. Milagro dreams of being a mother and being able to give her children a better quality of life than the one that she has had.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, coffee, sugar, detergent and other products for her store.

loans.name: Kyar Ga Yat Village Group

texts.en:
The Kyar Ga Yat Village group members are so grateful with their first loan from Kiva community. Previous loan helped the group members purchase high-quality feeds and ducklings that boosted their income. Some group members could additionally invest at their primary businesses such as planting rice, seasonal vegetables and fruits.
This recycling loan will help 25 group members, at expending their duck businesses through by purchasing additional ducks, ducklings and high quality feeds.

loans.use: of 25 members purchase ducklings and high-quality feeds

loans.name: Eleticia Del Carmen

texts.es: Eleticia de 26 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive al lado de sus hijos de 1 y  8 años de edad. Eleticia es una persona humilde y muy trabajadora quien en busca de mantener la economía del hogar administra una tienda que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado instalar en su vivienda. Debido a que este negocio lo ha administrado desde hace algunos años, ya cuenta con un número de clientes bastante grande y la demanda para sus productos ha aumentado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: aceite, salsas, arroz, azúcar, golosinas, bebidas, etc. para surtir su tienda y así aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Eleticia, 26 years old, is a single mother and lives with her two children of 1 and 8 years of age. Eleticia is a humble and hardworking person. Seeking to maintain the household finances, she tends to a store which she has managed to install in her home with a lot of effort. She already has a large amount of customers since she has been running this business for a few years and demand for her products has increased. This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: oil, sauces, rice, sugar, candies, drinks, etc. to restock her store and thus increase her earnings.

loans.use: to invest in: oil, sauces, rice, sugar, candies, drinks, etc. to restock her store.

loans.name: Anibal De Jesus

texts.es:
Anibal, de 27 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está soltero y vive con su abuela.

Anibal, se dedica a comercializar pan desde hace dos años, y fue gracias a un amigo como pudo aprender a elaborar pan; pero aparte de eso también trabaja en una taquería y él pan lo vende casa por casa. 

Anibal, necesita el préstamo para construir un horno artesanal y comprar una motocicleta, para salir a vender el pan.

Anibal, sueña con tener una panadería más grande y así tener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Anibal is 27 years old and has a high school education. He is single and lives with his grandmother.

Anibal works selling bread and has done so for the past two years. A friend taught him how to make bread but, aside from that, he also works in a taquería and he sells bread door to door.

Anibal needs a loan to build an artisan oven and to buy a motorcycle to use to go out and sell bread. Anibal dreams of having a bigger bakery and in this way, generate a greater profit.

loans.use: to build an artisan oven and to buy a motorcycle to use to go out and sell bread.

loans.name: José Dalvis

texts.es: José es un comerciante de 29 años que se encuentra comprometido, él es padre de un niño de 7 años de edad y emprendió su negocio un almacén misceláneo en el año 2007, con el que le ha brindado el sustento a su cónyuge e hijo y también a sus padres. Con sus ahorros inició su negocio y con tan solo unas vitrinas y escaso surtido empezó a realizar sus primeras ventas, poco a poco su negocio ha crecido y se ha dado a conocer en una localidad del municipio de Soledad en donde diariamente sus clientes ingresan a partir de las 7:30 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m.  José maneja un amplio surtido de productos; prendas de vestir, calzado, juguetes, papelería, comestibles y detalles para toda ocasión.  En la actualidad José desea aprovechar la temporada que se avecina e incrementar sus inventarios, es por ello que realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar ropa, calzado y mercancías varias. Su meta a futuro es tener un almacén más grande y continuar apoyando a sus padres.
texts.en:
