Jose is a 29-year-old businessman who is engaged and is the father of a 7-year-old son. He started his business, a general store, in 2007. This business has provided for his partner and son as well as his parents.

He used his savings to start his business and, with only a few display cases and a few products, began to make his first sales. Little by little, his business has grown and he has become known in a storefront in the city of Soledad where he has clients daily between 7:30 am and 6:00 pm.

Jose's store is well stocked with clothes, shoes, toys, stationary, groceries, and gifts for every occasion. Presently, Jose hopes to capitalize on the approaching season and increase his inventory. This is why he is asking for a Kiva loan, an opportunity to be connected to a financial institution through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, to buy clothes, shoes, and other varied merchandise.

His goal for the future is to have a larger store and to continue to support his parents.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and varied merchandise.

loans.name: Yeme  Faustine

texts.fr: Yeme est une femme mariée avec un enfant à charge qui vit à Tokoin. Yeme est une revendeuse de friperies qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend dans les quartiers environnant. Pour avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit, Yeme sollicite ce prêt pour commander des unités d’habits et de pantalons de friperies en vue de bien revendre puis de répondre à nombreuse attentes de ses clients afin de gagner des bénéfices et aider son enfant dans son éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Yeme is a married woman with one dependent child, who lives in Tokoin. She is a retail merchant of used clothing who resupplies twice a month from the market and resells in the surrounding neighborhoods.

Yeme is seeking this loan to build up a large inventory and maximize her profits. She will place orders for sets of used clothing and pants for resale in response to her customers' numerous requests, so that she can achieve profits and help with her child's education.

loans.use: buy 43 sets of second-hand clothing and 44 pairs of second-hand pants

loans.name: Wara Wara De Los Andes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “WARA WARA DE LOS ANDES” iniciará el décimo tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Alicia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de comida, venta de coca, venta de cosméticos, venta de fruta, venta de verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Alicia es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio tejido y venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de un familiar y decidió emprender su propio negocio hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de el Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "WARA WARA DE LOS ANDES" communal bank will begin its tenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, and is part of the Los Andes central office. The group is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors, headed by Alicia, the president. The business activities that the members of the association carry out are varied and include the sale of blankets, food, coca leaves, cosmetics, fruit and vegetables. The loan that they are taking out will benefit small microentrepreneurs such as Alicia.

Alicia states that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago, after being invited by a friend who is a client of the organisation. She currently has a business making and selling blankets. She states that she learnt this business from a family member and decided to start her own business a number of years ago.

The current loan will be used to increase her capital (to purchase yarn wholesale). She will buy it from the wholesalers in the city of El Alto and then use it to manufacture and later sell the products at her store. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family financially, as she is married and has 2 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the healthcare and training that the organisation offers.

loans.use: to purchase yarn wholesale

loans.name: Emilly

texts.en:
Emilly is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years.

Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to have a big shop within 5 years.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia, age 41, married and has two children; ages four and three years old. Her husband works at a construction site, and Alicia needs to work hard to help him support the family. To earn an income, she makes and sells mat. The family lives in the city of Baybay.

Alicia has been making and selling mats for twenty years, and she wishes to improve her business in order to enhance her earnings to better sustain her family's needs and start other business opportunities like starting up a sari-sari (variety) store. She requested a loan in order to buy raw materials needed for making mats, specifically “buri” leaves and assorted dye. (Buri is the largest palm in the Philippines.) This “buri” is being dried (under the heat of the sun) and dye to make it more colorful. In this way, she will be able to improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed for making mats, specifically “buri” leaves and assorted dye.

loans.name: Crezeil

texts.en:
Crezeil is 42 years old and married with five children, four of whom are still in school, Crezeil works very hard to provide for them.

Crezeil runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, milk, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, shampoo and snack foods.

Crezeil has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future Crezeil would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, shampoo and snack foods.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara is 63 years old and married with five children.

She is in an agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Barbara is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Barbara has been in this business for 5 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 44 years old and married with three children.  With one child in school, Mary Ann works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Ann has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for twelve years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, spices, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Mary Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a married woman, 59 years old with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Rosemarie has a foos vending business in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a PHP 14000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, milk and other materials for her food production business.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 6 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, milk and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Celio Antonio

texts.es:
Celio, de 33 años de edad, es un hombre muy versátil, estudió hasta bachillerato, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los cuidados del hogar y viven junto a sus 2 hijos.

Celio, desde que tenía 13 años de edad, emigro a Estados Unidos en donde estudió y llegó a trabajar en distintos empleos, luego por petición de sus padres regresa a su país natal, con el objetivo de vivir y cuidar de la casa familiar, la cual se encontraba en abandono, estando en el país y con ayuda de un tío aprendió la agricultura y el cuidado de animales para engorde, lo cual hasta la fecha es su principal fuente de ingresos.

Celio, necesita el préstamo para comprar dos novillas para engordarlas y preñarlas cuando estén grandes y de esta manera abastecerse con la leche que produzcan.

Celio, sueña con seguir ampliando su grupo de animales, para que su negocio siga creciendo y a través de eso pueda darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Celio is 33 years old and he a very versatile man who studied up to high school. He has a life partner who takes care of their household, and they live together with their 2 children.

When he was 13, Celio emigrated to the United States, where he studies and did different jobs. At his parents' request, he then came back to his homeland, planning to live in an care for his family house, as it was in a state of neglect. Living in his country, he learned how to engage in agriculture and in livestock fattening thanks to his uncle; to today, this remains his main source of income.

Celio is requesting a loan to buy two heifers to fatten them and then impregnate them once they come to the right age, in order to stock himself up with the milk they will produce.

Celio dreams of keep on increasing the number of his animals, in order for his activity to keep on growing, thus succeeding in granting his children a better standard of living.

loans.use: buy two heifers.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 46-year-old married mother of four. Eight years ago, she started selling her handmade crafts to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She is very creative and talented. Crafts is her hobby and she really enjoys it.

Fatima is working hard to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate and redecorate her shop to attract more customers. She hopes to keep on expanding her business to increase her income and stay capable of providing her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate and redecorate her shop to attract more customers

loans.name: Flor De Haba Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE HABA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Domitila es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de queso, venta de manta, venta de zapatos, venta de helados, venta de frazadas, venta de ropa, venta de comida.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Domitila es integrante, ella indica que integra Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de manta; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de mantas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “FLOR DE HABA” communal bank will begin its second cycle in Pro Mujer, as a part of the Los Andes Focal Center. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors, of which Domitila is the President. The business that the members of the communal bank have are varied. Among them are: selling cheese, selling blankets, selling shoes, selling ice cream, selling bedspreads, selling clothes, and selling food.

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-businesswomen, including Domitila. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. At present, she has a business selling manta. She reports that she started this business several years ago on her own initiative.

The loan she will take out will increase her capital by buying blankets wholesale. She will acquire them from the wholesalers in the city of El Alto and later sell them in er sales space. This work allows her to generate income to support her family financially, since she is in a common law marriage and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the trainings and the area of health that the institution offfers.

loans.use: to buy blankets wholesale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years.

Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 35,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is indeed encouraged for the continuous support from KIVA and its good hearted lenders to sustain her poultry and ducks business. Her poultry income has helped fund her College, High School and Elementary children's education. Her jeepney's public service, which her husband drives, is doing good also.

To buy feeds for her chicken and duck poultry and to regularly maintain her jeepney, she trusts that she can again request a PHP 30,000 loan. It is very important to raise healthy chickens and to regularly maintain her jeepney to ensure safe and efficient service, in order to generate a stable income. She values her businesses for they are the only source of income to feed her family and send her children to school.

Ma. Theresa dreams to expand her poultry farm and add more jeepneys to adequately provide for her children's education, as it is their hope to uplift their lives. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for feeds for chicken poultry and for maintenance of her jeepney as well.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria, who is in her early 40s is a widow with two grown up children. She has been running a general store for seven years now. She works from 7am to 9pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on the store inventory and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan. She used the profit to repay loan, to take care of her family,built her house and covered household expenses. She really appreciate Kiva's support, her life has changed. With the new credit request, She will use to buy the fast moving items in the general store(maize and baking flour, cooking oil, rice, soaps and many more). She dreams of opening another general store.

Victoria will be accountable for paying back the loan as per schedule.

loans.use: to buy the fast moving items in the general store.

loans.name: Lucilla

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Lucila works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines.  Lucila is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sells.

Lucila has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Roselia

texts.en:
Roselia is a woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Roselia is 35 years old and five of her  children are in school.

Roselia has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Roselia requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more gallons, of coconut wine to sell.

Roselia has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Roselia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more gallons, of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Cristine

texts.en:
Cristine is 37 years old, married, and has two children who are still in school.

Cristine is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Cristine has been in this business for 4 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cristine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Elma Flor

texts.en:
Elma Flor is 62 years old, married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Elma Flor has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Elma Flor requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

Elma Flor has been in this business for three years. In the future, Elma Flor would like to save enough money in order to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maricel is 40 years old and has three children are still in school.

Maricel has a food vending business in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, pork, spices and other materials for her food production business.

Maricel has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, pork, spices and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 52 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom is still in school.

Jane is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Sheane requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Jane has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jane would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marissa is 45 years old and has four children who are in school.

Marissa has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Marissa requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Marissa has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a widowed woman, 57 years old with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Victoria has a fishing business in the Philippines. Victoria requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish net, bamboo and gasoline for her boat.

Victoria has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish net, bamboo and gasoline for her boat

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie is 32 years old and has three children. Lenie is married and has two children are currently in school.

Lenie is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Lenie requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lenie has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lenie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Edwin Alexander

texts.es:
Edwin de 30 años d edad,  estudió noveno, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a vender ropa para todos las edades, no tienen hijos por el momento y viven en casa propia.


Edwin ya tiene varios años de trabajar en una agencia de telefonía en la ciudad, fue la necesidad de salir adelante que lo llevó a realizar este trabajo y porque no encontró otras opciones de empleo, él viaja de lunes a domingo ya que trabaja todos los días.
 
Él necesita este crédito para comprar camisas, blusas, pantalones, ropa interior, etc. ya que se acerca la época navideña y la ropa es lo que más se vende.

Él sueña con tener un puesto estable de venta de ropa con su esposa y tener mas variedad para aumentar la clientela.
texts.en:
Edwin is 30 years of age. He studied until ninth grade and has a partner. His partner makes a living selling clothing for all ages. They do not have children and they live in their own home.

Edwin has worked for a number of years for a telephone company in the city. He got this job because he needed to earn a living and he did not have other employment options. He travels from Monday to Sunday because he works everyday.

He needs this loan in order to purchase items such as shirts, blouses, pants and underwear as the Christmas season is coming and this is the type of clothing that is most in demand.

He dreams of having a stable clothing store with his wife and to offer more variety of products so that they can increase the number of customers.

loans.use: to purchase items such as shirts, blouses, pants and underwear to prepare for the busy Christmas season.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a married woman. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 21,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will have a big shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital. She will use the 21,000 KES loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. She also does farming.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is a married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be industrious.

She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high cost of products.

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Eustaquio

texts.es:
Eustaquio con 48 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia, junto a su cónyuge y su hijo, en el distrito de Buenos Aires,provincia de Morropon,departamento de Piura,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes es esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la producción y venta de plátano para exportación, contando con 1 hectárea de cultivo,con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 05 años. El destino del crédito será para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción, para mejorar casa. De eta manera le ayudará a tener un mejor calidad de vida y brindar un mejor servicio.

Eustaquio es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Eustaquio, 48 years old, is in a common law marriage and lives in his own house with his spouse and son in the Buenos Aires district in the Morropon province, in the Piura department of Peru. He has very good references, as many personal as professional from residents in the area. The habitants of this place work primarily in agriculture, commerce, and ranching.

He works in the production and sale of banana exports, and has 1 hectare of crops and more than 5 years experience in this field. The loan will be used to invest in the purchase of construction materials to improve his home. In this way it will help him to have a better quality of life and provide a better service.

Eustaquio is a recurring member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of construction materials.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 42 years old and married with nine children, three of whom are still in school. Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, milk, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, shampoo and snack foods.

Josephine has been in this business for 7 years. In the future Josephine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, shampoo and snack foods.

loans.name: Rolanda

texts.en:
Rolanda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rolanda is 44 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Rolanda has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase fish net, bamboo and other materials for her business.

Rolanda has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fish net, bamboo and other materials for her business

loans.name: Rosebeth

texts.en:
Rosebeth is 35 years old and single with one child.

Rosebeth is in the agricultural business – pig fattening in the Philippines. Rosebeth has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. Rosebeth requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

In the future, Rosebeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Kilangalanga Group

texts.en:
AMINA is in her late 30's and single with four schooling children. She has been running a grocery store for four years now. She works from 06 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be AMINA's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this to buy the best selling drinks in the store. She dreams of expanding her business into a pub business.

Amina will share this loan with her loan group, KILANGALANGA, which consists of nine people who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the best selling  drinks in the store.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is 40 years old and is managing a junkshop business in her village. She has four children who are attending school. For her to sustain her children's needs, Rizalina has to buy more scrap metals and used bottles to have enough income.

In this regard, Rizalina wanted to borrow P50,000 to buy more bottles, plastics, and scrap metal. After buying recycled materials, Rizalina sells them to the buyer for a higher price.

She knew that it would be a difficult kind of business, but she will do whatever she can for the future of her children. She will use her earnings for their education.

loans.use: to buy more bottles, plastics and scrap metal.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en: Purity is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital. She will use the 60,000 KES loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. She hopes that in the future she will own a supermarket. She also does farming of beans and maize.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services.

She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of beauty products. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy beauty salon equipment.

She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to expand more.

loans.use: to buy beauty salon equipment

loans.name: Lennox

texts.en:
Lennox is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be hardworking.

He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, eggs, flour, and other items. He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock.

He will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap, and other items.

His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to open another business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap, and other items.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa supports the family through her fishing business in the Philippines.

The accompanying photo shows Marissa with her son Micky, who is 16 years old and is the third of three children in the family.

Marissa is borrowing 4,550 PHP to pay the tuition fees of Micky, who is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Hotel and Restaurant Management. Micky is currently in his first year of this four-year course.

When he graduates, Micky plans to be a chef and help his family.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fees.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte supports the family through her fishing business in the Philippines.

The accompanying photo shows Charlotte with her son Charlone, who is 22 years old and is the first of four children in the family.

Charlotte is borrowing 15,000 PHP to pay the tuition fees of Charlone, who is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Marine Engineering. Charlone is currently in his third year of this three-year course.

When he graduates, Charlone plans to be a seaman and help his mother send his younger siblings to finish college as well.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fees.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 48 years old, married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Mary Jane has a firewood retailing business in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of firewood to sell.

Mary Jane has been in this business for three years. In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money in order to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Esbie

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Esbie works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Esbie is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy more sea foods to sell to customers.

Esbie has been sustaining her business activities through her past  loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio es un microempresario de 47 años dedicado al expendio de verduras en un puesto ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de Barranquilla, él es padre de dos hijas de 24 y 15 años y aunque se encuentra separado de su compañera sentimental cumple con su rol de padre. Él inició su negocio hace 18 años, sin embargo la forma en la que comercializaba las verduras era totalmente distinta, él recorría los diferentes barrios del municipio ofreciéndoles sus productos a las amas de casa y en la actualidad tiene un puesto estacionario en donde llegan sus clientes a realizar sus compras y por ser una plaza de mercado, constantemente existe gran afluencia de personas. Julio desea aprovisionarse de verduras para responder oportunamente al incremento en la demanda de fin de año, puesto que por tradición las familiar preparan platos típicos que contienen muchas verduras, y por ello  realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar zanahorias, tomate, pepino, pimentón y toda una gama de vegetales que se venden con frecuencia en esta fecha. Julio desea a largo plazo lograr ubicarse en un local comercial y realizar adecuaciones a su vivienda.
texts.en: Julio is a micro entrepreneur aged 47, who runs a small vegetables shop located in the center of the town of Barranquilla. He has two daughters aged 24 and 15, and he is compliant to his father role even thought he is separated from his partner. He started his activity 18 years ago, even though he would sell vegetables in a very different way. Back then, he would walk around the different neighborhoods of his town, selling his products to housewives, while now he owns a stall customers come to in order to buy his products; as it is located on a market square, there is always a great number of people. Julio wants to stock himself up with vegetables in order to properly meet the increasing amount of end-of-the-year requests. In fact, according to tradition, families prepare the typical dishes, which need many vegetables. For this reason, he saw a chance to enter the financial world and requested a loan to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will buy carrots, tomatoes, cucumbers and paprika, as well as a wide variety of vegetables normally sold at this time of the year. In the long run, Julio wants to set his activity in a commercial building and to make improvements to his house.

loans.use: buy carrots, tomatoes, cucumbers and paprika.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 27 years old, married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Helen has a food vending business in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Helen has been in this business for six years. In the future, Helen would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 62 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Violeta has run a general store in the Philippines for five years. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, shampoo, and snack foods.

In the future, Violeta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, shampoo, and snack foods.

loans.name: Yei Fernando

texts.es: Yei es un joven de 20 años con una gran proyección de vida, él es un emprendedor que inició su negocio cuando se encontraba en prácticas empresariales y encontró oportunidad de negocio entre sus amigos de trabajo al ofrecerles ropa y calzado. Posteriormente decidió formalizar su negocio y compró tres vitrinas con el apoyo de su padre quien le ayudó a terminar de adecuar y surtir el local en el que aperturó su almacén misceláneo. En la actualidad cuenta con tres años de funcionamiento y comercializa un gran número de artículos y detalles para toda ocasión, maquillaje, bisutería, accesorios para el cabello, prendas de vestir, calzado y bebidas. Él realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar surtido de ropa, calzado, maquillaje, bisutería, accesorios para el cabello, artículos que son de gran demanda para la temporada de fin de año.  Yei es soltero y su meta a futuro es terminar de construir su vivienda en un lote de su propiedad y apoyar a sus hermanos en sus estudios.
texts.en: Yei is a 20 year old man who has a big life project. He is a business man who started his business when he found himself in business apprenticeships and found a business opportunity with his work friends when offering them clothes and shoes. Later, he decided to formalize his business and he bought three display cases. With the support of his father, who helped him set up and stock the locale, he opened his miscellaneous store. Now he has been running his business for three years and he sells a large number of items for all occasions, as well as make-up, jewelry, hair accessories, clothing, shoes, and beverages. He applied for a Kiva loan, an opportunity to become connected to the financial life through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He did this to buy some inventory of clothing, shoes, makeup, jewelry, and hair accessories, which are in great demand for the end of year season. Yei in single and his goal for the future is to finish building his home on a lot he owns and help with his siblings' education.

loans.use: to inventory of clothing, shoes, makeup, jewelry, and hair accessories.

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel is a 49-year-old married man who lives in Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Angel always wants the best for his family. So he engaged in a transport business to provide for his family's needs.

He is also engaged in farming, especially in Corn production. He aims for a better income because of the needs and demands of his family.

Therefore, Angel decided to take a loan to buy motor parts for motorcycle maintenance so that he can continue to cater to more passengers that will create greater income. Angel's plan for the future is to buy a new motorcycle for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for motor maintenace.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 8 years.

Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of clothes.

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable.

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand more.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man. He has 3 children. He operates a retail business where he sells watches, wallets, and other items. He has been involved in this business for 2 years.

His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the Kes 55,000 loan to buy more stock of watches, wallets and other items. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable.

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of watches, wallets and other items

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth supports the family through her fishing business in the Philippines.

The accompanying photo shows Elizabeth with her son, Jonel, who is 20 years old and is the first of five children in the family.

Elizabeth is borrowing 25,000 PHP to pay Jonel's tuition fees. He is studying for a Bachelor of Science degree in Marine Transportation. Jonel is currently in the third year of this three year course.

When he graduates, Jonel plans to be a seaman and help his mother send his younger siblings to finish college as well.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 4 years.

Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of milk. Her business goal is to have a large milk distribution centre within 5 years.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of milk

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a single man. He has 2 children. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 3 years.

His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Qhantati Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “QHANTATI” iniciará el décimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mauricia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de gorras de lana, venta de mantas, venta de carteras, venta de joyas, venta de mantillas, servicio de construcción, venta de mochilas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Mauricia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de carteras; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió con el apoyo de su esposo hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de carteras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de Oruro y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
“Qhantati” (Sunrise) is a Communal Bank that will start its eleventh cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Community Center. It is composed of eight members, guided by a directive board presided over by Mauricia. The member of the Communal Bank engage in different activities such as selling woolen caps, selling blankets, selling wallets, selling jewels, selling baby clothes, providing construction services, selling rucksacks.

Mauricia is one of the micro entrepreneurs of this group, and she will benefit from the requested loan. She says that she has become a member of Pro Mujer one year ago, having been invited by a friend who is a member of the institution. She currently sells wallets, and she says she started this activity may years ago thanks to her husband's support.

The loan she is now requesting will be used to buy wallets at wholesale price; she will buy them from wholesalers in the town of Oruro, to then sells them in her shop. This type of activity helps her earning an income to economically support her family, as she is married and has a son.

When asked about what she likes of Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the healthcare and the seminars provided by the institution.

loans.use: buy wallets at wholesale price.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 32 years old and widowed with four children. With all of them in school, Cheryl works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional buy items to sell, like eggs, biscuits, soft drinks and other products.

Cheryl has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items. In the future, Cheryl would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store, like eggs, biscuits, soft drinks and other products.

loans.name: Suleima Isabel

texts.es: Suleima de 42 años es una emprendedora mujer que durante años se ha desempeñado en diferentes roles de la vida y ante todo lo más importante siempre ha sido su familia.  Ella  laboró como auxiliar de oficios varios, posteriormente viajó a Venezuela y regresó a Colombia donde actualmente labora en un restaurante y también comercializa productos de belleza a sus compañeros de trabajo.  Ella se incorporó a una empresa de ventas por catálogos brasilera que le ofrece unos innovadores productos, los cuales son muy acogidos por sus clientes y como su capital no es suficiente para abastecer la demanda, realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar maquillajes, colonias, cremas hidratantes, y tratamientos anti envejecimiento.  Con esta inversión sus utilidades serán mucho mayor y su familia gozará de mejores beneficios.  El sueño de Suleima es tener casa propia.
texts.en: Suleima, 42 years old, is a female entrepreneur who over the years has held different roles in life, and before all else, the most important thing has always been her family.  She worked as an assistant in various offices.  Subsequently, she traveled to Venezuela and returned to Colombia where she currently works in a restaurant and also sells beauty products to her coworkers.  She started a company that sells products from Brazilian catalogs, which offers her innovative products, which are welcomed by her customers.  Since her capital is not sufficient to meet demand, she completed a loan application, an opportunity to link herself to finances through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy makeup, cologne, hydrating creams, and anti-aging treatments.  With this investment her profits will be much better and her family will enjoy better benefits.  Suleima’s dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy makeup, cologne, hydrating creams, and anti-aging treatments.

loans.name: María Pastora

texts.es:
María de 40 años de edad, estudió hasta 9º grado, está acompañada y su pareja es comerciante, tiene dos hijos que ya asisten a la escuela y dependen de María y su esposo.


María se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas como faldas, blusas, sostenes, etc. y su esposo vende ropa para caballeros como pantalones, bóxeres, calzonetas, etc. María aprendió el negocio debido a la necesidad económica que tenían en ese momento y se siente alegre de que le haya ido bien, el horario de trabajo es de 8:00 AM a 2:00 PM.

 
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar faldas, blusas, sostenes,  pantalones, bóxeres, calzonetas, etc para continuar con el comercio de ropa.

Ella sueña con tener un puesto estable donde vender su ropa y  comprar mas para obtener mejores ingresos económicos y  espera contar con el apoyo de esta institución.
texts.en:
María is 40 years old. She went to school up to the 9th grade. She is married and her spouse is a merchant. She has two children and they are in school. They depend on María and her husband.

María sells clothes for women such as skirts, blouses, bras, etc. Her husband sells clothing for men, such as pants, boxers, underwear, etc. María learned the business out of financial necessity that they had at that time. She is happy that it is going well for them. Her work schedule is from 8:00 AM to 2:00 PM.

 
She needs the loan to buy skirts, blouses, bras, pants, boxers, underwear, etc., to continue with the clothes selling business. 

She dreams of having a stable place where she can sell her clothing and buy more to have better income. She hopes to have support from this institution.

loans.use: to buy skirts, blouses, bras, pants, boxers, underwear, etc., to continue with her clothing business.

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita is a widowed woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Sherlita is 57 years old now.

She has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell, like slippers, dresses, etc.

Sherlita has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like slippers, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Baiel

texts.en:
Baiel is a freshman in the software engineering program at the American University of Central Asia (AUCA). He lives with his father and brother. At the age of nine, his family lost his mother to a serious illness. Baiel doesn’t like to remember those days, because it became too hard to live without a sun in their family, everything seemed foolish and uninteresting. Thanks to the moral support of his family and relatives, as well as friends at school, he overcame, continued his studies, and started to understand that education is one of the most important things in life.

Baiel searched for a good university and was told a lot about AUCA. Its international atmosphere and unique spirit attracted him. He liked its modern educational system, taught in English; its new high-tech, qualified professors; and its rich library. Baiel was happy to find such a nice place for his higher education, but became worried about tuition fees. As his father is the only income earner in the family, it is very difficult for him to pay for his son’s tuition fee by himself. Baiel applied for financial aid from AUCA and received some. So, having the chance to get a deferred loan from Kiva, he hurried to apply for it.

Kiva loans are a great solution for helping AUCA students cover their tuition fees. They are provided on an interest-free basis and can be paid back after graduation. Among Kyrgyzstani banks or microcredit organizations can’t be found such an organization, which can totally support students in their endeavors for higher education.

loans.use: to pay for his bachelor's degree in the software engineering program at the American University of Central Asia.

loans.name: Sarim

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Sarim is 46 years old and a married mother of three dependent children, two of whom are in school and need better support for their studies.

Weaving mat has been her main business for over ten years. Due to having not enough capital to keep on supporting her son’s studying while he pursues his bachelor degree in Engineering, she is now applying for a Kiva loan via VisionFund to pay her son’s tuition fees.

She actually hopes that her son will be able to complete his studying and get a highly paid job.

loans.use: to pay her son’s tuition fees. He is pursuing his bachelor degree in Engineering.

loans.name: Mujeres De La Zona K Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “MUJERES DE LA ZONA K” conformada por 06 socios. Este es el caso de Carmen de 41 años de edad soltera con 3 hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de salchipapas (comida peruana) desde hace más de 1 año que tiene dicho negocio. Su mayor deseo es de poder ampliar su negocio. Solicito el crédito para la compra de papas salchichas y lechuga. El grupo “mujeres de la zona k” está agradecido con las personas de kiva que hicieron posible este crédito, pues le permite seguir mejorando. Carmen es la primero del lado izquierdo viste camisa color celeste se encuentra sentada.
texts.en:
This is the new 'Women from Zone K' group, made up of six members.

Carmen, who is 41 years of age, is single and has three children. She earns a living selling salchipapas (a Peruvian dish with hotdog and fries). Her greatest wish is to be able to grow her business. She is requesting the loan in order to purchase potatoes, sausages and lettuce.

The 'Women from Zone K' group appreciates the Kiva donors who have made this loan possible, and who allow them to continue to improve. Carmen is the first on the left in the photo - she is wearing a blue shirt and is sitting down.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, sausages and lettuce.

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en:
Teresiah is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables.

She has been involved in this business for 13 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock.

She will use the Kes 75,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits. She hopes that in the future, the family will have improved living standards.

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to add more of a variety of products.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Melvis Yaneth

texts.es:
La señora Melvis de 46  años de edad,  no tiene   hijos   que dependan  de ella, vive en su casa de un familiar que está ubicada en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras.
Doña Melvis se dedica desde hace mas de 03 años al negocio de venta de abarrotería, refrescos, golosinas entre otros y sus clientes son los estudiantes amigos y vecinos de su comunidad que a diario le visitan, es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante con su familia.
Doña Melvis está solicitando el préstamo para compra blusas, faldas, vestidos, camisas, pantalones, etc.  ya que quiere empezar con este nuevo negocio porque varios de sus clientes ya le han hecho este tipo de pedidos y quiere aprovechar la época navideña.
Con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su negocio porque tendrá más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes su sueño es mejorar su negocio y tener su casa propia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2015
texts.en:
Melvis is 46 years old, she has no children depending on her, and she lives in the house of a relative located in the town of San Lorenzo, in southern Honduras.

Melvis has been engaging in running a grocery store for more than 3 years, selling soft drinks, sweets and other products. He customers are students, friends and neighbors of her area who daily go to her shop. She is a hardworking woman wishing to see her family progress.

Melvis is requesting a loan to buy blouses, skirts, dresses, shirts and trousers to start with a new activity: many among her customers have already requested this kind of products and she wants to take advantage of the upcoming Christmas season.

Thanks to this loan, she wishes to improve her income as well as her shop, as she will have more products to offer to her customers. She dreams of make improvements to her shop and to live in her own house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2015

loans.use: buy blouses, skirts, dresses, shirts and trousers

loans.name: Deliro

texts.es:
Delirio con 37 años de edad,de estado civil soltero, vive junto a su familia, en el distrito de Oyotún,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú, en una zona rural. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a brindar servicios de carpintería, contando con herramientas propias, con más de 06 años de experiencia en el negocio, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para arreglos de vivienda y compra de material de carpintería-madera, dicha inversión le servirá para realizar trabajos de madera y poder tener en stock artículos de madera, con gran influencia en el negocio; cliente piensa mejorar productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona.

Delirio es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha tenido dos créditos de S/.1000,00 y S/.1000,00 los cuáles lo a cancelado de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Delirio is 37 years old and single. He lives with his family in the district of Oyotún, province of Chiclayo, deparment of Lambayeque, country of Perú, in a rural area. He has very good references, both personal and professional, from the local people. The inhabitants of that community mostly work in agriculture, retail and livestock.

He provides carpentry services using his own tools. He has over six years of experience in this line of work and his business is located in his own home. He requests this loan so that he can provide home repair services and purchase carpentry supplies such as wood. This investment will allow him to do woodwork and stock up on wood products, which will greatly influence his business. Delirio hopes to improve productivity in his services and therefore be able to meet the diverse needs of his local customers.

Delirio is a recurring client of Edpyme Alternativa. He has taken loans for 1,000 PEN and 1,000 PEN, both of which he repaid in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to provide home repair services and to purchase carpentry supplies such as wood.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela thanks Kiva and the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for their tireless financial and moral support of her livelihood. She has received a number of loans, which helped grow her farm and thus provide income to feed her children and send them to school.

To sustain a productive harvest, she is again seeking assistance in the amount of 25,000 PHP to pay for more farm seedlings, fertilizer, and labor. Although her farm suffers when hit by typhoons, she trusts the sun rises again and gives new life and renewed hope for better days.

Miguela prays for a plentiful harvest, to acquire a bigger farm, and for her children to finish school. She faithfully meets up every week with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for farm seedlings, fertilizer, and labor for a productive pineapple harvest.

loans.name: Je-An

texts.en:
Je-an is a woman with one child in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Je-an is 29 years old now. Je-an has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines.

Je-an requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like shorts, t-shirts, etc. Je-an has been in this business for 9 years.

In the future, Je-an would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shorts, t-shirts, etc.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.ru: Чамила благодарить Вас за Вашу доброту. Она успешно закончила ремонт. Чамила рада, что есть люди которые поддерживает ее. Она продвигает свою работу. У нее увеличилось количество клиентов. Чамила нравится когда ее клиенты радуется. Она во дворе построила дом. И дом остается без штукатурки, стяжки и без краски. Чамила решила взять кредит и купить стройматериалы (цемент, алебастр, краски, обои, люстра) и другие принадлежности. Она верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку. Чамила надеется на Вас.
texts.en:
Jamila is thankful for you and your kindness. She has successfully finished her repairs. Jamila is glad that there are people who will support her.

Jamila is advancing in her work. Her number of clients has increased. Jamila likes when her clients are happy. She has built a house in her yard, but the house still needs plaster, braces, and it needs paint.

Jamila decided to take out a loan to buy construction materials (cement, plaster, paint, wallpaper, and lights), and other necessities. She trusts in you and your support. Jamila relies on you.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 52 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Nenita works very hard to provide for them.

Nenita has a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell. Nenita has been in this business for six years, and sells a variety of items such as sugar, shampoo, noodles, canned goods and other groceries.

In the future Nenita would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a 52-year-old married woman with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Lorena has had a fishing business in the Philippines for two years. Lorena requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fish netting, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.

In the future, Lorena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish netting, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 56 years old and married with six children. She is in agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Vilma is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers, vegetable seeds and other farm supplies.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Vilma has been in this business for five years, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, vegetable seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Joevelyn

texts.en:
Eight years ago, 28-year-old Joevelyn got married and started her own business. She owns a sari-sari (variety) store, where she sells varieties of goods. She has been doing this to help her husband in raising their children.

They have two young children to support. Their children are eight and six years old. Joevelyn’s only wish in life is to become a successful businesswoman someday. All of this is for her children. She wants to give them a better life, and enable them to finish their studies.

To do this, she needs a loan to buy commodities that will help her augment her earnings. She needs to purchase items such as biscuits, candies, chips, bread, juice, toiletries, spices, eggs, noodles, cooking oil, canned goods and drinks. Aside from this, she also wants to buy frozen goods to sell.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, candies, chips, bread, juice, toiletries, spices, eggs, noodles, cooking oil, canned goods and drinks and frozen goods.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is married and has two grown children. She resides in Getafe, Bohol. She has been a farmer for a long time. She owns rice paddies and sells her rice to locals. She faces challenges in her livelihood: lack of capital and the high cost of farm maintenance.

Cristita wants to buy fertilizer and pesticides. These would help her improve the yield on her farm. This would help her to provide for her family's needs and to expand her farm to become more sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle, 47, is married with six children. Four of her children are enrolled in school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from fish vending.

Anabelle is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs. She works tirelessly toward attaining her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel works hard to support four children. She is married, and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Annabel requested a PHP 10,400 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Annabel is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money. She is also helping the environment and reducing health hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred, 40, is married with five children, four who are presently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years.

Mildred has requested a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy assorted fresh fish to sell. She would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es:
Rosa de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta 5° grado, actualmente está casada y su esposo reside en Estados Unidos, ella vive con sus tres hijos los cuales los mayores van a la escuela; en su casa Rosa es la persona que lleva el sustento para su familia ademas de recibir ayuda de su esposo que viven en el extranjero.


Rosa se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace varios años, dicha actividad la aprendió de su mamá ya que ella tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta misma actividad.- Rosa sale a vender todos los días de la semana a la ciudad en la plaza, un lugar donde se comercializan muchos productos; ella recorre una distancia de cinco kilómetros en autobús para llegar hasta su lugar de trabajo.


El presente crédito Rosa lo utilizará para comprar mas ropa como blusas, camisas, licras, topa interior shorts, etc. para continuar trabajando.

Rosa con lo que mas sueña es con ver crecer a todos sus hijos y darles una buena educación para que sean personas de bien en su futuro.- Con el presente crédito Rosa incrementará sus ventas porque ampliará su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is 37 years old and has a fifth grade education. She is currently married and her husband lives in the United States. She lives with her three children who are older and are all in school. In her home, Rosa is the person who provides for her family along with the help she receives from her husband who lives abroad.

Rosa has worked selling clothing for many years. She learned this business from her mother who has also spent many years in this type of business. Rosa goes out to sell every day of week in the plaza in the city, an area where many products are sold. She travels five kilometers by bus to get to her place of work.

Rosa is asking for a loan that she will use to buy more clothing including blouses, shirts, leggings, underwear, shorts, etc. to continue working. What Rosa dreams of most is to see her children grow up and to give them a good education so that they can be good people in the future. With this loan, Rosa will increase her sales and be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing including blouses, shirts, leggings, underwear, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a married woman with one child. She describes herself as humble. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes and clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of shoes. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is a wise woman, who is engaged in different businesses. She is married, and has two grade school children.

Florenda is engaged in the retailing business. She has her sari-sari store and bakery beside the house. While managing her store, Florenda and her husband also sell meats, fish and vegetables around the villages. Her aspiration is to have a dry goods business such as a clothing store.

Florenda is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy grocery items to sell. She will also use her loan to buy flour, sugar, and other ingredients for making breads.

Florenda hopes for the continued growth of the business for the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes con 58 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia de material rústico,junto a su cónyuge y sus hijos,en el distrito de Santo Tomás,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura,específicamente al cultivo de café, de la variedad Catimor, sembrando 1 hectárea de café de su propiedad,su predio se ubica en el Caserio Palma Central del distrito Santo Tomás de Cutervo, se dedica a la agricultura hace 15 años y hace 4 años cultiva café. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría y venta de animales menores y cultivo de productos de pan llevar, cuenta con mucha experiencia en el rubro. El destino del crédito será para invertir en el mantenimiento de su cultivo, con ello obtendrá buen rendimiento y mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Mercedes es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. El firmará con su cónyuge.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 58 years of age. He is married and lives in his own home, which is made of basic materials, with his wife and children in Santo Tomas district, Cutervo province, Cajamarca department in Peru.

He has very good personal and employment references from locals. Inhabitants in this region generally make a living from farming and trade.

Mercedes earns a living from farming, specifically from growing coffee, the Catimor variety. He plants one hectare of coffee plants on his property, which is located in the Palma Central village in the Santo Tomas de Cutervo district. He has been farming for 15 years and growing coffee for the last four years.

He also earns a living from raising and selling small animals and growing basic food crops and he has a lot of experience in this line of work. The loan will be used to invest in the maintenance of his crops. With this he will get a good yield and better income so that he can improve his quality of life and that of his family.

Mercedes is an ongoing member of Edpyme Alternativa. He will sign with his wife.

loans.use: to invest in the maintenance of his crops.

loans.name: Hyna

texts.en:
Hyna, 49, is married with five children, three who are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for nine years. She has requested a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy assorted fish to sell.

She would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish to sell

loans.name: Elvia Evangelina

texts.es:
Elvia de 24 años de edad, estudió hasta 6°, es madre soltera de un varón  que tiene 10 años de edad, actualmente su hijo está estudiando 4° grado, de ella depende únicamente su hijo que es con quien vive y también apoya a sus padres en algunos gastos en el hogar pues son ellos quienes siempre la han apoyado a ella en sus proyectos. No pudo continuar con sus estudios debido a la falta de ingresos económicos y por vivir muy alejado del centro escolar.

Actualmente, Elvia está trabajando en una tienda en la ciudad, trabaja de lunes a sábado desde tempranas horas de la mañana, donde tiene que viajar desde su comunidad, se levanta a las cuatro y media de la mañana, camina durante 20 minutos hasta llegar a l lugar donde toma el bus en donde se transporta hasta la ciudad donde labora. Ella siempre ha trabajado en negocios varios, como  en la crianza de pollos de engorde.

Elvia está solicitando un crédito para comprar 200 pollos de engorde de donde espera obtener muy buenos ingresos para su familia, actualmente tiene ya la galera donde tendrá a los pollos durante su desarrollo pues ya conoce muy bien de la actividad productiva. 

Elvia sueña con poder seguir trabajando arduamente para seguir generando ingresos económicos a su hogar, ir ahorrando para poder un día llegar a tener su propia casa y ayudar a su hijo a terminar sus estudios y que llegue a ser un profesional y una mejor persona para la sociedad ya que ella no tuvo la oportunidad de hacerlo.
texts.en:
Elvia is 24 years old, she studied up to 6th grade and she is the single mother of a 10-year-old boy who is currently attending 4th grade. Her son lives with her and depends completely on her; she also helps her parents paying some of their expenses, as they have always supporter her and her projects. She could not continue studying because they lacked the money for it, as well as for living very far away from her school.

Elvia is currently working in a town shop, working Mondays to Saturdays and starting very early in the morning. She has to make a long journey from her community: she gets up at 4.30 am, and walks for 20 minutes to reach he bus that takes her to the town where she works. She has always worked, and she has also been engaged in different activities, such as breeding broiler chickens.

Elvia is requesting a loan to buy 200 broiler chickens, and she hopes to get a good income for her family from this activity. She already owns the shed where she will keep the chicken while breeding them, as she already has a good knowledge of how to run this activity.


Elvia wishes to keep on working hard to make money to support her household, and to save money to be able to live in a house of her own one day; she also wishes to help her son complete his studies, helping him become a professional and contribute to society in a better way, as she did not have the chance to do it.

loans.use: buy 200 broiler chickens.

loans.name: Bessy Cristina

texts.es:
Bessy, de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está separada desde hace 10 meses y tiene 2 hijos en esa relación. 

Bessy, tiene 3 años de dedicarse a la venta de frutas, porque ese fue el oficio que su madre le ha enseñado, porque es un negocio que da genera ingresos, pero también su mamá le enseñó a trabajar en la agricultura, pues desde pequeña la llevaba a que trabajara en la tierra para que aprendiera muy bien el oficio; su horario de trabajo es desde las 6:00 a.m. a 10:00 a.m. 

Bessy, está solicitando el préstamo para comprar 100 pollos de engorde y concentrado; esto le ayudará mucho porque tendrá más ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos.

Bessy, sueña con seguir trabajando para sacar adelante a sus hijos y que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Bessy is 26 years old and has a high school education. She separated from her partner ten months ago and has two children from this relationship.

For three years, Bessy has worked selling fruit, as this is the trade that her mother taught her and it is a business that generates a good income. Her mother also taught her to work in agriculture as she would bring her to work in the fields with her when she was young so that she would learn this trade well. She works from 6:00 am to 10:00 am.

Bessy is asking for a loan to buy 100 chickens to fatten and chicken feed. This will help her very much because she will have a greater income to provide for the needs of her children. Bessy dreams of continuing to work in order to bring her children forward so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy 100 chickens to fatten and chicken feed.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.ru: Азизе 27  лет. Она не замужем  и не имеет детей. Азиза более 10 лет своей жизни начала продавать средства гигиены и разную косметику. Она решила заняться этой деятельностью, потому что ее мама работала именно в этой сфере деятельности. И мама научила ее правильно общаться с клиентами и вести данный бизнес. Сейчас Азиза знает все тонкости своей работы. Она хочет расширить деятельность и привлечь больше клиентов. Азиза собирается увеличить ассортимент товара.
