Она надеется на получения кредита увеличить ассортимент товара. Азиза хочет добиться цели в этой сфере деятельности.
texts.en:
Aziza is 27 and single with no children. She has been selling cosmetics and hygiene products for more than 10 years. She decided on this occupation because her mother worked in the same sphere of business, and taught her the right way to deal with customers and run this kind of business. Now, she knows all the ins and outs of her profession.

Aziza wants to expand her business and attract more customers. She wants to increase her selection of products and hopes to receive a loan so she can do so. She wants to reach her business goals.

loans.use: to increase her selection of goods and expand her business

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru: Причина обращения за кредитом Мехринисо является приобретения угля для запаса на зиму. В Таджикистане в некоторых районах устанавливается лимиты в подачах электричества, а в некоторых местах вообще несколько месяцев отключаются электричества. У Мехринисо трое детей и она заботиться об их здравоохранении. Мехринисо надеется, что в срок запасся углем и зимой в доме всегда будет тепло.
texts.en: Mehriniso is looking for a loan to stock up on coal for the winter. In many regions of Tajikistan they put limits on electricity supplies, and in some places there is no electricity at all for several months. Mehriniso has three children and she is worried about their health. She hopes that she will have time to stock up on goal so that it will always be warm in the house this winter.

loans.use: to stock up on coal for the winter

loans.name: Fe Ruina

texts.en:
Fe Ruina, 42, is married with two children. She runs a general store in the village of Tabid in Ozamiz City. She is also engaged in her Video K business to make a living.

To improve her business, she previously borrowed 10,000 Philippine pesos from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative to repair her Video K machine. She has successfully repaid that loan and can now avail a new loan.

Her request is for 20,000 PHP to buy additional home-use groceries to sell. With the profits she earns from this loan, she hopes to expand her business and send her children to school and finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional home-use groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby’s store is colorful indeed! She sells balloons, party display materials, and giveaways. She also decorates party venues when necessary and accepts bulk orders for helium balloons. She’s been in this business for five years now and she pays three on-call workers. It’s a good source of income that supplements her husband Rommel’s income as a cellphone technician. They provide for their daily expenditures and the education expenses of their two children.

Ruby anticipates a higher demand for her products this Christmas season, as many schools and offices will host Christmas parties. She needs to increase her supplies with additional capital of 20,000 PHP. She will buy party display materials, giveaways, and helium gas tanks. It’s her chance to boost her profit and savings this season. She hopes you can be part of her success with your heartfelt support.

Ruby dreams of seeing all her children graduate from college and have a brighter future. She shares her experiences with her co-fellowship members at CCT Credit Cooperative, Polomolok, South Cotabato branch. The cooperative has been operating in this area for many years and was able to form several fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans. Ruby regularly attends this weekly meeting to draw strength and inspiration.

loans.use: to buy party display materials, giveaways, and helium gas tanks.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is 50 years old and married with four children. Celsa works very hard to provide for them.

Celsa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, eggs, home product care items, and other groceries.

Celsa has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as dry goods, etc.

In the future, Celsa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, eggs, home product care items, and other groceries.

loans.name: Rossini

texts.en:
Rossini is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rossini is 60 years old and has one child is still in school.

Rossini has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Rossini requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy assorted fish to sell.

Rossini has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish to sell

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Esmeralda is 49 years old now.

Esmeralda has a buy-and-sell firewood business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy bundles of firewood to sell.

In the future, Esmeralda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy bundles of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 51 years old and married, and she has three children who are currently in school.

Gina is in the agricultural business – pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years now, and has borrowed from NWTF four times in the past to sustain it. Gina requested a 18,000 PHP loan to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Annabelle is 45 years old and has three children in school.

Annabelle has a fishing business in the Philippines. Annabelle requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish netting, gasoline for her boat and maintenance services for her business.

Annabelle has been in this business for 12 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish netting, gasoline for her boat and maintenance services for her business.

loans.name: César Armando

texts.es:
César de 25 años d edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, actualmente está acompañado, su compañera de vida se dedica a realizar labores domésticas en su casa, tienen dos hijos en común, uno de 4 años y el otro de 2 años, en su vivienda Cesar vive con sus dos padres, su papá trabaja como conserje en una iglesia evangélica y su madre elabora tortillas para vender a las personas que viven en su comunidad.


César trabaja en un taller de mecánica automotriz donde realiza todo tipo de reparaciones como engrases, cambios de aceite, mantenimiento preventivo y correctivo de vehículos livianos, entre otras reparaciones, dicho taller está ubicado en el mismo cantón donde vive, a una distancia de 500 metros de su casa.- César aprendió este oficio hace varios años por un amigo quien lo llevaba al taller y desde entonces trabaja en ese lugar con un horario de lunes a viernes de 8:00 AM a  5:00 PM y sábados de 08:00 AM hasta las 12:00 MD.


El presente crédito Cesar lo utilizará para comprar herramientas como compresor, equipo para soldar, entre otras cosas para el taller.

Cesar sueña con darle a su familia todo lo necesario para tener una vida digna, especialmente a sus hijos, ya que desea brindarles una buena educación y todo lo que ellos necesiten.
texts.en:
Cesar is 25 years of age and studied until ninth grade. He currently has a partner and his partner does the housework at home. They have 2 children, a 4 year old and a 2 year old. At home Cesar lives with his two parents. His father works as a concierge at an evangelical church and his mother makes tortillas to sell to people in her community.

Cesar works in an automechanic workshop where he does all kinds of repairs such as lubrication, change of oil, preventative maintenance and corrections of light vehicles. This workshop is located in the block where he lives, 500 metres from his home. Cesar learnt this occupation some years ago from a friend who took him to the workshop and he has been working there ever since. He works from Monday to Friday from 8.00am to 5.00pm and Saturdays from 8.00 am until 12.00pm.

Cesar will use this loan to buy tools such as a compressor, soldering equipment and other things for the workshop. He dreams of providing his family with everything they need to lead a dignified life, especially his children, and he would like to give them a good education and everything that they need.

loans.use: to purchase tools such as a compressor and soldering equipment for his workshop.

loans.name: Asalia

texts.es: Asalia, tiene 22 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y vive con ellos en una aldea del municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Lleva siete años de dedicarse a la compra y venta de pescado fresco y mariscos. Esta actividad es su fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. El pescado tiene buena demanda y lo distribuye en la misma comunidad. Decidió solicitar un préstamo por 5,000 lempiras para para comprar mayor cantidad de pescado y marisco para vender y poder incrementar las ventas e ingresos. Su sueño es seguir trabajando para darles estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en: Asalia is 22 years old and a single mother with three children. She lives with them in a town in the municipality of Tela, Atlantida. She has made a living buying and selling fresh fish and seafood for seven years. This activity is her source of income to support her family. Fish is in high demand and she distributes it in her local community. She decided to request a loan for 5,000 lempiras to purchase fish and seafood wholesale so that she can increase her sales and income. Her dream is to continue working so that she can pay for her children's studies.

loans.use: to purchase fish and seafood to sell.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Шарофат очень благодарна Вам за Вашу поддержку и понимание. Именно с Вашей помощью она теперь имеет хороший доход,  занимаясь куплей и продажей детской одежды. Она получает хорошую прибыль от своей деятельности. Однако семья у неё большая и все свои деньги она тратит на расходы семьи. Так как Шарофат трудолюбивая женщина, она не перестала заниматься животноводством. Но сейчас у неё нет достаточно средств, чтобы купить ещё несколько голов телят. Шарофат и на сей раз также обратилась к Вам за поддержкой. Она очень верит, что  с Вашей помощью она сможет снова расширить свой бизнес и за счет полученной прибыли отремонтировать свой дом.  У неё очень большие планы на будущее.
texts.en:
Sharofat is very thankful to you for your support and understanding. Thanks to your help she now has a good income from her work buying and selling children's clothing. She receives good profits from her business; however, her family is big and all her money goes toward family expenses. 

Since Sharofat is a hardworking woman, she hasn't stopped working in animal husbandry, but she doesn't have enough money to buy more calves. This time again she is turning to you for support. She believes strongly that with your help she will be able to expand her business again and use the profits to renovate her home. She has very big plans for the future.

loans.use: to purchase a few calves

loans.name: Maritza Yaneth

texts.es: Maritza de 39 años de edad es viuda y vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa interior para damas y caballeros, desde hace varios años ejerce este oficio y cuenta con muchos clientes fijos con lo que puede mantener su negocio a flote, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logar cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, ella solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para comprar mayor cantidad de ropa interior diferentes precios, estilos y colores y de esta forma contar con más clientes y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Thirty-nine-year-old Maritza is a widow and lives in her own house with her two children. She makes a living selling undergarments for women and men. She has had this job for several years and has many regular customers from which she is able to keep her business afloat. With the earnings she receives from her sales, she succeeds in covering some household expenses. She is requesting a loan from Integral in order to buy a greater quantity of undergarments at various prices, and in different styles and colors. This way, she will get more customers and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of undergarments at various prices, and in different styles and colors.

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia is 40 years old and married, and she has two children, one of whom is still in school.

Clemencia is in the agricultural business – pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig. Clemencia has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed from NWTF twice in the past to sustain it.

In the future, Clemencia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Orlando De Jesus

texts.es:
Orlando es un hombre de 49 años de edad que heredo un negocio de venta de licores en el año 1990, gracias a este negocio genera el sustento para su familia conformada por su pareja y sus dos hijos. 
Orlando trabaja no solo por su familia, quiere mantener este ya tradicional bar, el cual es frecuentado por clientes que nacieron junto con el negocio.
La temporada de fin de año es donde percibe mejores ingresos, por ello solicita un préstamo para comprar surtido al por mayor de licores, principalmente cerveza, aguardiente y ron, parte del capital será para la compra de snack
texts.en: Orlando is a 49 year old man who inherited a liquor business in 1990. Thanks to this business he generates support for his family which consists of his wife and two children.  Orlando works not only for his family, he wants to maintain this traditional bar which is frequented by customers who were born near the business. The end of the year season is where he receives the best income, so he seeks a loan to buy a stock of alcohols at wholesale, primarily beer, liquor, and rum, and part of the capital will also buy snack food.

loans.use: to buy a stock of alcohols at wholesale, primarily beer, liquor, and rum.

loans.name: Unión Progreso Y Trabajo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNION PROGRESO Y TRABAJO” iniciará el décimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Enriqueta es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de mantas, venta de sombreros, venta de polleras, tienda de barrio, venta de carne y abarrotes, venta de coca.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Enriqueta es integrante, ella indica que hace siete ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años por iniciativa propia ya que atravesaba por momentos difíciles económicamente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de abarrotes por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración, lo venderá en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera  y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal association, "Union, Progreso y Trabajo" will begin its eleventh loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal Los Andes. The group is made up of eight members and is led by a board of officers where Enriqueta is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal association have are varied and include: food sales, blanket sales, hat sales, skirt sales, a small grocery store, the sale of meat and groceries, and coca sales.

The loan they are requesting will benefit the small businesses including Enriqueta's. She says that she joined Pro Mujer seven cycles ago from the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. She currently has a business selling food, which she started a number of years ago of her own initiative as she was going through difficult economic times.

The loan she is asking for now will be used to increase her capital (to buy groceries in bulk) which she will buy from the wholesalers in the city of El Alto. After preparing the food, she will sell it in her place of business. This type of work allows her to generate an income to support her family economically as she is single and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health center and the trainings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Doña Alicia de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace 12 años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende de forma ambulantes por las diferentes colonias, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Alicia, 59, lives in her own home with her daughter.

She has earned a living for 12 years selling personal care products. Her business is located in her home and she also works as a street vendor in different neighborhoods.

She's requesting a loan to buy perfume, lotion, cream, shampoo, deodorant, and so forth, all wholesale. That way she can continue with her job and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy perfume, lotion, cream, shampoo, deodorant, etc. wholesale

loans.name: Tiofreda

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Tiofreda works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Tiofreda is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to purchase fish net, gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her fishing business.

Tiofreda has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish net, gasoline for her boat, and other materials.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Motorcycle transport is Florida's business. Her husband is a farmer.

Florida aims to keep her motorcycle transport business in good condition so she is requesting additional capital of 6,000 PHP. She will use this loan to buy new tires, chains, and sprockets for her motorcycle transport business. This amount will enable her to maintain her business.

Florida is looking forward to further developing her transportation business.

loans.use: to buy new tires, chains, and sprockets for her motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 45 years old and married with six children. With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

Beverly has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as dry goods, etc.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 60 years old and married, with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Adelina has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 46 years old and married with five children.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines, and is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Teresita has been in this business for nine years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Lynie

texts.en:
Lynie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 43 years old now.

She has a internet café business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy mice, keyboards, and other supplies needed in her business.

Lynie has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy mice, keyboards, and other supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Tero

texts.en:
Tero is 54 years old and is married with 4 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Tero runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a 13,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy additional items to sell such as beverages, canned goods, snack foods, personal care products, and other groceries.

Tero has been in this business for 10 years where she sells a variety of items.

In the future, Tero would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as beverages, canned goods, snack foods, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
Adelaida es una mujer de 37 años de edad, una mujer luchadora, emprendedora que se gana la vida vendiendo tintos, perico (café con leche), en las calles del municipio de Medellín. 
Ella es una mujer casada con una hija de 12 años de edad, vive en un hogar muy humilde, pero gracias a Dios nunca han pasado necesidades, puesto que tanto su esposo como ella trabajan para mantener las cuentas del hogar al día.
El sueño de Adelaida es comprar una vivienda, pagar la educación de sus hijos y en un futuro poder tener un negocio más estable, que sería un cafetería.
Ella trabaja diariamente por mantener su hogar, pero siempre aspira a mejorar sus ventas, diversificar su oferta vendiendo alimentos, aumentar sus ventas y ganar clientes.
El cliente tiene la intención de crecer y vender mayor número de cafés, tintico como se conoce en Medellín, solicita un préstamo para lograr aumentar sus ventas, el cual invertirá en la compra de termos (ver foto) para depositar café y salir a vender por más calles de Medellín.
texts.en:
Adelaida is 37 years old. She's a hardworking, enterprising woman who earns a living by selling black coffee and "perico" (coffee with milk) on the streets of the town of Medellín.
She's a married woman with a 12-year-old daughter. She lives in a very humble home but, thanks to God, they haven't suffered hardships because she and her husband both work to keep the household finances in order.
Adelaida's dream is to buy a house, pay for her children's education and someday own a more stable business, such as coffee shop.
She works on a daily basis to support her family, but she always aspires to improve her sales and diversify her business by selling foodstuffs. She aspires to increase her sales and gain customers.
Adelaida wishes to expand and sell more units of coffee, or "tintico" as it is known in Medellín. She requests a loan so that she can increase her sales. She'll use it to purchase thermos flasks (as shown in the photo) to fill with coffee for selling on the streets of Medellín.

loans.use: to purchase thermos flasks to fill with coffee for selling on the streets of Medellín.

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
Beatriz es una empelada de oficios varios de 53 años de edad, que se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para pagar un curso de cocina saludable el cual ha estado buscando hace dos años, los que encontraba eran muy costosos por ello quiere tomar esta oportunidad que se le presenta y así expandir sus conocimientos en cocina saludable y estar más cerca de montar su negocio propio.
Por esta razón pide ayuda a la comunidad Kiva para cumplir un objetivo que ha buscado pro dos largos años.
texts.en:
Beatriz, 53, is an employee in a variety of trades.

She's requesting a loan to pay for a course in healthy cooking, which she has been looking for for two years. The ones she found were too expensive, so she wants to take this current opportunity and expand her knowledge of healthy cooking to move closer to setting up her own business.

This is why she's asking the Kiva community for help to achieve a goal she has pursued for two years.

loans.use: to pay for a course in healthy cooking

loans.name: Ester Julia

texts.es:
Ester es una mujer casada de 50 años de edad, la cual se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para pagar un curso de cocina saludable dictado por la corporación Interactuar, ella antes del matrimonio e hijos tenía una panadería y por ocuparse de su familia desistió de este.
Ahora que cuenta con más tiempo la señora Ester busca adquirir los conocimientos y encaminar un posible futuro negocio de venta de productos saludables y tiene la gran ventaja que en el mercado casi no se presenta competencia.
texts.en:
Ester is 50 years old and married. She's requesting a loan to pay for a course taught by Interactuar on healthy cooking. Before she got married and had children she had a bakery, which she gave up to take care of her family.

Now that she has more time, Ester wants to acquire the knowledge and work toward a possible future business selling healthy products. She has the big advantage that there's no competition in the market.

loans.use: to pay for a course on healthy cooking.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
As a married mother of 3 children, Ofelia works hard to support her family. She has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business.

Ofelia is borrowing 10,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy spare parts and gasoline and pay for maintenance for her business.

Ofelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline and pay for maintenance for her business.

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina is 38 years old and is married with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Melodina runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, home care products, and other groceries.

Melodina has been in this business for 19 years and sells a variety of items. In the future, she would like to save enough to be able to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia works hard to support 6 children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Emelia has requested a 6,750 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy a solar lamp. She is purchasing the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of an emergency.

Emelia is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a mother with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 25 years old now.

Alma has a shell craft business in the Philippines. She has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more shells, thread, and other supplies to use in her business.

Alma has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to be able to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more shells, thread, and other supplies to use in her business.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Ella es Rosa una batalladora incansable de 66 años de edad, una persona perseverante, soltera cabezada de familia que toda la vida se ha valido de sus manos y de su capacidad para superar adversidades para sobrevivir, y criar a una hija ya mayor de edad.
Rosa se dedica a la venta de fritos, tiene una freidora y se ubica en frente de su casa a vender.
Su principal objetivo con su negocio es generar los recursos para el pago de sus obligaciones financieras y poder disfrutar un buen alimento en la mesa de su casa, comprar sus medicamentos. 
Rosa solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos al por mayor para atender la temporada de fin de año, tales como carnes frías, panes, papas, salsas, cubiertos y platos plásticos, carnes, servilletas, refrescos, vasos, verduras y frutas para realizar ensaladas, productos fritos congelados.
texts.en:
This is Rosa, a tireless fighter who's 66 years old. She's a persevering, single person who's head of her family. All her life she has been making use of her hands and her ability to overcome struggles in order to survive and raise a daughter who's already an adult.
Rosa sells deep-fried snacks. She owns a fryer and sets it up in front of her house to make her sales.
Her main goal with her business is making a profit in order to afford her financial obligations. That way she can enjoy a decent meal at the table at home and also buy her medication.
Rosa requests a loan so that she can purchase wholesale supplies to use in the year-end holiday season. She'll purchase cold cuts, bread, potatoes, dip, plastic plates and cutlery, meat, napkins, refreshments, cups, vegetables and fruits to make salads, and pre-fried frozen products.

loans.use: to purchase cold cuts, bread, potatoes, dip, plastic plates and cutlery, meat, napkins, refreshments, etc.

loans.name: Norma Marina

texts.es:
Norma de 21 años de edad, estudió hasta 8° grado, está soltera y nadie depende económicamente de ella y por lo tanto vive con sus padres y sus hermanos.

Norma se dedica a la prestación de servicios en un molino, el cual es de su propiedad, tiene 1 año de dedicarse a esta actividad, anteriormente trabajó en una tortillería por 6 años de modo que se ha esforzado por salir adelante.


Ella necesita este crédito para comprar 3 cerdos, los cuales engordara y cuidará para venderlos posteriormente cuando ya estén grandes. 


El sueño de Norma es seguir trabajando para continuar con sus estudios y comprar un terreno para construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Norma is 21 years old, learned until 8th grade, and is single. No one depends on her economically; therefore, she lives with her parents and siblings. 

Norma makes a living providing services at a mill, which is her property. She has worked one year in this occupation. Previously, she worked in a tortilla shop for six months so that she could make efforts to get ahead.

She needs this loan in order to buy three pigs, which she will fatten and take care of in order to sell afterward when they are big. 

Norma's dream is to continue working in order to continue her studies and to buy land to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy 3 pigs, which she will fatten and take care of in order to sell them afterward when they are big.

loans.name: Alba Nubia

texts.es:
Alba es una mujer cabeza de familia de 48 años de edad que se dedica  a la confección de uniformes, inicio su negocio en el año 2007 por superación personal pues era empleada en una empresa, la cual abandono buscando su propio camino y la manera de aumentar sus ingresos para tener una buena vida.
Se acerca un nuevo año, muchos estudiantes renovaran uniformes, algunos comprarán uno nuevo y Alba quiere ser la empresaria que los provea, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de confección para la elaboración de uniformes.
texts.en: Alba is the head of the family at 48 years old. She makes uniforms. She began her business in 2007 on her own accord as she was an employee in a business which she left seeking her own path and way to increase her income in order to have a better life.  As the new year approaches, many students repair uniforms, some will buy new, and Alba wants to be the businesswoman who services them. Therefore she seeks a loan to buy sewing supplies to make uniforms.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies to make uniforms.

loans.name: Benito Richard

texts.es:
Benito es un hombre de 63 años de edad, soltero, tiene 2 hijos de 15 y 21 años, y su negocio es la reparación de equipos eléctricos.
Él es emprendedor, independiente y muy paciente. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ’16 de julio’ donde se realiza la feria del mismo nombre, aquí se encuentran vendedores de productos usados, entre otros de ropas y artefactos, se dice que se puede encontrar desde un “alfiler hasta un tractor agrícola”.
Benito es de tez morena, cabello negro y físico robusto, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla dentro de su entorno familiar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza, su vida la comparte con sus 2 hijos que estudian y trabajan, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es el servicio de ensamblaje de equipos electrónicos, como; ensamblaje, cableado, tés de funcionamiento, Montaje de cables, conexiones, circuitos, electrónica de potencia, comunicación, seguridad, iluminación, automoción y otros, “estudie electrónica y desde muy joven me especialicé…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque es el único técnico ensamblador de su tipo en el lugar. La ventaja de su negocio es que es estable, la desventaja es la falta de repuestos para trabajar inmediatamente. Su sueño es tener un gran stock de mercadería, el desea comprar repuestos eléctricos por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Benito solicita un préstamo para comprar repuestos por mayor para ensamblar equipos electrónicos.
texts.en:
Benito is a 63 year old man who is single and has two children aged 15 and 21 years old. He has a business repairing electronic devices.

He is entrepreneurial, independent and very patient. He runs his business in the area called "16 de julio" where there is a market of the same name. Here, there are people who sell used products, and others who sell clothing or devices. It is said that you can find anything from "a pin to an agricultural tractor."

Benito has a dark complexion, black hair and is physically robust. His native language is Aymara, which he speaks with his family and, he speaks Spanish culturally and for his business. He lives with his two children who are in school and work. They live in a rented room made of brick that has drinking water, electricity, and plumbing.

He has a business where he provides services assembling electronic devices including: assembly, wiring, function tests, cable assembly, connections, circuits, power electronics, communication, security, lighting, automotive, and others. "I studied electronics and from a young age, I became specialized," he said. His business is successful because he is the only technical assembler of his kind in the area. The benefit of his business is that it is stable. The disadvantage is that he is lacking electronic parts to be able to work immediately. His dream is to have a large stock of merchandise. He wants to buy electronic parts in bulk. This is his first loan cycle with the institution in the 20 years that he has had this business.

For these reasons, Benito is asking for a loan to buy parts in bulk to assemble electronic devices.

loans.use: to buy parts in bulk to assemble electronic devices.

loans.name: Jenipher

texts.en:
Jenipher is married and she operates a food café where she sells her cooked food. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals.

Jenipher describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use this 40,000 KES loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing her food.

This is Jenipher's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use her anticipated profits to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing her food.

loans.name: Malinda

texts.en:
Malinda is a very hardworking woman. She earns a living selling seashells to the locals in her area. She is 46 year old is a married mother of 8 children, 5 of whom are still attending school. Her husband is a fisherman. He fishes both for his family's consumption and as a source of income.

Malinda would like to purchase more supplies of seashells but she does not have enough funds to make bulk purchases. Malinda joined CEVI to access capital. She wants to acquire a loan to purchase a variety of seashells. This could boost her earnings and enable her to invest in other sources of income.

In the future, Malinda hopes that she will become successful in her projects to not only finance the schooling of her children but also improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to to purchase a variety of  seashells.

loans.name: Kong Group

texts.en: Kong is a 38-year-old married rice farmer with three children in her care, and she resides in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. All of her three children attend school. Kong is pictured 1st from the left and has cultivated rice since 1997. Her husband is a 38-year-old rice farmer, and fattens up animals as well. Kong and her husband can earn approximately 3 USD per day. Kong, a group leader, would like to request a loan as part of a group of four members, and she will use her portion to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticides for farming. This loan helps her to increase her income as well as her family's standard of living. In the future, Kong is going to buy more pigs and cows, build a new proper house and support her three children to go to university.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticides for farming

loans.name: Jesai

texts.en: Jesai is a married man with two children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using bicycles. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more bicycles. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more bicycles

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
This is Chona, 48-year-old hardworking entrepreneur from Polomolok, South Cotabato. She operates a store of school supplies combined with soft drinks and other beverages. She continues to explore many ways of improving her business in order to support her husband and earn a living. Edmundo, her husband, is a driver and his income doesn’t suffice for his family with five children.

Chona wishes to enhance her business by acquiring more school supplies to sell, adding cases of soft drinks, and starting to sell grocery items at one side of her store. She is requesting financial assistance worth PHP 10,000 to meet this purpose. She hopes to raise her profit with these additional supplies.

Eventually Chona’s goal is to have a bigger area for her busines and build their own house and lot. She would be very happy to see her children with college diplomas and stable jobs in the near future.

She’s a dutiful member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more school supplies, cases of soft drinks, and grocery items to resell

loans.name: Carlosa

texts.en:
Carlosa is a married mother of 2 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 46 years old now.

Carlosa has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 25,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Carlosa has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business so she can secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Miguel Alcides

texts.es:
Miguel, de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, pero en la temporada de cortar café ella trabaja para generar un ingreso extra para la familia, junto a ella tiene 2 hijos de 6 años de edad y su hija de 7 meses de nacida.

Miguel, se dedica a la agricultura desde que era un niño, actualmente cultiva maíz, frijol y trabaja en la finca de café durante todo el año y a través de este trabajo ha sacado adelante a su familia, su lugar de trabajo está cerca de su casa y se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. para prepararse y estar en el trabajo a las 5:00 a.m. 

Miguel, necesita el préstamo para pagar mano de obra para hollar la tierra, porque tiene arbolitos de café que necesitan ser trasplantados y también comprara abono para aplicarlo a los arbolitos.

Miguel, sueña con terminar la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Miguel is 26 years old. He completed fourth grade. He's married and his wife is a homemaker, but during the coffee harvest season she works to get extra income for the family. With his wife he has two children, a six-year-old and a seven-month-old daughter.

Miguel has worked in agriculture ever since he was very young. He currently grows corn and beans. He works on the coffee farm on a year-round basis and through this work he has gotten his family ahead. The farm is near his house and he gets up at 4 a.m. so that he can get ready and be at work at 5 a.m.

Miguel needs the loan in order to pay for labor to plow the land, since he has little coffee trees that have to be transplanted. He'll also purchase compost to use in the coffee trees.

Miguel's dream is to finish the construction of his house.

loans.use: to pay for labor to plow the land and also to purchase compost for growing coffee.

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma is a 30-year-old woman who resides in Lahore, Pakistan. She has 3 children. Her husband has been running a general store for a year. He wants to purchase rice, sugar, tea bags, milk, and other items for his business, but Najma's husband is not in a position to buy these products to resell.

With her group of 3 women, Najma has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. Her loan portion will enable Najma's husband to buy merchandise and earn a profitable income, allowing him to manage his household and business.

Najma is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio es un hombre soltero de 45 años de edad que se dedica a vender mercancía como independiente, actividad que nace de la necesidad de generar recursos para el sostenimiento del hogar, pero su mayor pasión es la gastronomía, espera en un futuro poder montar un negocio de comida saludable y aunque no cuenta con los recursos va juntando conocimientos y recursos para cuando llegue el día poner toda la iniciativa, tiempo, ganas para montar el negocio.
Julio actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para pagar un curso dictado por la corporación Interactuar de comida saludable, todo esto lo hace pensando en el negocio que quiere conformar a futuro.
texts.en:
Julio is a single 45-year-old man who works selling merchandise independently, a business born from the need to generate resources to support his home. However, his greatest passion is gastronomy, and he hopes to someday be able to start a healthy food business. And, although he does not have the resources, he is gathering knowledge and resources for when the day arrives to put forth all of the initiative, time, and enthusiasm to start the business.

Currently Julio is requesting a loan to pay for a class taught by Corporación Interactuar on healthy food. He does all of this thinking of the business that he wants to form in the future.

loans.use: to pay for a class on healthy food.

loans.name: Santos De Jesus

texts.es: DOña Santos de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella posee desde hace 10 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia tiene muchos clientes espscialmente sus vecinos y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la clienta esta solicitando un credito para la compra de más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Santos is 54 years old. She lives with her life partner in a house that she owns. For the past 10 years she has owned a small store located in her home. She has several customers, especially her neighbors. With the profits she makes she's able to pay for some of her household expenses. She's requesting a loan in order to purchase more soup, eggs, basic grains, refreshments, candy, sweet bread, etc. That way she'll increase her profits as a way to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more soup, eggs, basic grains, refreshments, candy, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Ruth Amparo

texts.es: Ruth es una mujer de 59 años de edad la cual se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para pagar un curso de cocina saludable dictado por la corporación Interactuar, ella es madre de 6 hijos la razón del préstamo es que quiere capacitarse para aumentar las preparaciones que realiza en su negocio, dado que tiene un servicio de alquiler de habitaciones con derecho a comida y como estrategia de fidelización y mejora del servicio quiere ampliar su menú de preparaciones.
texts.en: Ruth is a 59-year-old woman who is asking for a loan to pay for a healthy cooking course prescribed by Interactuar. She is the mother of six children. The reason for the loan is that she wants to get trained to increase the kinds of foods she prepares in her business. Given that she has a service renting rooms with food included, she wants to expand her food menu as a customer loyalty strategy and to improve her service.

loans.use: to pay for a healthy cooking course

loans.name: Luz Adriana

texts.es:
Luz Adriana es una mujer de 39 años de edad, una mujer responsable, trabajadora, con sueños y aspiraciones, la cual se encuentra solicitando tu apoyo para iniciar un negocio de venta de comidas rápidas 
El motivo del préstamo nace del deseo de Luz Adriana de querer tener un negocio propio, buscar un mejor futuro, cumplir sus sueños de comprar vivienda, carro, propiedades y sabe que como empleada estos sueños serían difíciles de cumplir, por esta razón acude a la comunidad Kiva para obtener el dinero restante con el que adecuara el local, lo pintará, pondrá publicidad en paredes, hará las cartas, comprara la freidora, mesas, sillas, e insumos.
texts.en:
Luz Adriana is a 39-year-old woman who is responsible and hardworking and has dreams and aspirations. She is asking for your support to start her business selling fast food.

Luz Adriana is asking for a loan because she wants to have her own business, search for a better future, achieve her dreams of buying a home, car and property and she knows that by being an employee, these dreams will be difficult to achieve. For this reason, she is turing to the Kiva community to obtain the remaining money with which she will adapt her space - she will paint it and put advertisements on the walls - she will make menus, buy a deep-fryer, tables, chairs, and supplies.

loans.use: to adapt her space, make the menus, and to buy a deep-fryer, tables, chairs, and supplies.

loans.name: Maria Yaqueline

texts.es:
María es una madre cabeza de familia de 32 años de edad la cual tiene dos niños de 10 y 5 años, la cual se dedica a la elaboración de alimentos, más precisamente pizzas, inició su negocio como una alternativa de generación de ingresos y la fue consumiendo hasta dedicarse de tiempo completo a esta profesión y gracias a ella lleva el sustento diario a su hogar donde sus hijos la esperan con un caluroso abrazo de bienvenida.
Ella sueña con tener una vivienda propia para vivir tranquilamente con su familia, solo le queda trabajar por sus hijos y por sus sueños.
María se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos en cantidades para la elaboración de pizzas.
texts.en:
María is a 32-year-old female head of household and has two children, ages 10 and 5. She works making food, and more specifically pizza. She started her business as an alternative way to generate income and it consumed her until she started working full time in this profession. And, thanks to it, she is able to bring food to the table each day where her children wait for her with a warm hug of welcome.

She dreams of having her own home to live calmly with her family. All that is left is to work for her children and for their dreams.

María is requesting a loan to buy ingredients to make pizza.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make pizza.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raúl es u joven de 25 años de edad, el cual vive en unión libre con su pareja hace un par de años, se dedica a las actividades agrícolas, principalmente a la producción de leche, este negocio lo inició buscando la libertad financiera y vivir solo con su pareja, empleada 12 horas diarias para sacar su profesión adelante, ordeñando sus vacas y llevando la leche hasta la cabecera municipal donde es recogida por sus clientes.
Raúl debe realizar largos viajes para entregar su leche y busca que cada viaje valga la pena, es decir, llevar una cantidad grande de litro de leche para que se justifiquen sus largos viajes.
Pensando en mejorar su producción y generar más recursos para lograr una estabilidad económica, el cliente solicita un préstamo para la compra de dos vacas lecheras.
texts.en:
Raúl is a 25-year-old young man. He has been in a common law marriage for the past two years. He works in agriculture, especially in milk production. He started this business as a way to achieve financial independence and move in with his spouse. He works a 12-hour day in order to get ahead professionally. He milks his cows and takes the milk to the main town where it is picked up by his customers.
Raúl has to travel far to deliver his milk and seeks to make each trip worthwhile, that is to say, he takes a large quantity of liters of milk in order to justify his long travels.
With the intent to improve his production and make a larger profit to become financially stable, Raúl requests a loan so that he can purchase two dairy cows.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows to increase the production.

loans.name: Ruben Dario

texts.es:
El señor  Rubén  de  43  años de edad es soltero y vive con sus hijas en su casa propia, se dedica a su negocio de venta de maíz por medidas y también cuenta con su propio molino eléctrico para quebrar maíz y vive en San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras.
Don Rubén sus clientes son todos sus vecinos amistades y personas de las comunidades vecinas que se dedican a la venta de rosquillas y quesadillas y necesitan de sus servicios con el molino,  es un hombre emprendedor que lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Don Rubén está solicitando el préstamo para compra de 10 cargas de maíz para surtir su negocio que en estos momentos no cuenta con producto por la escases y espera poder fortalecer su venta diaria.  

Su sueño es  crecer con su negocio, para seguir mejorando su calidad de vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Octubre del  2015.
texts.en:
Ruben, 43 years old, is single and lives with his daughters in his own home. He works in his business selling corn and he also has his own electric grinder to break corn. He lives in San Lorenzo in southern Honduras.

Don Ruben's customers are all his neighbors, friends, and people from the neighboring communities who work selling pastry and quesadillas and need his services with the grinder. He is an enterprising man who works day by day to improve his quality of life.

Don Ruben is requesting the loan to buy 10 loads of corn to supply his business, which at this time does not have product due to the shortage, and he hopes to be able to strengthen his daily sales.

His dream is to grow with his business, and to continue improving his quality of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2015.

loans.use: to buy corn for his business.

loans.name: Laura Vanessa

texts.es:
Laura es una hermosa joven de 19 años de edad, u na persona que gusta del trabajo independiente, que tiene sueños y aspiraciones en la vida, busca comprar vivienda, estudiar, ser alguien en la vida y estar siempre al lado de su madre quien la apoya y le ayuda incondicionalmente.
La joven se dedica a la venta de mercancía, vende ropa, calzado y accesorios, usa su carisma y bella sonrisa para captar la atención de sus clientes, un buen recurso para vender que quiere seguir aprovechando.
Laura se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para abastecerse de mercancía para la temporada de fin de año, comprara jean, camisas, camisetas, bolsos, reloj, calzado.
texts.en:
Laura is a beautiful young woman of 19 years, a person who enjoys independent work, who has dreams and aspirations for her life. She is looking to buy a house, study, be somebody in life and always be by her mother’s side, who supports her and helps her unconditionally.

This young woman works selling merchandise – she sells clothing, footwear and accessories. She uses her charisma and beautiful smile to capture the attention of her customers, a good resource for sales that she hopes to continue making good use of.

Laura is requesting a loan to supply merchandise for the end-of-year season; she will buy jeans, shirts, t-shirts, bags, watches, and footwear.

loans.use: buy jeans, shirts, t-shirts, bags, watches, and footwear for the for the end-of-year season.

loans.name: Alfredo Rafael

texts.es: Don Alfredo de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, el se dedica al transporte, limpeza de fosas septicas y reparacion de aparatos de soldaduras y estructuras metalicas, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 15 años el cual inicio con capital propio, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el cliente solicita un credito para la compra de una bomba sumergible para la limpieza de las fosas septicas y asi seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Alfredo, 51, lives in his own home with his wife and his two children.

He earns a living in transportation, cleaning septic tanks, and repairing welded and metal structures. He has had this business for 15 years, having started with his own capital. He's able to cover some of his household expenses with what he earns from his job.

The client's requesting a loan to buy a submersible pump for cleaning septic tanks so he can continue working.

loans.use: to buy a submersible pump to clean septic tanks

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn and her spouse manages a farming business for income. She is 58 years old, married and had four children. Her family lives at Alcala. Evelyn wanted to improve their farming business with enough fertilizers and pesticides so she asked for loan. Evelyn is now asking additional capital of P35,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides use in farming. This will help develop her crops and help it grow very well and achieve abundant harvest someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides use in farming

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 57 years old and has seven children. Fely is married and has one child still in school.

Fely is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Fely requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Fely has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Fely would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Mwanamwaka

texts.en:
Mwanamwaka is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman and has been blessed with three children all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over five years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia is a 25-year old married woman living with her spouse and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has requested a loan for her husband's fruit selling business. He owns a fruit selling business in a nearby fruit market. With the increase in the household expenses, she wants to grow the business also.

Therefore, she has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband will be able to buy fresh fruit. She wants to save the profit amount so that she can face any sudden incidents or for medical treatment for her children.

Sadia hopes that this loan will prove productive for her and she will save a reasonable amount soon. Sadia is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits for her husband's fruit selling business.

loans.name: Seang Lang

texts.en: A 20-year-old single lady, Seang Lang is a resident living in Toul Kork district of Phnom Penh city. Nowadays, she works and studies at a local university located in Phnom Penh. She has been involved in this job for three months. Due to having not enough capital to support on her studying, she is now applying for a Kiva loan via VisionFund in order to pay for her tuition fees and the rest of money will be used to buy a motorbike for driving her to school. This will be her first loan cycle and she hopes to be able to get high education so as to get a good job.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees to be able to get high education so as to get a good job.

loans.name: Glaiza

texts.en:
Glaiza is responsible and loving wife to her husband.Her husband is a driver and at the same time her helper in the market.Glaiza is 28 years old and has been making native delicacies for three years.With her aim to have additional income she decided to borrow additional capital of PHP5,000 to be use in buying needed ingredients in making native delicacies.

She knows that this amount of loan will enable her to improve the taste and varieties she offers and obtain better income.

loans.use: to buy needed ingredients in making native delicacies

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a married woman. She has 4 children. She operates a food café where she cooks food for sale. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open a new business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Alicia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Alicia is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, vegetable, fish, meat, etc. for her food vending business.

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, vegetable, fish, meat, etc.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Arlyn is 34 years old and has one child in school.

Arlyn has a buy and sell beverages business in the Philippines. Arlyn  requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy variety of beverages to sell.

Arlyn  has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Arlyn  would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy variety of beverages to sell

loans.name: Sara Rebeca

texts.es:
Sara es una humilde mujer de 63 años de edad, madre de 6 hijos, casada la cual se encuentra solicitando un apoyo de la comunidad Kiva para iniciar un negocio de cría de cerdos, está idea surge de la necesidad de generar ingresos, el alimento, el arriendo, están muy costosos y quiere apoyar a su esposo en el sostenimiento, también para vivir una vida digna, tener para comprar medicamentos y lo más importante no pasar necesidades ya que están entrando a una etapa de la vida donde es bastante dificultoso encontrar trabajo, es por esta razón que la mejor opción para ella es tener su propio negocio.
Con el dinero la señora Sara construir una porqueriza, comprará cerdos, alimento de engorde y vacunas.

Espera tener éxito en su profesión y poder cumplir oportunamente con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Sara, 62, is a humble married woman and the mother of six children.

She's asking the Kiva community for help to start a business raising pigs. This ideas comes from her need to earn income. Feed and rent are very costly and she wants to help her husband with the support. She also wants to live a decent life, have money to buy medicine, and above all not have needs. They're entering a stage of life when it's hard to find work, so the best option for her is to have her own business.

With the money Sara's going to build a pigsty and buy pigs, fattening feed, and vaccines.

She hopes to be successful in her profession and be able to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to build a pigsty and to buy pigs, fattening feed, and vaccines

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at  a house that has electricity but no water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
Juan de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta 2° grado, no continuo sus estudios por razones personales, mejor se dedico a trabajar como ayudante de albañil desde los 14 años de dad, está casado y tiene 2 hijos.

Juan trabaja como albañil, actividad que aprendió desde que era un niño,  este  trabajo lo aprendió de su padre y es uno de los mejores aprendizajes que puede dejarle.


El crédito será utilizado para comprar herramientas de albañilería como palas, cintas, taladros, etc.



El sueño de juan es seguir trabajando para poder comprar un terreno en donde realizar trabajos agrícolas, también sueña con sacar a sus hijos adelante y prepararlos con sus estudios para un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Juan is 34 years old. He completed second grade and didn't continue his studies due to personal reasons. Instead he has worked as mason's assistant ever since he was 14 years old. He's married and has two children.

Juan works as a mason, a trade he has learned ever since he was very young. His father taught him this line of work and it is one of the best lessons he could have left for him.

The loan will be used to purchase masonry tools such as shovels, tape, drills, etc.

Juan's dream is to keep on working so that he can buy some land where he can carry out farm work. He also dreams of getting his chidren ahead and preparing them for a better future through their studies.

loans.use: to purchase masonry tools such as shovels, tape, drills, etc.

loans.name: Dinora Del Carmen

texts.es:
Dinora, de 43 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, es madre soltera de 1 hijo que aún vive con ella y ha estudiado técnico en agronomia y actualmente trabaja en una micro financiera y en su casa solo vive su hijo, su esposa y su nieto.

Dinora, trabaja haciendo pupusas desde hace 4 años, aprendió este negocio de su madre, porque ella también realizaba cualquier actividad productiva para ayudar a llevar el pan a su familia; el negocio lo tiene en su casa y trabaja de las 4:00 p.m. a las 7:00 de la noche haciendo pupusas.

Dinora, necesita el préstamo para comprar maíz, frijoles y verduras para la elaboración las pupusas, pero también comprará una vaca, porque también se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado.- El préstamo le ayudara a seguir con sus negocios.

Los sueños de Dinora, son que su negocio crezca y con las ganancias colocar una tienda de productos básicos.
texts.en:
Dinora, 43 years old, studied until third grade. She is a single mother of one son who still lives with her. She has studied agriculture and currently works at a microfinance company. In her home live only her son, his wife, and her grandchild.

Dinora has worked making pupusas for four years. She learned this business from her mother because she also carried out any productive activity to help put bread on the table for her family. She has the business in her home and works from 4:00pm to 7:00pm making pupusas.

Dinora needs the loan to buy corn, beans, and vegetables to make pupusas, but also to buy a cow because she also works buying and selling cattle. The loan will help her to continue with her businesses.

Dinora's dreams are that her business grows and to use the earnings to start a store with basic products.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, and vegetables to make pupusas, and also to buy a cow.

loans.name: Vicuñitas De San Simon Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VICUÑITAS DE SAN SIMON” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nieves es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de frutas, venta de pan, venta de comida, servicio de transporte, venta de CD’s, venta de ropa deportiva, tienda de barrio, taller de bicicletas. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nieves es integrante, ella indica que ocho meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia al ver que en su zona no había este negocio; en la actualidad quien le ayuda en este negocio es su hija. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, fideo y papa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializara en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
Vicuñitas de San Simón Communal Bank will start its second loan cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana regional office. It's made up of eight members governed by a board of which Nieves is the president. The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses, including fruit sales, bread sales, food sales, transportation services, CD sales, athletic clothing sales, a neighborhood store, and a bicycle shop.

The loan they're getting will benefit small business entrepreneurs like Nieves. She said she has been a member of Pro Mujer for eight months, having joined on the invitation of an officer of the institution. Currently Nieves has a business selling food. She said she learned the business on her own initiative upon seeing that there wasn't such a business in her area. At the moment her daughter helps her with her business.

The loan she's getting will be to increase her capital with a wholesale purchase of rice, pasta, and potatoes, which she'll get from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto and after preparation sell in her stall. This job allows her to earn an income to support her family financially, because she's single and has a child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says the health information the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy rice, pasta, and potatoes wholesale

loans.name: Noha

texts.en:
Noha is a Lebanese married woman. She’s 26 years old and mother for four school aged children. She is a housewife, focusing on her family and kids and her husband is a farmer, who owns a chicken farm.

Sanaa at this period is in a real need of a little help from Kiva. For that reason, she is requesting for a loan from kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s educational fees for the coming year. She said that she is happy that she will be able to ensure them a suitable education.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees.

loans.name: Angielyn

texts.en: Angielyn is a fish vendor for almost four years, she is married with two children.Currently her two children are still studying.Angielyn's husband is also a vendor of fish in the market. Even though they are both working hard still their profit is not enough to sustain their daily needs.With her determination to increase her sales and income she is asking for additional capital of PHP 5,000 to be use in buying ten kilos of fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy ten kilos of fish to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 42 years old and single. She works hard to provide for her family. Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as bread, beverages, junk food, home product care, and other groceries.

Gina has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from food vending.

Gina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as bread, beverages, junk food, home product care, and other groceries.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 49 years old and has six children. She is married, and two of her children are in school.

Gina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock. Gina has been in this business for three years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
As a parent of five children, Fe works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell beverages.  Fe is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to buy assorted fish like bangus, tilapia to sell in her business for her fish vending business.

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish like bangus, tilapia to sell in her business

loans.name: Nadon Group

texts.en: Khamdee ’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Khamdee  and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Khamdee  and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Khamdee ’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nduku

texts.en:
Nduku is a married woman with three children  all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has piped water and electricity. She cites school fees and food being her greatly monthly expenses.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbours and people at the market place. She dreams of earning more income and incorporating of hairdressing skills in the future. 

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Gladys Eugenia

texts.es:
Gladys es una mujer de 50 años de edad, separa, cabeza de familia en un hogar conformado por su persona y dos hijos, se dedica a al confección a terceros, negocio que inició como independiente en el año 2013 y que aprendió trabajando como operaria para diferentes empresas.
Ella se encuentra solicitando un apoyo económico para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de peluches y cuadros navideños, los cuales son muy comunes en los hogares en la temporada de fin de año y se venden muy bien.
Con el dinero del préstamo comprara telas, icopor y pinturas, elaborara artículos similares a los que se pueden apreciar en la foto.
texts.en:
Gladys is a 50 year old woman. She is separated and the head of her family in a home composed of herself and two children. She works in garment fabrication for third parties, a business she started independently in the year 2013 after she learned by working for different companies.

She is requesting economic support for the purchase of materials for the production of stuffed toys and quilted Christmas motifs, which are very common in homes during the end-of-year season and sell very well.

With the money from this loan, she will buy fabric, polyester filler, and paint. She will make similar pieces to those shown in the photo.

loans.use: to buy materials for the production of stuffed toys and quilted Christmas motifs.

loans.name: Orbelinda

texts.es:
La señora Orbelinda de 60  años de edad es madre soltera y no tiene hijos que dependan de ella y  vive con sus hijos en su casa  propia, se dedica desde hace 20 años al negocio de venta de tortillas, refrescos, charamuscas, churros, pan, maíz, etc.
Doña Orbelina sus clientes son todos sus vecinos, amistades y personas que la conocen desde hace varios años, vive en un municipio Choluteca,  al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Orbelina está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como: maíz, leña y cal con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende comprar los productos por mayor y conseguir mejores precios, al mismo tiempo mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente subsiguiente  con deseos de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Su sueño es crecer su negocio tener más clientela para poder mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Octubre del  2015.
texts.en:
Miss Orbelinda, 60 years old, is a single mother whose children do not depend on her. She lives with her children in her own house. For 20 years, she has sold tortillas, soft drinks, firewood, churros, bread, corn, etc.

Her clients are all her neighbors, friends and people who have known her for several years. She lives in Choluteca, in the south of Honduras. She is an entrepreneur with the desire to advance herself forward and fights every day to improve her quality of life.

Miss Orbelinda is requesting a loan for the purchase of products like: corn, firewood and lime. With the support of this loan she intends to buy wholesale products and get better prices, at the same time as improving her income and her quality of life. She desires to keep working with a unique point of view.

Her dream is to grow her business and have more clientele to be able to improve her income and her quality of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – October 2015

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and lime for her business.

loans.name: Tuinuane Group

texts.en:
