Edina, who is in her early 30's, is married with four children in school. She has been running a tailoring business for three years now. She works from 7am to 7pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Edina's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her sewing products and has paid back her loan successfully. Edina is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan, and to cover household expenses. Edina will use this loan to increase tailoring products in the shop, and to buy materials for making dresses and suits. She dreams of expanding her business.

Edina will share this loan with her loan group, Tuinuane, which has two members that will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase tailoring products in the shop, and to buy materials for making dresses and suits.

loans.name: Mara Cecilia

texts.es: Mara es una madre amorosa de dos pequeños hijos de 10 y 2 años de edad, ella vive en compañía de su cónyuge y sus hijos en un barrio de Soledad, e inició hace 10 meses su negocio de venta de mercancías, con esta actividad ha logrado continuar con sus responsabilidades en el hogar y lo más importante al cuidado de sus hijos a quienes ofrece una formación en valores y buenas costumbres. Ella comercializa a sus conocidos ropa, calzado, cosméticos, fragancias y electrodomésticos, quienes previamente le realizan los encargos de estas mercancías. Ella necesita fortalecer su capital de trabajo para responder oportunamente a las solicitudes de sus clientes es por ello que realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y comprar televisores, licuadoras, vestidos, blusas, jeans, zapatos unisex y demás. A futuro Mara desea mejorar su capital de trabajo y continuar en el comercio para estar al cuidado de su familia.
texts.en:
Mara is a loving mother of two small children, ages 10 and 2. She lives in the company of her husband and their children in the neighborhood of Soledad. Ten months ago she started her business selling merchandise. With this business she has been able to continue with her responsibilities in the home and most importantly the care of her children, to whom she offers an upbringing in values and good traditions.

She sells clothing, footwear, cosmetics, fragrances, and home appliances to her customers, who previously order these items from her. She needs to strengthen her working capital to respond at the appropriate time to the requests of her customers. That is why she requested a loan, a credikiva, an opportunity to be linked with the financial life through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and buy televisions, blenders, dresses, blouses, jeans, unisex shoes, and other items.

In the future, Mara wants to improve her working capital and continue her business to be able to care for her family.

loans.use: to buy televisions, blenders, dresses, blouses, jeans, unisex shoes, and other items.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Being the mother of four children, Nora needs to be wise in budgeting. She is 43 years old and is married. She is engaged in the retailing business while her husband is a company driver. With her desire to increase her income, Nora is also engaged in a livestock business.

She usually invests her earnings in the education of her children. Due to financial constraints, Nora is not able to finance both her children's allowances in school and her hogs' feed at the same time. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs. She will also use her loan to improve her pig pen to ensure that her hogs will not get foul. As usual, Nora will use her income for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is 28 years old, and married with one child. He lives in Batibut, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental with his family. Jimmy grows and harvests bananas, and sells them in the market. He gets up early in order to go to the fields where he oversees his crops.

Jimmy took a new loan recently to buy organic fertilizer and pesticides for his farm, so he can have a more productive harvest. He plans to improve the family house for better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es:
Ella es Daniela, una joven de 19 años de edad residente del municipio de Montería, ella es soltera y no tiene hijos, cuenta con un negocio de cría de cerdos el cual inició con la intención de generar recursos para estudiar y apoyar a sus padres económicamente.

Daniela ha buscado muchos medios para hacer crecer su negocio pero al no contar con historial crediticio le han cerrado las puertas de un préstamo.

Gracias a la incursión de la corporación Interactuar en zonas de inclusión social, la joven Daniela hoy puede solicitar un préstamo, el cual quiere realizar por medio de su aliado Kiva, con la ilusión de encontrar un apoyo que le permita aumentar el número de animales y así generar mayores ventas.

Daniela solicita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos, cerda de cría y alimento de engorde para sus animales.
texts.en:
This is Daniela, a 19 year old youth and resident of the city of Montería. She is single and has no children. She has a business raising pigs which she started with the intention of generating income to study and to support her parents financially. 

Daniela has sought out many means by which to grow her business but since she does not have a credit history the door to a loan has been closed. 

Thanks to the corporation Interactuar's ventures in areas of social inclusion, the young Daniela can now request a loan. She wants to get it from their partner, Kiva, with the hope of finding the support that will allow her to increase her number of animals and thus generate more sales. 

Daniela requests a loan to buy pigs, a breeding sow and fattening feed for her animals.

loans.use: to buy pigs, a breeding sow and fattening feed for her animals.

loans.name: Erica Astrid

texts.es:
Ella es Érica es una mujer de 32 años de edad que se dedica a la confección a terceros, madre cabeza de familia, separada, sus hijos tienen 11, 6 y 5 años de edad, depende económicamente de su madre.

Érica genera dos empleos, espera seguir creciendo económicamente para contratar una empleada más y mantener tres empleadas durante la temporada de fin de año.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar una máquina recubridora que necesita para agilizar su profesión y entregar su mercancía con un mejor acabado, este préstamo no solo le permitirá comprar la máquina sino también generar el empleo.

El mayor sueño de Érica es comprar una vivienda para vivir cómodamente con sus hijos y pagar la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en: This is Erica, she is a 32-year old woman who works sewing for third party clients. She is a mom, the head of the family, separated. Her children are 11, 6 and 5 years old, she depends economically from her mother. Erica has two jobs, she hopes to continue growing to hire another employee and have three employees during the year-end season. She is asking for a loan to buy a wrapping machine which is needed to speed up her work and deliver her merchandise with a better finish work. This loan will not only allow her to buy the machine but will also generate employment. Erica's biggest dream is to buy a house to live comfortably with her children and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy a wrapping machine

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es una mujer de 56 años de edad, se separó de su esposo, ella genera ingresos gracias a un negocio de fabricación de bolsas de regalo que empezó años atrás, con esto se vale para pagar sus deudas pendientes y comprar el alimento que consume diariamente.
Margarita se siente muy feliz por la temporada de fin de año, es una época de unión familiar y que gracias a los obsequios que tradicionalmente se regalan representa en ventas la mejor época del año, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de materiales para la fabricación de bolsas de regalo, esperando tener grandes ventas que signifiquen el progreso de su negocio y aseguran su perdurabilidad para el año siguiente.
texts.en:
Margarita is a 56-year-old woman who is separated from her husband. She earns a living thanks to her business which she started years ago, making gift bags. This allows her to pay her pending debts and to buy food to eat daily.

Margarita is very happy for the holiday season. This is a time of family unity and, thanks to the tradition of gift giving in this time, this is the best season of the year for sales. This is why she is asking for a loan to buy materials to make gift bags. She is hoping to have large sales which will indicate the progress of her business and will ensure it's durability for the following year.

loans.use: to buy materials to make gift bags.

loans.name: Tamaz

texts.en:
Tamaz is 51 years old. He lives in Khelvachauri district with his large family, including his wife, son, daughter-in-law, grandchild and pensioner mother. The family is involved in agricultural activities. They have cattle and produce dairy products.

Tamaz wants to start a business for stable income and has requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 3,000 GEL. With the loan, he will purchase a refrigerated coffin and will rent it out for funerals. This will give him a stable income.

loans.use: buy a funeral coffin to rent out for funerals.

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
María de 51 años de edad, estudió solo primer grado, le fue imposible continuar ya que su familia es de escasos recursos económicos y su padre falleció cuando ella era una niña, actualmente está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura,.  es madre de 5 hijos, 2 hijos viven con ella y también dos nietos.


María se dedica al comercio de ropa desde hace 8 años,  también se dedica al comercio de pescado fresco, ella compra el pescado a los proveedores y lo vende en los cantones vecinos, la ropa la compra al por mayor y la vende en los cantones cercanos y es así como obtiene ingresos económicos para mantener a su familia.

Ella necesita este crédito para comprar mas ropa para damas y caballeros y pescado para seguir vendiendo y obteniendo ganancias.

El sueño de María es  trabajar duramente para sacar adelante a sus hijos y prepararlos con sus estudios para que tengan una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 51 years old and has a first grade education. It was impossible for her to finish school because she is from a low-income family and her father died when she was a young girl. Presently, she is married and her husband works in agriculture. She is the mother of five children. Two of her children, and her two grandchildren, live with her.

For eight years, Maria has worked selling clothing. She also works selling fresh fish. She buys the fish from the suppliers and she sells them in neighboring towns. She buys clothing in bulk and she sells it in nearby towns. This is how she earns an income to support her family.

She needs a loan to buy more clothing for men and women and to buy fish to continue selling and earning an income. Maria's dream is to work hard to bring her children forward and to prepare them in their studies so that they can have a better life.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for men and women, and to buy fish.

loans.name: Morlinda

texts.en:
Morlinda is 55 years old and married. She lives with her family at Solana. She raises hogs and sells them when they reach the desired weight. She wants to improve the hogs' growth and nutrition so she is now asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy feed.

Someday, Morlinda hopes to continue improving her income from her small business and save funds for emergency needs.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Otella

texts.en:
Otella is 65 years old and married with one child. She lives in Gata Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental with her family. Otella has a retail store serving numerous customers. She sells assorted groceries and beverages to generate additional income while her husband engages in transport services.

Otella is working hard every day in order to provide income for the family and to show customers her responsibility and reliability to serve. Otella requested this loan to buy additional goods and bottled soft drink products to sell. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits so that she may open a bigger place and continue assisting her family with additional income.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lucena works hard to support her family.

She has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Lucena is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell in her coconut wine vending business.

Lucena has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Moureen

texts.en:
Moureen is a married woman with one child, who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has piped water and electricity. She cites school fees and food as her greatest monthly expenses.

Moureen has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbours and people at the marketplace. She dreams of earning more income and adding hairdressing skills in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, Moureen wants to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Marneys Del Socorro

texts.es:
Marneys es una mujer de 44 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja, tiene tres hijos adolescentes los cuales están cursando estudios superiores,
Ella se dedica a atender un negocio de venta de mercancía varia, al cual le dedica 12 horas diarias, pero en temporada de diciembre atenderá 15 a 18 horas.

Su negocio tiene 8 años de vida, 8 años donde la perseverancia y las ganas de salir adelante le permitieron mantenerse en el tiempo y ganar utilidad en su trabajo.

Marneys se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual quiere invertir en la compra de surtido en general, tales como accesorios, lociones, calzado, ropa, artículos de papelería, entre otros. Espera que con este negocio mejoren sus ventas, aumenten sus clientes y obtener una buena utilidad que le ayuda a pagar el semestre universitario de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marneys is a 44-year-old woman. She lives in a common law relationship with her partner. They have three adolescent children who are in their upper level studies.

She works attending to a business selling various merchandise, to which she dedicates 12 hours daily, but in the December season she will work 15-18 hours.

Her business is 8 years old, 8 years where perseverance and determination to get ahead have allowed her to maintain the business through time and to earn profit in her work.

Marneys is requesting a loan to invest in buying supplies in general, such as accessories, lotions, footwear, clothing, stationery items, among other things. She hopes that with this business her sales improve, her customers expand, and to obtain a good profit to help her pay for her children's university semester.

loans.use: to stock up on accessories, lotions, footwear, clothing, stationery items, and other things.

loans.name: Glady Esperanza

texts.es:
Glady, de 61 años de edad, estudio hasta 6° grado, esta casada, madre de 2 hijos los cuales ya no dependen de ella, vive solo con su esposo, el cual es empleado en una compañía de seguridad.


Glady se dedica a los oficios del hogar, y al cuidado de aves de corral,  actividad que realiza desde hace 16 años lo cual aprendió de su madre.


 Glady utilizará el dinero para pagar a mozos que le ayuden a sacar la cosecha de granos básicos.

Ella sueña con seguir trabajando juntamente con su esposo para mejorar su calidad de vida y cambiar sus condiciones  económicas.
texts.en:
Glady is 61 years old and studied until 6th grade. She is married and has two children that are no longer dependent on her. She lives alone with her husband, who works in a security company. 

Glady takes care of the household chores and raises poultry, an activity she has been doing for the last 16 years, and that she learned from her mother. 

Glady will use the money to pay laborers to help with the harvest of basic grains.

She dreams of being able to continue working with her husband to improve their quality of life and change their economic conditions.

loans.use: to pay laborers to help with the harvest of basic grains

loans.name: Juntos Al Desarrollo Group

texts.es: Iván, tiene 38 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene un hijo, y residen en una aldea del municipio de Lepaera Lempira. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura. Aproximadamente hace 15 años que cultiva café el cual lo vende a intermediarios de la zona. Iván ha invertido varios préstamos en sus cultivos para obtener buena producción. Este otro  préstamo que actualmente solicita es en forma grupal el cual va invertir en la compra de abonos, fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra para darle mantenimiento a su finca y para resiembra de café. Con esta asistencia espera obtener mejor cosecha. Su plan es ampliar su finca de café. El grupo se llama Juntos al Desarrollo y lo forman tres personas que viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican al cultivo de café.  El préstamo grupal que solicitan es por 56,000 para brindar asistencia al cultivo de café y para resiembra del mismo. En la foto se encuentra a la izquierda don José, Iván y María a la derecha.
texts.en:
Iván, 38, lives in a common-law marriage with his wife, and they have one child. They live in a community in the town of Lepaera, Lempira. He has always worked in agriculture.

He has been growing coffee for about 15 years. He sells it to third parties in the area. Iván has invested several loans in his crops so he can get a better harvest.

This new loan he's requesting now is a group loan, which he'll invest in buying soil amendments and fertilizer, and in paying for labor to maintain his farm and to plant coffee. He hopes to get a better harvest with this help. His plan is to expand his coffee farm.

The group is called Juntos al Desarrollo and it's made up of three people from the same community who work as coffee growers. The group loan they're requesting is for 56,000 [HNL] to provide care for the coffee crop and for planting.

In the photo are José on the left, Iván, and María on the right.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments and fertilizer, and to pay for labor to provide maintenance for his farm and for planting coffee

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a single woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more fruits and vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will be succesful. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to add more vegetables.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Kimanga Group

texts.en:
Fransisca, who is in her late 20's, is single with one child who is still in school. She has been selling fashion clothes at her shop for five years now. She works from 8am to 8pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Fransisca's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her clothes stock, and has managed to repay all her loans successfully. Fransisca is so thankful for the loan and appreciates Kiva lenders for the support of their group. She used the profit to pay school fees for her child, renovate her house, repay the loan and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy up to date clothes to meet customer requirements. She dreams of opening another shop to sell more fashion clothes.

Fransisca will share this loan with her loan group "KIMANGA," which has two members who will hold each other accountable to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy up to date clothes to meet her customers' requirements.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman with two children. She describes herself as determined. Eunice operates a restaurant and has been involved in this business for eight years.

Eunice's business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food to sell.

Eunice hopes that in the future she can open more business outlets. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. Eunice will use the anticipated profits to open a hotel.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients.

loans.name: Lucina

texts.en:
Lucina is 63 years old and married with two children.

Lucina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell such as beverages, junk food, home product care, and other groceries.

Lucina has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns income from food vending.

Lucina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as beverages, junk food, home product care, and other groceries.

loans.name: Belisario De Jesus

texts.es:
Belisario es un hombre de 41 años de edad, soltero sin hijos, vive en una residencia propia, es una persona humilde trabajadora la cual se dedica a la cría de ganado porcino. El cliente se encuentra buscando por todos los medios posibles salir adelante, mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus ingresos para así mejorar su calidad de vida, mantener su negocio y empezar el año 2016 de la mejor manera.

El cliente se encuentra solicita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos, alimento de engorde y vacunas. Con la inversión espera tener una gran temporada de ventas que le ayuden a mejorar su calidad de vida, mejorar empresarialmente y el aspecto de su hogar.
texts.en:
Belisario, 41, is single and has no children. He lives in his own home. He's a modest and hardworking person who earns a living raising pigs. He's using all the means possible for ways he can get ahead, improve his sales, and increase his income. They way he can improve his income, support his business, and begin 2016 in the best possible way.

The client's requesting a loan to buy pigs, fattening feed, and vaccines. With the investment he hopes to have a great sales season that will help improve his income, his business, and the appearance of his home.

loans.use: to buy pigs, fattening feed, and vaccines

loans.name: Oscar Alexander

texts.es:
Oscar de 27 años de edad, solo estudió hasta noveno grado, ya que por motivos económicos no pudo continuar, está soltero y sin hijos, vive con su demás familia y nadie depende de él.

Oscar tiene una panadería, desde hace 3 años se dedica al comercio de pan, lo aprendió en un taller donde puso mucho empeño y así fue como inició su propio negocio, solo un familiar suyo se involucra y le ayuda a Oscar con el trabajo de panificación.

Él solicita este crédito para comprar harina, huevos, azícar, sal, levaduras, etc para la elaboración de pan.

Su sueño es que su negocio siga en marcha y tener muchos clientes que consuman su pan en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Oscar, 27 years old, only studied until ninth grade, since due to economic reasons he could not continue. He is single and without children. He lives with the rest of his family and no one depends on him.

Oscar has a bakery, and for the last 3 years he has worked in the bread business. He learned the business in a shop where he put in a lot of effort and that was how he started his own business. Only one relative of his is involved and helps Oscar with the work of bread making.

He requests this loan to buy flour, eggs, sugar, salt, yeast, etc. to make bread.

His dream is that his business continues to progress and to have many customers that consume his bread in the community.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, sugar, salt, yeast, etc. to make bread.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
José es un joven de 25 años de edad el cual se dedica a la cría de cerdos, vive unión libre con su pareja con la cual tiene una pequeña de 4 años de edad, su familia es su principal fuente de energía, su meta es bridarle un hogar confortable donde no pasen necesidades y tenga un futuro próspero.

A pesar de que vive en una zona de postconflicto, es un hombre emprendedor que se fabrica sus propias oportunidades, pues montó un negocio de cría y venta de animales, trabaja con gallinas, pollos y cerdos.

El cliente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para comprar alimento al por mayor, para sus animales, el alimento principalmente es para acelerar el proceso de engorde de los animales y así venderlos en diciembre.
texts.en:
José, 25, is a young man who earns a living raising pigs. He lives in a common-law marriage with his partner. They have a four-year-old little girl. His family is his main source of energy. His goal is to give them a comfortable home where they will lack for nothing and have a prosperous future.

Despite living in a post-conflict zone, he's an enterprising man who makes his own opportunities, because he started a business raising and selling animals. He works with hens, chickens, and pigs.

The client's requesting a loan to buy feed wholesale for his animals. The feed is primarily to accelerate the fattening products so he can sell them in December.

loans.use: to buy feed wholesale for his animals.  The feed is mainly to accelerate the fattening process

loans.name: Sara 9 Group

texts.en:
Abir is the featured borrower for Sara 9 Group. She got together with the other members of the group to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Abir is a 39-year-old divorced mother of one child, and she has been employed at a company for two years. She earns a limited salary to cover the needs and expenses of her child. Abir is trying hard to improve her living conditions. As such, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to start a new business of selling clothes as a second source of income.

In the photo, Abir is the lady sitting in the middle. With respect to the other group members, Zoubaida is the first lady on the right, and Enaam is the first lady on the left.

loans.use: to start a new business of selling clothes as a second source of income.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 43 years old and married with two children. Her husband works as a farmer within her locality. Marites has been running her variety store for ten years.

Marites would like to keep her variety and ensure the eatery is progressive, and that's why she's asking for additional capital of PHP 5,000. This loan will be used to buy additional variety of vegetables, as well as more stock of grocery items and meat to sell.

Marites hopes and prays for continuous growth of her business to sustain her basic family necessities and to let her children finish their studies someday.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables, as well as more stock of grocery items and meat to sell.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 52 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Letecia works very hard to provide for them.

Letecia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like biscuits, bread, beverages, canned goods, and other groceries.

Letecia has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items, such as beverages, biscuits, canned goods, noodles, oil, condiments, etc.

In the future, Letecia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like biscuits, bread, beverages, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Tengiz

texts.en: Tengiz is 53 years old. He lives in Khelvachauri district with his wife and two children. Tengiz works at a local petrol station as an operator and gets a small monthly income. Tengiz owns a flat which needs renovation. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 2,100 USD. With the received credit he will renovate his flat and rent it out in order to get additional income and make a better future for his children.

loans.use: to renovate a flat and rent it out in order to have stable income.

loans.name: Regina

texts.es:
Regina es una mujer cabeza de familia de 44 años de edad, una luchadora de mil batallas todo un ejemplo de vida, de como una mujer saco adelante tres hijos, a la cual le cerraron las puertas del empleo, pero ella no se resignó y monto un negocio de venta de fritos y refrescos. 

Ella tiene un sueño de pagar la educación de sus muchachos, comprar vivienda, mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, hasta ahora, lo ha logrado, trabajando incansablemente en su cafetería.

Regina para generar más recursos quiere ampliar su negocio para iniciar a vender comidas rápidas, por este motivo quiere solicitar un préstamo para lograr este sueño, con el dinero comprara el puesto, los enseres e insumos para comenzar rápidamente con dicha profesión.
texts.en:
Regina is a 44-year-old female head of household, a fighter of a thousand battles. She is a complete example of life, of how a mother got her three children ahead, to whom the doors of employment were shut, but she did not give up and she started a business selling fried foods and drinks.

She has a dream to pay for her children's education, to buy a home, and improve the living conditions of her family. Until now, she has achieved it, working tirelessly in her cafeteria.

Regina, to generate more income, wants to expand her business to begin selling fast food. This is why she wants to request a loan to achieve this dream. With the money she will buy the stand, the basic tools, and ingredients to begin quickly with this profession.

loans.use: to begin selling fast food.

loans.name: Lina Maria

texts.es:
Lina es una mujer de 29 años de edad, mujer responsable, alegre, sonriente y muy honesta la cual se dedica a prestar servicios de peluquería, manicura y pedicura, negocio que nació de la necesidad económica, del gusto por el trabajo independiente y de su gusto por la estética capilar.

Lina poco a poco está formando su salón de belleza, invirtiendo sus ganancias en diferentes artículos y activos necesarios en su negocio, se proyecta lograr poner dos puntos de corte de pelo para generar empleo, para ello necesita infraestructura y si lo logra será un aumento considerable en ventas dad que tendría capacidad para atender mayor número de clientes.

Para Lina está será su primer temporada de fin de año con su negocio, espera obtener muy buenos beneficios económicos que le ayuden a tener ya un local constituido para el año venidero.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos y activos para su negocio, tales como plancha, máquina para aplanchar	, máquina para motilar, insumos para realizar lisado, peinados etc., lava-cabezas y un tocador.
texts.en:
Lina is a 29-year-old woman. She is a responsible, happy, smiling, and very honest woman that earns a living providing hair salon, manicure and pedicure services. The business was started out of financial necessity, a love of independent work, and her love of aesthetics and hair.

Little by little Lina is forming her beauty salon. She is investing her earnings in different articles and assets necessary in her business. She is projected to achieve placing two booths for hair cuts in order to create jobs. To do this she needs infrastructure, and if she achieves it, it will be a considerable increase in sales since she will have the capacity to serve a greater number of clients.

For Lina, this will be her first end-of-the-year season with her business. She hopes to obtain very good financial benefits that help her to have a makeup booth in the coming year. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies and assets for her business such as irons, ironing machine. trimmer, supplies to perform exfoliation, haircuts, etc., a shampoo chair and a vanity table.

loans.use: to buy supplies and assets for her business such as irons, ironing machine. trimmer, supplies to perform exfoliation, haircuts, etc.

loans.name: Julio Abelino

texts.es: Julio de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la venta de medicina natural desde hace 10 años con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un dormitorio pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razon esta solicitando un credito para la compra de los materiales de construccion necesarios para poder ampliar su casa.
texts.en: Julio is 44 years old and lives in the house he owns with his wife. For the past 10 years he has dedicated himself to the sale of natural remedies, which allows him to cover some of his home expenses. He would like to improve his home by adding a bedroom, but he does not earn enough to do so. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to purchase the building materials needed to expand his home.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary building materials.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas earns a living through tailoring. She caters services like dressmaking, dress adjustments, and other tailoring services. She is a 57-year-old married woman and has eight grown children. She lives in the town of Carmen.

She would like to boost her income by acquiring more materials in order to cope with demands. Felicitas has requested a loan to purchase materials like sewing thread, zippers and a new sewing machine. In that way, her earnings will slowly improve. Thus, she would be able to set aside some of the profit for future use.

She is hopeful that someday her source of income will become successful, coupled with hard work and determination to go forward for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase materials like sewing thread, zippers and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Alina

texts.fr: Alina est une femme divorcée âgée de 38 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Mère d’un seul enfant, Alina s’efforce  pour gagner son revenu  en revendant des articles de mercerie dans sa boutique. Pour s’approvisionner, Alina se rend quatre fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des unités de moules de pression, de doublures, de visselines et des paquets de fil, Alina nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera suite à une bonne revente, Alina va pouvoir bien prendre soins de ses enfants et  agrandir son commerce.
texts.en: Alina is a divorced woman, 38 years old, who lives in Tokoin. The mother of one child, she strives to earn an income by selling sewing supplies in her shop. To stock up, she goes to the market four times a month. To order units of “moules de pression”, lining material, “visselines” and packets of thread, Alina has need of funds to finance her supplies. With the resulting profits from her sales, she will be able to take good care of [her child] and expand her commerce.

loans.use: to purchase a unit of "moule de pression", 15 units of lining material, 5 units of "visseline", and 13 packets of thread.

loans.name: Essohanam

texts.fr: Essohanam est une femme mariée âgée de 32 ans résidante à Tokoin. Mère de deux enfants, Essohanam est une marchande des produits alimentaires qu’elle revend en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Essohanam s’approvisionne de ses marchandises deux fois par mois  au marché et désire ce prêt pour commander des sacs de riz, des bidons d’huile et des plateaux d’œufs. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Essohanam compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider son mari à prendre en charge les besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Essohanam is a married woman, 32 years old, residing in Tokoin. The mother of two, she is a merchant of grocery items, which she sells by circulating through nearby districts. She gets her supplies of merchandise twice a month at the market and would like have this loan to order sacks of rice, containers of oil, and trays of eggs. With the resulting profits, Essohanam plans to improve her range of offerings and to help out her husband in meeting family needs.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of rice, 5 containers of oil, and 25 trays of eggs

loans.name: Noemi Yaneth

texts.es:
La señora Noemí es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada al comercio que es su fuente principal de ingresos, vende comida como ser desayunos y almuerzos y a su vez elabora nacatamales, este negocio lo atiende desde hace 7 años. Su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación y las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante
Doña Noemí sus principales clientes son vecinos de su comunidad está solicitando el Préstamo para la compra de materia prima como ser: carne, arroz, maíz, papas, chile, tomate, condimentos, etc. espera con esta inversión poder salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida y el de su familia.
Doña Noemí  sueña con ampliar su negocio y captar más clientes y así aumentar sus ingresos.


Danli, Honduras -  Noviembre del 2015
texts.en:
Noemí's an enterprising woman who earns a living as a merchant, which is her main source of income. She sells food for breakfast and lunch. She makes nacatamales, a business she has had for seven years. It's located in her home and she makes sales as a street vendor.

Noemí's main customers are neighbors in her community. She's requesting the loan to buy ingredients, including meat, rice, corn, potatoes, chili peppers, tomatoes, and spices. She hopes to get ahead and improve her quality of life and her family's with this investment.

Noemí dreams of expanding her business and attracting more customers so she can increase her income.

Danli, Honduras, November 2015

loans.use: to buy meat, rice, corn, potatoes, chili peppers, tomatoes, spices, etc. for her business

loans.name: Fatou Seye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 4 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée en novembre 2009 regroupant des femmes du même quartier et qui entretiennent d’excellentes relations. Elles s'activent principalement dans le commerce.
FATOU debout à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche est l'emprunteuse vedette, mariée et mère 6 enfants dont 2 garçons et 4 filles. Elle s'active dans le commerce de céréales ( mil, maïs) et d'autres produits divers. Elle tient une alimentation chez elle depuis deux années.
Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter du mil pour une valeur de 100 000 FCFA, du maïs pour 50 000 FCFA qu'elle va revendre ensuite. Avec le reste du prêt, elle achète divers produits (tomates, riz, huile, biscuits, épices....) pour renouveler le stock au niveau de sa boutique afin de satisfaire sa clientèle.
Les bénéfices récoltés de son activité lui permettront d’épargner afin de préparer l'avenir de ces enfants mais aussi aider ces derniers en satisfaisant leurs besoins.
texts.en:
This group of 4 members is part of the 'banc villageois' that was created in November 2009. It is composed of women from the same district who maintain excellent relationships among themselves. The women are active mainly in commerce.

FATOU, standing at the right in the photo with her left hand raised, is the featured borrower. She is the married mother of six children (two boys and four girls). She sells grains (millet, corn) and various other goods. She has had a grocery store in her home for two years.

With her new loan, she intends to purchase some millet worth 100,000 francs CFA and some corn worth 50,000 francs that she will then resell. With the rest of the loan, she is purchasing a variety of goods (tomatoes, rice, oil, cookies, spices, …) to renew her shop’s inventory in order to satisfy her customers.

The profits earned from her business will enable her to save money for her children’s future, as well as for helping them by meeting their needs.

loans.use: to purchase millet, corn, tomatoes, rice, oil, cookies, and spices

loans.name: Las Retamitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS RETAMITAS” iniciará el décimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Los Andes, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maxima es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, servicio de transporte, servicio de café internet, venta de comida, venta de frutas, tienda de abarrotes, bordados en prendas de vestir.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maxima es integrante, ella indica que hace siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su hermana que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio un taller de bordados en prendas de vestir; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años aprendió por iniciativa propia. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de hilos por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto para posteriormente ofrecer sus servicios en su taller de bordados. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "LAS RETAMITAS" will begin its twelfth cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal Los Andes. It is made up of ten members and is managed by a board where Maxima is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied and among them are: vegetable sales, transportation service, internet café service, food sales, fruit sales, a grocery store, and embroidery on clothing items.

The loan they will take out will benefit the small micro enterprises where Maxima is a member. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer seven years ago, joining by the invitation of her sister who is a client of the institution. Currently she has a business that is a shop of embroidery on clothing items. It is worth mentioning that she started this business several years ago and learned it by her own initiative.

The loan she will take out will be to increase capital (buy wholesale thread) that she will acquire from the wholesale sellers from the city of El Alto to later offer her services in her embroidery shop. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, since she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wholesale thread.

loans.name: Samah1 Group

texts.en:
Nadwa is the featured borrower for samah1 Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Nadwa is a 47-year-old married woman who has worked for thirteen years in her father's grocery shop. She is managing the shop well and has her loyal customers. She worked hard throughout the years to develop and expand the shop to better satisfy her family's needs. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her medical treatment expenses. She is the lady in the middle.

With respect to the other group members, Samah is the lady on the left, while Sahar is the lady on the right.

loans.use: to pay for her medical treatment expenses

loans.name: Ivin

texts.en:
Ivin lives at Solana. She is 47 years old and had six children. She manages a vegetable stall and patiently acquires profits for her family's daily needs. She used part of her profits as revolving capital in her business, and the other part of it was used for education expenses.

Ivin wanted to improve her sales, so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fish, fruits and vegetables to re-sell. Additional vegetables to sell will help increase capacity of sales and profits as well.

loans.use: to buy fish, fruits and vegetables to re-sell

loans.name: Rocky's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe fait partie du banc villageois fondé en avril 2007. Il regroupe des femmes très dynamiques qui sont très solidaires entre elles et s'activent dans le commerce, l'embouche et l’agriculture. La majorité d'entre elles partage la même culture et la même langue.
KHEMESSE debout à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche est l'emprunteuse vedette,âgée de 41 ans et  mariée. Elle s'active dans le  commerce de tissus, d'habits et de parfums depuis des années.
Avec le prêt, elle envisage d'acheter des habits pour une valeur de 145 000 FCFA, des tissus pour une valeur de 200 000 FCFA et enfin des parfums pour une valeur de 100 000 FCFA.Elle revend ses produits dans les marchés hebdomadaires des localités environnants.
les bénéfices serviront à renforcer son pouvoir d'achat afin de développer son activité, mais aussi épargner au niveau du banc villageois et enfin satisfaire ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
This group is part of the 'banc villageois' that was founded in April 2007. It is composed of very energetic women who have a lot of solidarity among them. The women are active in commerce, raising livestock, and farming. Most of them share the same culture and the same language.

KHEMESSE, standing at the right in the photo with her left hand raised, is the featured borrower. She is 41 years old and married. For years, she has been active in the commerce of fabrics, clothing, and perfumes.

With this loan, she envisions buying some clothing worth 145,000 francs; some fabrics worth 200,000 francs; and finally some perfumes worth 100,000 francs. She resells her products at the weekly markets in nearby towns.

The profits will be used to bolster her buying power in order to develop her business, to save money at the 'banc villageois’, and to meet her personal needs.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, clothing, and perfumes.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a married man. He has two children.

Stephen operates a barber shop. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Stephen will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy barber shop equipment. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy barber shop equipment

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila has a food-vending livelihood. She prepares and sells snack foods like hot cakes, pastries and ice cream.

She is a 39-year-old married woman and has four school-aged children. On the other hand, her husband earns a living by working abroad.

Selling cakes and pastries is in demand in her locality, which is why she joined CEVI, to cater to her financial need.

She would like to boost her earnings by providing more display of goods, but, unfortunately, she has not enough capital to do it.

Sheila wants to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, milk, flour and vanilla. In that way, she will be able to cater the needs of her respective customers, and her income will improve slowly. Thus, she could roll out her capital and set aside some of the profit for future use.

Sheila is determined that she can make it to be more productive and to improve the living condition of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, milk, flour and vanilla.

loans.name: Carmen Alicia

texts.es:
Carmen es una orgullosa  y tradicional mujer campesina, tiene 67 años de edad, se dedica a las actividades agropecuarias las cuales aprendió de su esposo quien fue el que la impulso a tener su propio negocio y generar sus recursos para solventar sus necesidades y deseos.

Su actividad principal es la producción de lácteos, gracias a la utilidad que genera puede vivir una vida tranquila y realizar reformar a su hogar, al ser una persona típica del campo le gusta tener un jardín lleno de flores, una buena vivienda una excelente casa y solo desea tener salid para seguir construyendo el hogar de sus sueños.

Para mejorar sus ventas y aumentar su capital la señora Carmen quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual usará en la compra de 2 vacas lecheras, esto con la intención de tener mayor rotación de vacas, puesto que algunas se secan y necesita un tiempo para volver a producir la leche, con las dos nuevas vacas lo que busca es mantener una producción de leche regular a lo largo del año.
texts.en:
Carmen is a proud and traditional farming woman. She is 67 years old and works in the agriculture and livestock businesses, which she learned from her husband who inspired her to have her own business and generate resources to cover her needs and desires.

Her main business is producing dairy milk. Thanks to the profit she generates she can live a calm life and carry out a remodel to her home. Being a typical country person, she likes to have a garden full of flowers, a good home and excellent house, and she only wants to have health to continue building the home of her dreams.

To improve her sales and expand her capital, Carmen wants to request a loan which she will use to buy two dairy cows with the intention of having a better rotation of cows, given that some dry out and need time to return to producing milk. With the two new cows she seeks to maintain regular milk production throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows with the intention of having a better rotation of cows to maintain production all year.

loans.name: Makhmad

texts.en:
Makhmad is 56 years old and from Telavi district, Kakheti region. He lives with his wife and son.

Makhmad works physically and gets daily income to cover everyday expenses. As the income is not enough for a three-member family, he decided to start an additional business.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 1,000 GEL. With the received credit he will purchase 55 small turkeys and will raise them in order to resell at a higher price and increase family income.

Makhmad awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase 55 small turkeys and raise them in order to resell at a good price.

loans.name: Fidelino

texts.es:
Fidelino es un hombre de 55 años de edad es casado con una linda familia de siete hijos de las edades entre 8 y 21 años, esta familia vive en  una comunidad de San Andrés Semetabaj.
Fedelino para sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la sastrería, lleva  15 años de dedicarse a este tipo de trabajo, a Dios gracias le ha ido muy bien, pues mucha gente prefiere su servicio, su esposa la apoya con los gastos de la casa pues se dedica a la compra y venta de güipiles típicos.
Fedelino con el deseo de superarse con su familia ha decidido solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de una cuerda de terreno para cultivo, pues hasta el momento  cuenta con muy poco terreno para cultivar su milpa. Él confía plenamente en este crédito para hacer posible esta oportunidad que la vida le presenta. Su esperanza de vida es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Fidelino is a 55-year-old married man. He has a beautiful family of 7 children, between 8 and 21 years old. This family lives in a community in San Andrés Semetabaj.

To support his family, Fedelino makes a living as a tailor. He has worked in the field for 15 years. Thanks to God, it has gone very well for him, as many people prefer his services. His wife helps him with household expenses by buying and selling güipiles [traditional dresses or blouses].

Wanting to be successful along with his family, Fedelino has decided to request a loan, which he will use to buy a parcel of land to cultivate. Up until now, he has had very little land on which to grow his corn. He is relying completely on this loan to make possible this opportunity that life has presented. His life's hope is to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a parcel of land to cultivate

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Esmero, dedicación y pasión por el trabajo es lo que lleva a María  a superarse ella es una mujer de 33 años que se dedica a tener cortes típicos, ella tiene una familia por lo que trabaja todos los días, esta amada familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Para María no hay nada más importante que sus tres hijos, por esa razón busca siempre fortalecer su negocio pues su mayor fuente de ingresos es su negocio de tejer cortes típicos, con la visión de seguir superándose ahora está solicitando un crédito  que lo invertirá en la compra de materiales como hilos y tintes de diferentes colores.
Su gran sueño es poder mejorar su vivienda y también darle a su familia una calidad de vida mejor.
texts.en:
Attention to detail, dedication, and passion for her work are what drive María to succeed. She is a 33-year-old woman who works making traditional woven clothing. She works every day for the sake of her family, who live in a community in Sololá.

Nothing is more important to María than her three children. That is why she is always seeking to develop her business. Her main source of income is her business weaving traditional clothing.
In order to continue her success, she is now requesting a loan, which she will invest in buying materials such as threads and dyes in different colors.

Her greatest dream is to be able to improve her home and also give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy threads and dyes to make traditional woven clothing.

loans.name: Maria Amparo

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 53 años de edad la cual vive en unión libre con su pareja, ella se dedica a la venta de alimentos fritos en un pequeño negocio que ubica en su hogar, sus ingresos son modestos pero se siente de feliz de aportar un granito de arena en el sostenimiento de su hogar.

María quiere lograr la independencia económica, tener un negocio lo suficientemente rentable para valerse por sí misma, es su sueño y trabaja mucho para lograrlo.

La cliente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para iniciar un nuevo negocio que será la venta de comidas rápidas para vender fines de semana en las noches, el dinero será para la compra de puesto de venta, comprara los enseres e insumos para vender estos productos.
texts.en:
Mary is a 53-year-old woman who lives with her partner. She sells fried food from a tiny business located in their home. Her earnings are modest but she is happy to add her two cents to supporting their household. 

Mary wants to achieve economic independence, to have a business profitable enough to stand on its own;  This is her dream and she works hard to realize it.  

She is requesting a loan to start a new business selling fast food on weekend nights. The money will be used to buy a food stand, the equipment and supplies she needs to sell these products.

loans.use: to start a new business that will be selling fast food.

loans.name: N’Sii Group

texts.fr: Furaha est sénior commerçante, présidente de la banque communautaire «N’Sii», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, divorcée, âgée de 57 ans, mère de 5 enfants dont 4 scolarisés et 1est grand. Elle est vendeuse des braises dans un dépôt de la ville depuis 5 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en seize sacs de braises. Elle commença son business avec le fonds reçu de son champs. Elle souhaite accroitre son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Furaha is a senior merchant and the president of the community bank called N’Sii. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is a divorced woman, 57 years old, and the mother of five children, of whom four are in school, and one is an adult. She is going to stock up with sixteen sacks of charcoal.

She began her business with funds from her farm fields. She would like to grow her business and provide schooling and food for her children. So she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to stock up with sixteen sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Enidith Clemencia

texts.es:
Ella es Enidith, una madre guerrera, luchadora, una persona que toda la vida se ha valido de sus manos para generar recursos, de su talento y recursividad para generarse oportunidades, monto un negocio de tienda de abarrotes para generar ingresos, puesto que su familia es muy abundante y su pareja no gana el suficiente dinero, para sostenerla a ella y a sus 5 hijos.

Enidith solicita un préstamo para abastecer su negocio con productos de la canasta familiar, refrescos y cervezas, quiere tener un negocio lo suficientemente abastecido para atender la demanda de fin de año y seguir generando calidad de vida a su familia y una prospera y feliz navidad.
texts.en:
This is Enidith, a mother, a warrior and a fighter, a person who has made good use of her hands to generate resources. She has used her talent and resourcefulness to generate opportunities. She opened a grocery store business to generate income, given that her family is abundant and her partner doesn't make enough money to sustain her and their 5 children

Enidith is requesting a loan to stock her business with basic food products, soft drinks and beer. She wants to have her business sufficiently stocked to care for the end of the year demand and continue to generate quality of living for her family and a prosperous and happy New Year.

loans.use: to buy basic food items, soft drinks and beer as she wants her store sufficiently stocked to meet the end of the year demand.

loans.name: Wilfredo Antonio

texts.es:
Wilfredo es un hombre de 40 años agricultor de nacimiento, se dedica a la agricultura y la cría de aves, negocio con el cual genera el sustento para alimentar su familia conformada por su pareja con quien vive en unión libre y su pequeño campeón de 7 años de edad.

Wilfredo es un hombre humilde que no cuenta con muchos recursos y no quiere excusarse para dejar de trabajar por el contrario busca todas las alternativas posibles para seguir realizando su profesión, por este motivo hoy pide a la comunidad Kiva un apoyo, un monto de dinero con el cual comprara insumos agrícolas para la asistencia técnica a sus cultivos, también comprara aves de corral para el levante y alimento para las mismas.

Su sueño es seguir desarrollando al actividad que por tanto tiempo ha realizado y con esta construir un futuro próspero para su familia.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is a 40 year old man who's a farmer by birth, he works in agriculture and raising poultry, a business from which he earns the means to feed his family. His family consists of his partner, with whom he cohabitates, and his little 7 year old champ. Wilfredo is poor and doesn't have much but he doesn't want any allowances to stop working, to the contrary he looks for every way possible to continue doing his job, and this is the reason that he's asking for support from the Kiva community. 

He'll use the sum of money to purchase agricultural supplies to provide support to his crops, and also purchase farm poultry to raise and their feed. His dream is to keep doing the job that he's done for so long, and use it build a prosperous future for his family.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies to provide support for his crops. He'll also purchase farm poultry to raise and their feed.

loans.name: Sophio

texts.en:
Sophio is 29 years old. She lives in Sagarejo, Georgia with her husband, child and parents-in-law. She is unemployed and wants to buy a cow to start a husbandry enterprise.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, will enable Sophio to get a loan of 2100 GEL. With the received credit she will buy the cow, start selling dairy products and use part of the output to feed her family.

Sophio is very motivated and awaits your support.

loans.use: buy a cow and start selling dairy products.

loans.name: María Isabeth

texts.es:
María, de 43 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora, honesta y responsable, que no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está casada y es madre de 2 hijos que estudian en la escuela de su comunidad y en su casa vive con su esposo e hijos.

María, se dedica a hacer los oficios del hogar, pero también se dedica a la crianza de aves y cerdos, pero por el momento solo tiene aves de corral, mientras su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, él siembra granos básicos para el consumo de su familia y en ocasiones también trabaja como ayudante de albañil.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar cerdos y concentrado para engordarlos y luego venderlos, para obtener ganancia económica.

María, sueña con producir diversos productos agrícolas y pecuarios para obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
43-year-old María is a very hard-working, honest, and responsible woman. She did not have the opportunity to go to school. She is married and the mother of 2 children who attend their community's school. She lives with her husband and children.

María makes a living by doing housework, but she also works raising birds and pigs. But at the moment, she only has poultry. Meanwhile, her husband works in agriculture. He grows basic grains for the family to eat, and sometimes he also works as a construction assistant.

María needs the loan to buy pigs and pig feed in order to fatten and later sell them, to make an income.

María dreams of making diverse farming and livestock products in order to make a better income.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed in order to fatten and later sell them

loans.name: José Inmer

texts.es:
José de 26 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer año de bachillerato, aún no está casado y tampoco tiene hijos, él vive con su madre y solamente ella depende de él.

José se dedica al negocio de ganado desde hace 6 años, es un joven muy trabajador, aprendió las labores con su padre ya que ha sido un buen ejemplo para él, el lugar donde José trabaja está a 5 km de su casa y se va a pie ya que no hay acceso de tranpsorte.

El solicita este crédito para comprar unos terneros pequeños ya que se los están ofreciendo a buen precio.

Su sueño es ser un buen ganadero y darles buen ajemplo a sus hijos algún día que sea padre de familia.
texts.en:
26-year-old José went to school through high school. He is not yet married, nor does he have any children. He lives with his mother, and she is the only one who depends on him economically.

For the past 6 years, José has made a living in the livestock business. He is a very hard-working young man. He learned his trade from his father, who has been a good example for him. The place where José works is located 5 km [about 3 miles] from his house, and he goes on foot because there is no access to transportation.

He is requesting this loan to buy some small calves, as they are being offered at a good price.

His dream is to be a good rancher and to give his children a good example one day, when he is the father of a family.

loans.use: to buy some small calves, as they are being offered at a good price

loans.name: Anlly Shirley

texts.es:
Anlly es una joven de admirar a sus 23 años de edad constituyo una distribuidora de bebidas y snack al por mayor, un logro muy importante de su vida ya que le permitió obtener la libertad financiera, es una joven muy perseverante que lucha por lograr cumplir sus sueños, su más grande deseo, comprar una vivienda para vivir con su padres cómodamente, una vivienda fruto de su esfuerzo y dedicación.
Anlly se encuentra buscando un apoyo para mejorar sus ventas, incrementar su utilidad y llegar a más clientes, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para aumentar su cantidad de inventario de licores, cervezas, dulces, chocolates, productos fritos en bolsa en gran parte para atender la gran demanda que se genera en fin de año.
texts.en:
Anlly is a young woman to be admired. At 23 years old she has set up a distributorship of drinks and snacks in bulk, a very important success that has allowed her to attain financial independence. She is a very persevering young woman who fights to realize her dreams. 

Her biggest dream is to buy a house where she and her parents can live comfortably, a home that she has earned through work and dedication. 

Anlly is looking for help in order to improve her sales, increase profits, and reach more clients. For this reason she is requesting a loan to increase the volume of her inventory of liquors, beers, candy, chocolates and packaged fried products, mostly to meet the high demand generated at the end of the year.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of liquors, beers, candy, chocolates and packaged fried products, mostly to meet the high demand generated at the end of the year.

loans.name: Rosa Haydee

texts.es:
Rosa, de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, juntos tienen dos hijos.

Rosa, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, pero aparte de eso tiene 3 peceras con tilapias y junto a su esposo le dan mantenimiento a las peceras, ella aprendió acerca de este oficio porque su padre también trabajaba de la misma manera y decidió dedicarse a ello porque es un negocio rentable.

Rosa, necesita el préstamo para comprar cinco quintales de alimento concentrado para peces y para comprar más plástico, para poder cambiárselo a las peceras. 

Rosa, sueña con que su negocio vaya creciendo y poder construir nuevas peceras y poder vender los pescados en otros lugares.
texts.en:
Rosa is 39 years old and has a 6th grade education, she's married and her husband works in agriculture and cattle-raising. They have two children together.

Rosa works as a homemaker but on the side she has 3 fish tanks of tilapia that she maintains with her husband. She learned about this trade because her father also did the same work and she decided to take it up because it's a profitable business.

Rosa needs a loan to purchase five hundred pounds of concentrated feed for fish, and to buy more plastic to replace it in the fish tanks. She dreams of expanding her business and being able to build new tanks and selling fish in other places.

loans.use: To purchase five hundred pounds of concentrated feed for fish and to purchase more plastic to replace it in the fish tanks.

loans.name: Fanny Esmeris

texts.es:
Ella es Fanny es una madre cabeza de familia de 39 años de edad la cual se encuentra solicitando tu apoyo para comprar una mercancía de calzado para vender en la temporada de fin de año.
Ella es una mujer que quiere brindar una feliz navidad a su familia tiene dos hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad, el préstamo no solo ayudara a tener una actividad económica para generar recursos con los que mantiene a su familia, será una oportunidad de trabajo, de mejora de ingresos, ella solo tiene sus manos para salir adelante y con esas manos quiere construir un futuro próspero para sus amadas criaturas.
El dinero será destinado en calzado para hombre y mujer los cuales comercializara en almacenes de veredas y pueblos.
texts.en:
Fanny is a 39-year-old mother and head of the family. She is requesting your support to buy shoe merchandise to sell during the end-of-year season.

She is a woman who wants to give her family a merry Christmas. She has two children who are 5 and 3 years old. The loan will help her have a business to generate income to maintain her family, and it will also be a work opportunity, an improvement of income. She has only her hands to use to get ahead, and with those hands, she wants to build a prosperous future for her beloved little ones.

The money will be used for men's and women's shoes, which she will sell at town and sidewalk markets.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's shoes, which she will sell at town and sidewalk markets.

loans.name: Adzo Jeanne

texts.fr: Adzo est une femme âgée de 53 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Mariée et mère de d’un enfant, Adzo est une marchande de «  pure water », du jus, de la farine de manioc, du sucre et autres en gros et en détail qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Adzo désire ce crédit pour financer son achat de sachets d’eau «  pure water » en gros, des sacs de farine de manioc et des bols de sucre en vue de bien revendre et de tirer profit afin de gagner plus de revenus et pouvoir mieux contribuer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en: Adzo is a 53-year-old woman who lives in Tokoin. The married mother of one child, she is a merchant of “pure water”, juice drinks, cassava flour, sugar, and other wholesale and retail items, which are supplied once a month from the market. She resells the merchandise in front of her home. Adzo would like to have this loan to finance her purchase of pouches of “pure water” in bulk; sacks of cassava flour; and bowls of sugar with the aim of doing well in her sales and deriving a profit, so as to earn more income and to do better at covering family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase 100 pouches of Pure water, 2 sacks of cassava flour, and 16 bowls of sugar

loans.name: Sadya

texts.fr: Sadya est une femme mariée âgée de 53 ans résidante à Tokoin. Avec deux enfants à charge, Sadya est une revendeuse des tubercules d’ignames et de l’huile végétale  qu’elle s’approvisionne sept fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Sadya désire ce prêt pour commander la calebasse de tubercules d’ignames et le bidon d’huile végétale. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera suite à une bonne revente, Sadya compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et celui de ses enfants puis à leur épanouissement.
texts.en: Sadya is a married woman, 53 years old, residing in Tokoin. With two children to support, she is a retailer of yam tubers and vegetable oil, which are supplied seven times a month from the market. She resells in front of her home. Sadya would like to have this loan to order a calabash of yam tubers and a container of vegetable oil. With the resulting profits from her sales, she plans on improving her offerings and meeting her day-to-day needs and those of her children, so that they may thrive.

loans.use: to purchase a calabash of yams and a container of oil

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Bertha, who is in her mid-fifties, is married with six children, all of whom are going to school. She has been running a retail shop for seventeen years now and makes a fair monthly profit working from 7:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily.

This will be Bertha's eleventh loan from Kiva's field partner Tujijenge Tanzania, this time for 2,000,000 TZS. She used the previous loans to increase her shop’s inventory and has managed to pay back all of her loans successfully. She used her profits not only to repay the loan but to pay school fees, buy a plot of land and start building a house, plus purchase a TV set, a sofa set and cupboards. In addition, her profits have been used to cover daily household expenses.

Bertha will use this loan to buy the fast-moving inventory in her retail shop. She dreams of finishing building her house.

loans.use: to restock the fast-moving inventory in her retail shop.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor con 67 años de edad, de estado civil separada, vive en el distrito de Pomahuaca,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de arroz, con más de 20 años de experiencia en el rubro. Solicita préstamo para gastos de abono y mantenimiento de su cultivo de arroz. De esta manera podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptable para mejorar su calidad de vida.

Flor es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Flor, 67 years old, is separated. She lives in the district of Pomahuaca, Jaén Provice, department of Cajamarca, in the country of Peru. She has very good personal as well as work references in part from the residents of the zone.

The people from this town are devoted mostly to agriculture, trade, and livestock. 

She earns a living through agriculture, specifically cultivating rice, with more than 20 years of experience in the sector. She requests the loan for fertilizer expenses and maintenance of rice cultivation. This way she will obtain a decent profit to improve her quality of life.

Flor is a recurring member of Edpyme Alternativa [Alternative Edpyme].

loans.use: for fertilizer expenses and maintenance of rice cultivation.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en: Manuel is a hardworking father. He is 33 years old, married and blessed with three children. His wife stays at home to take care of their children. He has been selling fish balls and other street foods for seven years. Manuel would like to increase the amount of fish balls, fried squid and other street foods he offers but his capital is not sufficient. With regards to this matter, he is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000. He hopes to avail of this loan amount to keep his business profitable.

loans.use: to buy fish balls, calamari and other street foods to sell.

loans.name: María Petronila

texts.es:
María de 43 años de edad, estudió hasta el tercer grado en su comunidad, no pudo continuar con sus estudios debido a los problemas que afrontó el país en esa época a causa de la guerra civil, se acompañó hace 16 años, es madre de cuatro hijos (tres hembras y un varón) tres de los cuales estudian en el nivel básico en la comunidad y uno trabaja en un taller de carpintería que tiene su cuñado. 


María se dedica a la siembra de cultivos de maíz y frijoles, actualmente tiene una hectárea de maíz y media de frijoles, debe de estar pendiente todos los días de la semana de sus cultivos para lo cual por las tardes la acompaña su hijo y su hija mayor. Anteriormente, trabajó por ocho años en una tienda que estaba en la hacienda donde cultivan café en las montañas de la comunidad.


Ella solicita este crédito para comprar 200 pollos de engorde y concentrado para su alimentación.

María sueña con que sus hijos sigan estudiando, por lo tanto se está esforzando con su esposo para apoyar a sus hijos a que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old and obtained a 3rd grade education in her community. She wasn't able to continue with her studies due to her problems her country faced in that era because of the civil war. 16 years ago she started her relationship and she's the mother of four children (three girls and a boy), three of whom are in elementary school in the community and one works at a carpentry shop owned by her brother-in-law.

Maria plants corn and beans for a living, and she currently has a hectare of corn and half a hectare of beans. She has to be vigilant every day with her crops and so every afternoon she goes with her son and elder daughter to check on them. Previously she worked for eight years at a store located in the coffee plantation in the local mountains.

She's applying for a loan to purchase 200 chicks to fatten, and feed for them to eat. Maria's dream is for her kids to continue with their education, and to that end she and her husband are striving to support their children so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: To purchase 200 chicks to fatten, and feed for them to eat.

loans.name: Oscar Osiris

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero y vive en la comunidad donde creció a lado de su madre pues fue ella quien siempre lo motivó a seguir adelante y gracias a ese esfuerzo logró estudiar hasta bachillerato, de él depende su madre y un hermano a quien apoya en los estudios actualmente.


Oscar se dedica al comercio, pues tiene una pequeña tienda el cual inició hace tres años en la comunidad gracias a la  motivación de su madre  y además tiene un molino que pone a disposición de los demás.

Él necesita este crédito para comprar azúcar, arroz, frijoles, maíz, aceite, leche, café, sal, huevos y otros productos de la canasta básica para aumentar su mercadería.

Oscar sueña con incrementar su inventario en el negocio pues le es rentable y tiene muchos clientes en la comunidad lo que le permite pensar en el futuro donde les puede ofrecer mucho mas variedad de productos de la canasta básica.
texts.en:
Oscar is 27 years old, single, and lives along with his mother in the community where he was born. His mother has always been the one to motivate him to move forward. Thanks to this strength, he was able to study through high school. His mother depends on him, as well as his brother, whose studies he currently pays for. 

Oscar works in business. He has a small store, which he started three years ago in his community, thanks to the motivation of his mother. He also has a mill which he makes available for others to use. 

He needs this loan to purchase sugar, rice, beans, corn, oil, milk, coffee, salt, eggs and other staples in order to augment his merchandise. 

Oscar dreams of increasing his business' inventory since it is profitable and he has many customers in the community. This allows his to think of a future in which he can offer a much greater variety of staples.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, beans, corn, oil, milk, coffee, salt, eggs and other staples to augment his merchandise.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is 51 years old, married and has two grown-up children. He and his wife farm to earn an income. They hire additional laborers, too.

Romeo is now asking for a loan of 40,000 PHP through Kiva's field partner ASKI to invest in his farm. He will buy fertilizers and insecticides and pay for labor on his fields. He promises to pay back his loan in full, continue improving his profits and save funds for emergency needs.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and insecticides and pay for labor on his fields.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is 35 years old and married with four children. With four children in school, Lita works very hard to provide for them.

Lita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell, like condiments and other groceries.

Lita has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soap, junk foods, coffee, biscuits, candies, etc.

In the future, Lita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
