La A.C. “GOTITAS DE CRISTAL” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Naide es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, venta de ropa, tienda de carnicería, venta de comida, venta de mantas de vicuña, venta de chamarras, venta de edredones.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Naide es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de edredones; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió con el apoyo de su hermana hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de edredones por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención al cliente que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Gotitas de Cristal" ("Glass Drops") group are in their first loan cycle with the Pro Mujer Foundation, part of the Centro Focal German Busch. The group, which is led by Naide, has eight members, and their businesses include: vegetable sales, clothing sales, a butcher's, food sales, the sale of vicuña wool blankets, jacket sales, and quilt sales.

The loan will benefit this group of small business owners of which Naide is a member. She comments that it is the first time that that the Pro Mujer Foundation has been involved, thanks to an evaluation by a member of the Foundation's team.

Naide has a business selling quilts, which she has been doing for some years with the support of her sister. She will use the loan in order to increase her capital and purchase quilts in bulk, which she will buy from wholesalers in La Paz and then offer them for sale. She is married and has two children, and this business allows her to support her family.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she appreciates the customer service that they provide.

loans.use: to buy quilts in bulk.

loans.name: Mujeres Artesanas Tzanyuju Group

texts.es:
María Mercedes es una joven de 19 años de edad, es soltera con una linda familia de un hijo de 4 años, ellos viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
María para generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, este negocio lo tiene ella desde hace 4 años,  pero para mejorar sus ingresos se dedica también a la venta de refacciones por las calles principales de su comunidad.
María con el afán  de mejorar su servicio hacia sus clientes ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de una variedad de estilos y precios de cortes, pues con la época de fin de año la demanda de ropa incrementa.
María y su grupo tienen las esperanzas de conseguir este préstamo para superarse en su negocio, y cambiar sus vidas.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes is a 19 year-old young woman, she is single with a beautiful four-year-old son. She lives in a community in Solola.
To generate income and support her family, she buys traditional clothing for resale. She has had this business for four years, but to increase her income she also sells spare parts along her town's busiest streets.
In order to improve her customer service, she has decided to request a loan that she will invest in purchasing a variety of textiles of different styles and price points, since the demand for clothing increases at the end of the year.
Maria and her group hope to obtain this loan to improve their business, and change their lives.

loans.use: to buy traditional textiles for their business.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es: Mari de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijo, ella posee una pequeña tienda desde hace 2 años ubicada en su lugar de residencia vende una variedad de productos como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mari, aged 47, lives in her own home with her husband and their children. She has run a small store from her home for the last two years and sells a variety of products, including candy, sodas, basic grains, coffee, soup, eggs and sugar, etc. She has plenty of customers, thanks to her reasonable prices.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies in bulk, as her store provides her only source of income, and in this way she can increase her earnings and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy candy, sodas, basic grains, coffee, soup, eggs, sugar, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: 17 De Agosto Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “17 DE AGOSTO” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Yola es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de jugos y refrescos, venta de colchones, tienda de barrio, venta de artesanías en madera, venta de cascabeles, venta de varillas, venta de cemento.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Yola es integrante, ella indica que integra Pro Mujer por la invitación de su vecina que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de jugos de frutas y refrescos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años por iniciativa propia; en la actualidad quien le ayuda en su negocio es su hija.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de azúcar por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración comercializará en su kiosco. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
17 de Agosto Communal Bank will start its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes regional office. The bank is made up of eight members governed by a board of directors of which Yola is the president. The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses, including juice and soft drink sales, mattress sales, a neighborhood store, wood craft sales, bell sales, wooden rod sales, and cement sales.

The loan they're getting will benefit small business entrepreneurs like Yola. She said she joined Pro Mujer on the invitation of a neighbor who's a client of the institution. Currently she sells fruit juice and soft drinks, a business she said she learned several years ago on her own initiative. Her daughter helps her at the moment.

The loan Yola's getting will be to increase her capital with a wholesale purchase of sugar, which she'll get from wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto then sell in her kiosk after production. This job allows her to earn an income to support her family financially, because she's in a common-law marriage and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says the trainings and the health programs the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy sugar wholesale

loans.name: Suha

texts.en:
Suha is a 38-year-old, Married woman from Khan Yata, Hebron. She lives with her family in a small, old house where she is the only breadwinner for her family. Suha has a store for selling brides dresses in the city. It is a good business and provides her with a good income, but the economic situation in Hebron is bad because of the latest conflict.

Suha took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help her to buy a new collection of brides dresses to sell at her store. She hopes that this new inventory will enable her to increase her sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to cover school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of brides dresses to sell at her store.

loans.name: Ronan

texts.en:
Ronan is a mother of two and operating a small variety store in their humble home in Quezon City. Her husband, Jerry, makes a living from his tricycle that transport passengers in their community. They are helping each other to sustain the everyday needs of the family.

Now that Ronan continues to develop her variety store business, she applies for PHP 20,000 loan to buy additional dry goods, beverages, and sacks of rice. She anticipates an increase in her sales and profit from these additional supplies. She hopes that all their income generating ventures will pave the way to the completion of her children’s education and a more comfortable life in the future. 

Ronan is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional dry goods, beverages, and sacks of rice to restock her store.

loans.name: Ashur

texts.en:
This peaceful man is Ashur. He lives with his family in the Shahrituz. Ashur has grown crops for twenty years - more than half his life. He loves his work, because it brings him a good profit. Ashur is known as the best plant breeder in his city. People come to him for advice, and want to know how he receives such a rich harvest every year.

This season Ashur also planted crops, however he did not have enough funds to buy mineral fertilizers. He is applying for a loan and greatly hopes that he will receive a good harvest as usual.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers for his plants.
